loans.name: Maria Graciela Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda makes a living through catalogue sales in her community of El Seco in Puebla. Her income represents a big part of the family's income, with her work allowing them to have a better life. Yolanda lives with her husband and the family of one of her sons. Where they live is a little crowded, and they are trying to look for alternatives especially now that a new grandchild is on the way.

Yolanda has the opportunity to start building a new home, a small house where she can move with her husband which will allow their son to live at their old place with his growing family. To Yolanda, this credit is important as it is the only way she can start the construction. She will receive technical assistance and supervision to ensure that the construction is done correctly and meets all the required safety and quality standards.

Yolanda sees this not only as an opportunity for her grandchildren but also as an opportunity to build a house where she can grow old because, unlike her current house, it has no stairs and other non-appropriate features.

loans.use: to start building a house in which she can grow old with her husband.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus, age 40, is married and they are blessed with three children. He has owned and managed a motorcycle transport business in their village for almost 6 months and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily.

They also have a retail store to generate additional income. Due to insufficient capital for his business he would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle and to purchase additional grocery items to sell. He's hoping that his businesses will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle and to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela owns a rice paddy. She grows and sells rice, which serves as the family's main source of income. She is a widow woman and has three grown children.

For a quite period of time, she has been selling rice to the locals in her place. She would like to enhance the yield of her farm to become more stable.

Adela has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides. She could start to maximize the farm's resources and augment her income soon.

She dreams of having a small business that could be relied upon to support her family in the future. Adela is thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a 44-year-old married woman with 3 children residing at Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Alona operates a small sari-sari store and her husband is a farmer and raises pigs. She has used her income to successfully repay a previous loan she used to buy feed for her animals.

She is always looking for ways to provide a better living to her three children, and is requesting a new loan to buy additional home products to sell in the village. Alona's future plan is to expand her business and help her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stock items.

loans.name: Analotis

texts.en:
Analotis is a single woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analotis is 35 years old and has one child still in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Analotis has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is a 62-year-old married woman with 8 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and chips in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Lupe has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour,a fry pan, and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.

Lupe hopes to extend her business and to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, and a fry pan.

loans.name: Utagamamao

texts.en:
Utagamamao is a 44-year-old single woman with 1 child. She runs a business designing clothes. She has 3 years of experience and requests a loan to buy paints, sponges, brushes, a design board, and material.

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, sponges, brushes, a design board, and material.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en: Soledad is a 56-year-old married woman with two adult children. Soledad owns and operates a business providing motor transportation services. She has been engaged in this business for many years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Soledad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Soledad is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle's engine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. In the future Soledad wish to expand her transportation services.

loans.use: to pay for engine repair and maintenance.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita lives a simple life with her family in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 49 years old and a mother of five children; two adults and three dependents who are still in college.

Her husband supports them by selling his catch; specifically her husband is a fisherman while Juanita has a tailoring business. She has been doing this for five years to earn a living and to support her husband in providing their children’s needs.

Juanita’s main goal in life is to improve their livelihood to have enough money for their children. She wants them to finish their studies. That is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the money to pay her children’s tuition fees (school fees). Aside from this, she will also buy additional fresh fish to sell and tailoring materials such as thread and cloth.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials such as thread and cloth, to buy fresh fish, and to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married and a 41-year-old mother of two children residing in Misamis Occidental. She helps her husband work on their own farm to make a living. Her husband also has a part time job as a baker in a bakery in town.

Marife had joined Gata Daku MPC recently and took a new loan to buy a new variety of seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost her garden.

She wants to improve their farm and is determined to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost her garden.

loans.name: Hirminia María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jocay se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Hirminia, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5  años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Hirminia es una mujer que le gusta colaborar con algo y así facilitar el trabajo de su marido, es por eso que ella realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su labor, el se dedica al comercio, el  tiene dos locales en el mercado en Tarqui, allí vende frutas,  legumbres, verduras y otros víveres primarios, le gusta tener muy bien surtidos sus locales con frutas frescas ya que esto es lo que siempre le ha generado mejor clientela,  trabaja todos los días en ocasiones ella le ayuda más en fines de semana que s cuando mas ventas hay, lleva más de 11 años con este negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son que nunca les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group "Jocay" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches, which are busy throughout the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this places lives Hirminia. She is 29 years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which she has two children, who are 10 and 5 years old and both attend school. Her spouse is a merchant.

Hirminia is a woman who likes to contribute in some way in order to facilitate her husband's job. That's why she is taking out a loan in order for him to use it in his work. He earns his living in commerce. He has two shops in the market in Tarqui where he sells fruits, vegetables, greens, and other staple groceries. He likes to have his shops very well stocked with fresh fruits, which is what has always generated a better clientele for him. He works every day. Hirminia sometimes helps him, mostly on weekends, which is when there is more business. He has had this business for more than 11 years, which allows him to make a living.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables. Hirminia has been in the credit group for two lending cycles and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is for her family to never be in need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 16 Group

texts.en: Thuong is a  married 45-year-old Thai ethnic woman with two sons. She and her husband work very hard at farming and animal breeding.  They grow rice and raise pigs, chickens, ducks, and fish. Her oldest son is 20 years old and stays at home to support her business. The other son is 17 years old and studies at grade 11. She doesn't want her second son's education to be interrupted so she has tried hard to increase production and improve her income. This is the fifth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. She hopes that with the agricultural training and counseling provided by the program's staff, her business will go well and be profitable. Thuong wants a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Zuleyka Lisbeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jocay se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Zuleyka, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años  de edad. Su esposo es maestro coloca cerámica.
Zuleyka es una joven  mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios ingresos gracias a su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida,  prepara almuerzos para  entregar a personas que le piden los almuerzos y ella les envía a sus domicilios o lugares de trabajo,  esto lo realiza de lunes a viernes, lleva 2 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos, lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella, sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group "Jocay" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches, which are busy throughout the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

In this places lives Señora Zuleyka. She is 20 years old and married. From that relationship, she has a two-year-old son. Her husband is a master tile setter.

Zuleyka is a very determined young woman who likes to be self-sufficient and earn her own income thanks to her work. She has a food-sales business. She prepares lunches to bring to people who order them, and she delivers to residences and workplaces. She does this Monday through Friday. She has run this business for two years and it gives her a very good income.

This loan is to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing the foods. She has been in the credit group for three lending cycles and she likes it because the loans are very helpful for her. Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Saelua

texts.en:
Saelua is a 59-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has run a small business selling chicken & chips for 2 years. Saelua requests a loan to buy boxes of chicken, cooking oil, and sacks of fries.

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Saelua will increase her standard of living and to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, cooking oil, sack of fries, and salt.

loans.name: Noema

texts.en:
Noema is 58-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has run a small business selling ice cakes for 3 years.

Noema requests a loan to buy plastic cups, sugar, Chinese lollies, and tang. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Noema hopes to buy a new freezer for her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, sugar, chinese lolly, and tang.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 36 years old and she is from from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mar, a tricycle driver, and they have one High School child and three Elementary School children.

Although the majority of Filipino families struggle to make ends meet, the parents do their best to provide for their children, including a good education. It is their hope and their path to improve their lives.

For the last two years Rona has derived her income from her small general store and a tricycle service. She is humbly asking for a Php 15,000 loan to refill her store with essential food items, such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages and toiletries, to sell at retail prices.

She trusts that out of your good heart she will receive the financial aid she needs for her livelihood. Rona dreams that someday she will own a bigger grocery store to complete the payments on her house and lot.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy food items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, 60 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a dried fish processing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and salt for her dried fish business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and salt to dry fish for her dried fish sales business.

loans.name: Sumira

texts.en:
Sumira is a 33-year-old woman. Her husband earns a very low income by providing shelter for under construction houses. He builds temporary shelters with the help of bamboo and wooden planks to support concrete mixtures for two weeks. He does contract work and that is hard to come by.


Recently her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Sumira has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy wooden planks, bamboo, and nails to provide his best services.

Sumira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan, she is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her by granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy  wooden planks, bamboo, and nails for her husband's business.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres llamado 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 4to  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y lo hace por medio de su confitería.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con su repostería, como ser dulces, azúcar, harina, manteca, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
8 de Diciembre group is on its 4th cycle of the women's committee program, where they participate in the elimination of poverty program, fighting to improve their quality of life.
One of its members is Rosa, is slowly getting out of poverty, but she is fully aware that this work and effort that she is putting into this has to be steady, and so she runs a candy store.
She is asking for this loan to buy baking supplies such as sweets, sugar, flour, butter and others so she can keep up with her sales the same way she's been doing so. She is thankful for the opportunity she's been given to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy store supplies such as sweets, sugar, flour, butter and others

loans.name: Dayce Aguedita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jocay se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dayce, tiene  53  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo, el cual ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada. Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza.
Dayce es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos, para esto ella se dedica a varias actividades,  tiene un salón de belleza en su casa, allí realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, ella también en su salón vende tratamientos, ropa, productos Belcorp, Yanbal(productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  y otros artículos de catálogos, allí tiene unas vitrinas en las que exhibe sus prendas y productos a sus clientes, lleva más de 21  años con esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo pensando siempre en mejorar el porvenir de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa, esmaltes, tintes, perfumes, cremas y tratamientos de belleza. Lleva 12 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Su sueño es seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The lending group "Jocay" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches, which are busy throughout the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Señora Dayce. She is 53 years old and married. From this relationship, she has one son who is already an adult and independent. Her husband works in a private company. She learned beauty several years ago.

Dayce is a woman who has always liked to work and earn her own resources. For that reason, she works at various activities. She has a beauty salon in her house where she does a variety of jobs like hair color, hair cuts, nails, and other things. In her salon, she also sells treatments, clothing, Belcorp and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories), and other products from catalogs. She has display cases with which she exhibits her garments and products to her customers. She has had this business for more than 21 years, and she earns her living, always thinking of improving her family's future.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing, nail polishes, dyes, perfumes, creams, and beauty treatments. She has been in the credit group for 12 years and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her. Her dream is to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, nail polishes, dyes, perfumes, creams, and beauty treatments.

loans.name: Vian John

texts.en:
Vian John is a 43-year-old married man with 4 adult children who lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Vian John owns and operates a motor-cab transportation service. He has done this business for many years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Vian John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vian John requests a new loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle and provide better service. He plans to buy a new motor in the future.

loans.use: to repair a motor.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
0 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y sacrificadas que luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante.
Benicia se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y por medio de su negocio tiene los medios para poder darle una vida digna a su familia y que no les falte nada. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas variadas para la venta, y así seguir luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Many women are members this group, hardworking, fighting, self-sacrificing women who struggle to be able to improve their quality of life. They are participating in the elimination of poverty program, making a huge effort to grow and get ahead.
Benicia sells all kinds of drinks. The business allows her to provide her family with a comfortable life where they have everything they need. She is thankful for this opportunity to grow and get ahead.
She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of beverages to resell and keep growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to resell.

loans.name: Mercedes Lucciola

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es maestro pintor. Ella hace años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios ingresos y así  ayudar a su marido a salir adelante, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella cose ropa de preferencia ropa de mujer y de niños, en ocasiones también confecciona uniformes ya sea para instituciones educativas o de empresas, lleva más de 40 años dedicada a su labor razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden sus trabajos . 
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas y otros materiales para la  costura. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ellos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Credit Group La 24 meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round and for being a city with unrivaled beauty and many tourist attractions. 

Mercedes, who is 65 years old and married, with three grown and independent kids, lives in Manta. Her husband is a master painter. Years ago she learned tailoring at an academy in the city.

Mercedes is a woman who likes to earn her own income and help her husband continue forward, she has a small sewing workshop, there she sews clothes, preferably women's and children's clothes, and on occasions she also sews uniforms for educational institutions or businesses, she's spent more than 40 years dedicated to this work, the reason why she has very good clientele that always buy her clothes. 

This loan will be used to buy yarn, fabric and other materials for sewing. She's been through two cycles in the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans are a great help to them. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: To buy yarn, fabric and other materials for sewing

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a 44-year-old married woman with four school-aged children who is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Charito has had a dried fish business for 15 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish and salt for her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish and salt for her dried fish business

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jocay se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene  46 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ambos mayores de edad, una de ellos  estudian en Universidad y es la que aun vive con ella.
Sonia es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro y así sacar adelante  sola a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, también en su casa realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras con lo cual se gana algo extra, ella ciertos días sale a vender puerta a puerta ya que la mayoría de sus ventas ella las realiza en su casa y solo sale cuando la llaman sus clientes, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que ella les da muchas facilidades de pagos a sus clientes, lleva más de 13  años en este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatillas, camisas, pantalones, ropa de niños y recargas telefónicas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The lending group "Jocay" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches, which are busy throughout the year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Señora Sonia. She is 46 years old and divorced. From that relationship, she has two children who are both adults. One of them is studying in the university and still lives with her.

Sonia is a woman who has had to work hard to provide for her children by herself. She earns her living selling all kinds of clothing and shoes. In addition, she sells prepaid mobile phone minutes from various providers to earn herself a bit extra. Certain days, she goes out selling door-to-door, but she does the majority of her selling at her house and only goes out when her customers call her. Her sales are good since she gives her customers lots of ways to pay. She has had this business for more than 13 years, which has allowed her to support herself.

She is going to use this loan to buy athletic shoes, shirts, pants, children's clothes, and prepaid mobile phone cards. She has been in the credit group since it started, and she likes it because she is able to stock up her business with the loans. Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes, shirts, pants, children's clothes, and prepaid mobile phone minutes.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Corazón de Jesús está en su 5to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luz quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos para una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera, toallas y otras prendas para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Corazón de Jesús group is on its 5th cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help one another to succeed. 
One of its members, Luz is slowly getting out of poverty thanks to her steady work and by applying the different essential techniques she's learned to be a successful woman.
She sells all kinds of clothes and through her sales she's able to help her loved one to have a decent life without the hardships she had to go through.
She is asking for this loan to invest in tee shirts, shorts, pants, skirts, towels and other items to resell. She is thankful for this opportunity she's been given to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell such as tee shirts, shorts, pants, skirts, towels and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Del Parque Industrial Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado de 17 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Flora, quien tiene una Pollería, se destaca ella por ser una mujer muy sacrificada, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. La Sra. Flora pide este préstamo para la compra de productos como pollos y también quiere adquirir una parrilla para poder vender pollos de otra variedad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 17 women, all of whom are very hard working and self-sacrificing, they are in the poverty elimination program, where each and every one of them gives all their effort to be able to grow and move forward. 

One of the members is Mrs. Flora, who has a chicken shop, and stands out for being a very self-sacrificing woman, who with effort and sacrifice is moving forward. Mrs. Flora is asking for this loan to buy products, such as chickens, and also to get a grill so she can sell grilled chicken. She is very thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and move forward.

loans.use: To buy wholesale chickens and a grill

loans.name: Ieva

texts.en:
Ieva is from Beregovo. It's a small Ukrainian town bordering Hungary that has always been an intersection of cultures, languages and trades. Ieva earns her living working at a small shop at the Ukrainian-Hungarian border selling souvenirs, office supplies, cleaning supplies, etc. She is 42, divorced with a 22-year-old daughter.

Ieva is hoping to invest 35 000 Grivnyas in improvement of her living conditions. Ieva's daughter got married recently and a young family is planning to have children. Both families are now sharing a simple single-floor house. Therefore, Ieva is planning to expand her living floor space to have comfortable living conditions for her daughter's new family and herself. Being a single parent, Ieva learned to rely only on herself providing for her daughter and creating comfortable living conditions for their family.

loans.use: to expand her living floor space

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en:
Huseyin is 20 years old. He was born in Imishli region. He has a family of parents living in Imishli and has 2 very young brothers. Huseyin is a student of Engineering at university and is in his second year. His family loves him a lot and they want him to pursue his career in urban place and be a contributing person to rural area hometown. Like many people who are studying from rural areas in Baku, he also has target to be successful and achieve great results in life. He is enthusiastic about studies. He finds life hard in Baku, such as dynamic and full of opportunities. Huseyin has a target in life and that is to become a great civic engineer. He knows that it a great target and to reach it requires constant effort and hard labor. He is not afraid of difficulties and studies hard and fights for his principles in life.

He is believed that to become a great engineer for his ability to work with numbers. He is taking his studies on this subject very seriously and also has great ambition. Huseyin understands that being educated he can help the rural area people and his own society greatly. He tries his best for this purpose. Currently due to family's difficulty he needs 1800 AZN. This amount he will use for paying the tuition fees. He is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: paying his university tuition fees in Civil Engineering

loans.name: Thanh Yen 14 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen, 40, is Thai ethnic single mom who has a daughter at the age of 11. She lives with her daughter in a small house and works at agricultural production to earn a living with several activities such as growing rice, raising cow, duck and chicken. She has been recognized by the government for her poverty.

Despite her poverty, she has still tried hard to send her daughter to school fully so that the girl could receive good education and have a brighter future. To cope with the difficulty of her family and the instability of income from agriculture, Mrs. Yen has always wanted to increase production. This is the fifth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy ducks, chickens and food for them. She hopes that her investment will go well and help her reap good profit, so that she could provide better for her daughter. Mrs. Yen dreams that her family will soon escape from poverty and have good living standard, that her daughter will be successful in career and happy in life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy ducks, chickens and food for them

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has already used assistance from Kiva. She invested her received funds in development of her business increasing her income by 2 000 Grivnyas as a result. Moreover, Nataliya can now afford to invest more in her daughter's studies in college.

Nataliya is seeking 40 000 Grivnyas this time to buy and install pre-ordered forged gate along with the guard railing in the front yard. Good-looking fencing made of durable materials will give Nataliya's house a decent look, turning a house more into a real home.

loans.use: to buy and install a pre-ordered forged gate along with the guard railing in the front yard.

loans.name: Taufafo

texts.en: Taufafo is 67 years old and a widow with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pop-corn in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Taufafo has requested a loan to buy sack of corn, salt, cooking oil, pot etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taufafo will use to support her family financially and to save for a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, salt, cooking oil, pot etc….

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is 20 years old. Kanan was born in Imishli region and his family there - in the south part of the country. Kanan is a student of medicine at university and he has been studying for 2 years. Alongside his parents, he has two sisters. Being the only son and eldest child of the family his family has great expectations from him. They are proud that their son is studying in Baku, far away from home.

They believe that Kanan will be a successful doctor and make the whole country proud. He is very studious person. He prepares the lessons, homework timely and always gets good grades from lessons, mid-terms exams and finals. Kanan is the favorite student of many professors and they see in him potential to be a good doctor. Kanan is aware of Azerbaijan's demand for doctors and medical experts and he wants to contribute to country in future after graduation.

Kanan is facing financial difficulty. It has become difficult for his parents to pay tuition fees. So he needs 1600 AZN. This fund he will use for paying the tuition fees. He is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: pay his tuition fees in Medicine, in order to graduate as a doctor

loans.name: Dolores Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 12, 8 y 6 años, estudian dos en colegio  dos en la escuela. Su esposo es  empleado privado.
Dolores es una mujer que le gusta generar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar y los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos que para ella es lo más importante, para esto ella se dedica a la  venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale ciertos días de la semana en la mañana ya que a esta hora es más fresco, aunque más vende en su casa, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 5  años que lleva con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella mejora su vida. Sus sueños darles la mejor educación a su hijos.
texts.en:
The 24th Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty that has a lot of attractive tourists.

This is where Dolores lives. She is 32 years old. She is in a common law marriage and she has four children who are 17, 12, 8, and 6 years old. Two of them are in middle/high school and two of them are in elementary school. Her husband is a private employee.

Dolores is a woman who likes to generate her own income. She uses her income to help her husband support their home and to cover the expenses of her children's studies, which is the most important thing for her. To do this, she makes a living by selling all kinds of clothes. She sells door-to-door. She goes out certain days of the week in the morning, since at that time it's cooler out. However, she sells more in her house. She leaves her product on credit and charges for it each week. She has been in this line of work for 5 years, which allows her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and other garments. She has been in the Credit Group for two years and she likes it because, thanks to the credits, she improves her life. Her dream is to give better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and other garments.

loans.name: Mujeres De Padre Winkel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Padre Winkel está en su ciclo número 2 º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorarla.
Una de las integrantes es Liz quien se dedica a la venta de  Lencerías, también se debe destacar el trabajo de ella y su esfuerzo, quiere capacitarse para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencería de toda clase, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por poder salir adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group "Women of Father Winkel" is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, where they all are working on eliminating poverty. Some of them are living under the poverty level, that is to say in extreme poverty, and are struggling to improve.

One of the members is Liz, who makes her living selling women's underwear. Her work and effort should also be highlighted. She wants to enable herself to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy women's underwear of all kinds in order to be able to continue with her sales and putting forth effort to be able to get by. 

She appreciates the opportunity she has to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy varied Comprar lencería variada para la venta.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 5 años de edad la cual estudia en escuela. Su marido es albañil. 
Johanna es una mujer que  le gusta trabajar para así poder ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, para esto ella  se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días por semana y también vende en su casa, ella aprovecha la mañana cuando lleva a su hija a la escuela para vender su mercadería, deja a crédito y cobran cada 8 o 15 días dependiendo de sus clientes, lleva más de un  año que se dedica a esta actividad la cual la mejora con la ayuda de los créditos, razón por lo cual agradece a las personas que le ayudan para que pueda recibir el crédito.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The "21 De Octubre" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton, known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and for it's crafts. It is known nationally and internationally as the home of the famous Panama hat.

Johanna lives in this place. She is 21 years old, married and from this realtionship has a five year old daughter who goes to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Johanna is a woman who likes to work in order to help her husband get ahead with their household. So she works selling all types of clothing. Her method of selling is from door-to-door. She goes out three tines a week and also sells at her house. She takes advantage of the mornings when she takes her daughter to school to sell her merchandise. She leaves the goods on credit and collects every 8 or 15 days depending on the client. She has been doing this business for more than a year which she has improved with the help of the loans. For this reason she is grateful to the people who support her so that she can get a loan.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it as the loans allow her to get ahead.

Her dream is to provide her daughter with the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is the age of 46 living along with her six children in the industrial area of Lahore, Pakistan. It proved very difficult for her to raise her large population of children. Due to poor earnings she could not educate her children. Her elder son has been learning techniques regarding lathe and now become very expert. On the other hand her husband runs a fruit shop in nearby main market.

She has requested a Kiva loan for both of them, she will utilize partial amount for purchasing seasonal fruits and partially for purchasing lathe tools for her her son's turner business. So both can enhance their businesses and can generate income for whole family.
She hopes that this loan will bring positive changing in both businesses and now she can educate her younger children. She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for her husband and  for purchasing lathe tools for her son's turner work.

loans.name: Reinelda

texts.es:
Reinelda proviene de una familia humilde pero sacrificada que supo darle la ayuda en el momento que ella necesitaba. Estudia la carrera de nutrición, de manera a poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
Su meta a futuro es culminar su carrera y poder desempeñarse como profesional en el campo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Reinelda comes from a humble but selfless family that knew how to help her in the moment when she needed it. She studies nutrition, in order to be able to become a good professional. Her goal for the future is to finish her studies and to be able to become a professional in the labor market. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition fees, and to be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una socia trabajadora que continúa dedicándose a sus tres actividades económicas: La crianza de animales, elaboración de jora y a su tienda de abarrotes, negocios pequeños con la que ella desea salir adelante.
La socia quiere aprovechar fiestas de fin de año y ofrecer más productos en su tienda de abarrotes por eso solicito el crédito.
Aurelia necesita comprar galletas, cereales, leche y gaseosas. Con estos productos podrá llenar las necesidades de sus clientes.
La socia está contenta y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a hard-working member who continues to work her three jobs: raising animals, making jora (a popular corn beer in Peru), and running her grocery store. These are small businesses with which she hopes to move forward.

The member wants to take advantage of the end of year celebrations and offer more products in her grocery store, which is why she is applying for this loan.

Aurelia needs to buy cookies, cereal, milk, and soft drinks. With these products she will be able to fulfill the needs of her customers.

The member is happy and very grateful for the help she is receiving from KIVA's investors.

loans.use: to buy cookies, cereal, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, está cursando el primer  año de la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal. 
Ella es una persona que se esmera para poder mejorar sus condiciones de a través de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir esforzándose por sus metas.
texts.en: Yessica studies and works at the same time. She is in her first year of the Forestry Engineering program. She is a person who takes great pains to improve her situation through her studies. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in her university bills, and to be able to continue working towards her goals.

loans.use: to pay university bills.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mae has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and salt for her dried fish business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish and salt for her dried fish business.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Agustin está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se encuentran haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer su situación de vida, que les permitirá poder trabajar por crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien es modista, tiene un humilde taller en el que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y de esa forma puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo y también así cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Agustin group is in their second loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey as a means to understand their life situation which allows them to work in order to grow.

One of the members is Rosa, who is a dressmaker. She has a humble workshop where she works every day from a very early hour. She makes all kinds of clothing and in this way she has the means to be able to help her family. She is a very hard-working person and a fighter who wants to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic and others. In this way she can continue to make clothing as she has been doing and also be able to fill her clients orders.

loans.use: to buy  fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic and others to use to make clothing.

loans.name: William Ufredo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don William, tiene 31 años de edad, y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.
William es guardia de seguridad  y el realiza el crédito para que su mujer trabaje en el comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o cuando este mas desocupa, deja a crédito y cobra coda 8 días. Los créditos siempre les han ayudado ya que así la mujer puede ejercer una actividad que les genera ingresos por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos, sus sueños son que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 21 De Octubre (21st of October) Credit Group meets every two weeks in Montercristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are recognized at a national and international level. It's a place also known for its famous straw hats.

William, who is 31 years old, in a free union, and has a 6 year old and a 3 year old kid, the older of whom is in school, lives in this town. His woman is a trader. 

William is a security guard and he is taking out this loan for his woman's business, she sells clothing of all types, she sells her clothes door to door, she goes out every day in the mornings or when she is most unoccupied, selling products on credit and collecting each week. The loans have always helped them since they allow the woman to work in an activity that generates income for them and for the wellbeing of their family.

This loan is for buying pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has been in this loan group from its beginning and she likes the help that they provide through loans. Her dream is for her kids to never lack anything.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: San Antonio Potrerito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio Potrerito está en su primer  ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres, tiene 17 integrantes, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lisa, ella es vendedora ambulante de especias y remedios naturales, en la ciudad y también por otras compañías, lo cual hace de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere darle una mejor vida a su familia.
La Sra. Lisa solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales y especias y así poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio Potrerito group is in its first cycle of the program committee for women. It has 17 members, all of them part of the program to eliminate poverty who are fighting to improve their life conditions.
One of the members is Lisa. She sells natural remedies and spices in the city as a street vendor and door to door.
She is a very hardworking and perseverant woman that wants to give her family a better life.
Lisa is requesting a loan to buy natural remedies and spices and this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been to date. She is grateful for the opportunity that she got to be able to improve her life and the life of her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy natural remedies and spices for sale.

loans.name: Erika Ximena

texts.es:
El cantón se llama así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón.
En este lugar vive la señorita Erika,  tiene 21  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive casa de sus abuelitos.
Erika para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a sus abuelitos en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también por las mañanas cuida niños en la casa. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es terminar su carrera de enfermería y ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
The canton is named after the Virgen of Carmen. The canton has rich flora and fauna, and its main source of income is the cultivation of Barraganete bananas. Here lives Miss Erika, 21 years old and single with no children. She lives in the house of her grandparents.

To obtain her own resources and to help her grandparents with the living costs, she sells Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). In the mornings she also takes care of kids in the house. She works three days a week from two to three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and charges every eight days. For two years she has worked in this business and it is going well. The best-sellers are perfumes and cosmetics.

This loan is for purchasing purfumes, creams, cosmetic products, and underwear. This is the second loan cycle in the Grupo De Crédito and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to finish her courses in nursing and become a good professional.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo está en su ciclo 26, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que hace muchos ciclos viene trabajando juntas, ayudándose las unas a las otras, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Nilda, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes de todo tipo, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y gracias a ello tiene los medios para poder esforzarse y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder comprar perfumes variados para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is in its 26th loan cycle. They are very hard-working and persevering women who have been working together since many cycles ago, helping one another. They are all in the Program of Poverty Elimination, fighting to grow and continue forward.

One of the members is Ms. Nilda, who sells perfumes of all kinds for work. She comments that she has very good clientele who always places a lot of orders, and thanks to this she has the means to strengthen herself and give her family a better quality of life.

She is requesting this loan as she wants to buy various perfumes for sale and in this way continue with her sales as they come.

loans.use: buy various perfumes for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married with eight children, seven in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Marites has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Faatautau

texts.en:
Faatautau is 49 years old and a partner woman with 8 children. She has been running a small business selling pineapples, cabbages, pies and other items in her community for 3 years.

Faatautau has requested a loan to buy chemicals, seeds, spades, rakes etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faatautau will hope to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy spades, chemicals, rakes, seeds, fertilizer and other items to enhance her business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a married woman who lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a mother of three children; one adult and two-school-aged that need support. She helps to provide this support by selling dried fish to the community while her husband fishes.

Jesusa has been successfully selling dried fish for five years and wants to operate this business continuously. With this, she is asking for this loan to buy fresh fish to make more dried fish.

Jesusa’s ultimate goal in life is to enhance her families livelihood to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa trabaja dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes, y conforme a ello poder trabajar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Candida es una de las que integra este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y lucha por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa, como ser frutas, verduras, carne, panificados y otros productos, y así tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa group works within the poverty elimination program as a way to identify each group member's life situation and be able to work and improve her living conditions accordingly.

Candida is one of the group members. She has a small grocery store where she works every day starting bright and early. She is a very hardworking and selfless woman who wants to succeed and strives to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to stock her grocery store with items such as fruits, vegetables, meats, baked goods, and other products. This will allow her to offer a better variety to her customers and fulfill their requests.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock a small grocery store, such as: fruits, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and has five children. She is married and resides at Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental with her family. She joined GDMPC in 2014 and is borrowing this loan to purchase flour, sugar and materials needed for food vending. Her husband is a farmer and she is earning money from her vending business to earn more for their family.

She wants to own a stall where she can have more products to sell and have a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and materials needed for food vending

loans.name: Nancy Amarilis

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen es reconocido por sus platos típicos los bolones de queso, maní y chicharrón; el seco de gallina y “guanta”, animal que se cría en las montañas. Su variedad de cultivos: plátano barraganete de exportación, frutas tropicales (piñas, bananas, maracuyá, etc.)
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, 4 mayores de edad e independientes y un hijo de 8 años que estudia en escuela. El cónyuge es mecánico automotriz. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Nancy se dedica a la agricultura, siembra pimiento y verduras en la época invernal,  tienen una finca la cual esta preparando para sembrar pimiento, maracuyá, (cultivo corto) malanga que es de cultivo largo (10 meses), matas de plátanos,  ella se dedica a hacer la comida para los trabajadores mientras dura la cosecha. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar semillas  y fertilizantes para los cultivos.Ella es socia nueva aunque ya perteneció a otro grupo de crédito en otro lugar. Le gusta el grupo ya que ha hecho nuevas amigas. Su sueño es tener una muy buena cosecha y poder comprar un carro así podría distribuir ella mismo sus productos.
texts.en:
El Carmen Canton is known for its traditional food: cheese, peanut, and crackling "bolones" [dumplings]; chicken stew, and paca, an animal raised in the mountains. There's a variety of crops: the barraganete variety of plantain for export and tropical fruit (pineapple, banana, passion fruit, etc.).

This is where Nancy lives. She's 46 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has five children, four independent adults and an eight-year-old child who attends school. Her husband's an auto mechanic. They live in their own home.

Nancy earns a living in agriculture growing peppers and vegetables in the winter. They have a farm, which she's preparing for planting peppers, passion fruit (short-term crop), and malanga (long-term crop). She makes meals for the workers during the harvest.

She's going to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the crops.

She's a new member, although she already belonged to another communal bank elsewhere. She likes the group because she has made new friends.

Nancy's dream is to have a very good harvest and be able to buy a car so she can distribute her crops herself.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalene is a married woman and a mother of two school-aged children and one child who is not yet of school going age. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Magdalene has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar etc. from a shop to the residents. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from business personnel in the same business line. Magdalene dreams of opening another shop outlet in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stock of sugar, maize flour, salts etc.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, maize flour, salts etc.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Naome operates a grocery stall and sells at the market to the residents of that area. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from fellow business persons in the same area. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase more grocery items including vegetables, potatoes etc. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman and has been blessed with 6 children who have completed their education. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water.

For the past 20 years she has operated a farming business, selling from home to her local residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Her dreams are to adopt a modern method of farming that will yield more production.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase seeds and cultivate her farming land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and cultivate her farming land

loans.name: Joseph Hervé

texts.fr:
Joseph Hervé vous remercie pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé récemment. Ce prêt lui a permis d'acheter des ingrédients supplémentaires pour la fabrication des donates.
 Quand-même, le fonds a un peu diminué en raison de la couverture  des dépenses pour l’accouchement de sa femme. Elle a du subir une OC. Divers matériels pour l’activité ont été acquis (cuvette, balance, poêle).  Des efforts ont été réalisés dans l’acquisition de matériels.  Cette demande de prêts  est une demande de fonds de roulement  car les commandes reçues augmentent. Le couple prévoit de développer l’activité, acquérir un vélo pour la livraison des produits.
texts.en:
Joseph Hervé thanks you for the loan you granted him recently. This loan enabled him to purchase extra ingredients for making “donates” [perhaps doughnuts]. Even so, funds have diminished somewhat due to expenses for his wife giving birth. She had to undergo an operation.

Various business supplies have been acquired (basin, balance, stove). Effort was expended to acquire the equipment. This loan application is for working capital, since special orders are on the rise. The couple plan to develop the business and acquire a bicycle to deliver the products.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of flour, two bags of sugar, and three dozen eggs.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products.

Marlyn has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: María Armendina

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen se destaca por la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz, palmito y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral.
En este lugar vive la señora María tiene 66  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor. Viven en una finca de su propiedad.
Doña María realiza el crédito para ella y su esposo, él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra plátanos, mandarinas, limones, naranjas y verduras en la época invernal, pero ellos también juntos tienen un negocio de venta de animales como cerdos, pollos, ganado vacuno, que crían y venden por libras a personas que llegan a la finca o también venden a tiendas, los fines de semana venden estos productos porque es cuando más gente llega al lugar y sus ventas son mejores, el resto de la semana él se dedica a sus cultivos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar vacunas, alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito, le gusta el grupo porque es muy unido. Su sueño es tener una muy buena cosecha y salud.
texts.en:
El Carmen Canton is known for agriculture. The crops are barraganete plantain, cacao, corn, palm heart, and a wide variety of fruit. In ranching dairy cows, horses, pigs, and poultry stand out.

This is where María, 66, lives. She's married and they have six adult children. Her husband's a farmer. They live on their own farm.

María's getting the loan for herself and her husband. He earns a living in agriculture growing bananas, mandarins, limes, oranges, and vegetables in the winter. Together they also have a business together selling animals such as pigs, chickens, and dairy cows, which they raise and sell by the pound to people who come to their farm. They also sell to stores. They sell these products on the weekend because that's when more people come to their location and sales are better. They devote the rest of the week to their crops.

She's going to use this loan to buy dairy cows, balanced animal feed, and crop fertilizer.

This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank. She likes the group because they're very close.

Her dream is to have a very good harvest and good health.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows, balanced feed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “KUÑA GUAPA” está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17 mujeres todas vecinas y amigas del lugar.  Las mismas se destacan en su comunidad por ser muy unidas y solidarias las unas con las otras.
Entre las integrantes se destaca en especial la Sra. Fatima, quien se dedica a vender comidas, tiene todo tipo de comidas que ella misma elabora todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día y después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, aderezos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas de comidas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group, Kuña Guapa, is in its sixth loan cycle as a women’s group made up of 17 women – neighbors and friends from the area. The women stand out in their community for being very united and supportive of one another. 

Mrs. Fatima, who makes a living selling food, stands out among the members. She has all types of foods that she makes herself everyday early in the morning and after sells them as a street vendor.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, breads, seasonings, etc. to be able to continue with her food sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food such as vegetables, meat, condiments, breads, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Jipson Eduardo

texts.es:
El cantón es gran productor y exportador de plátano, cacao; sus habitantes además se dedican a la ganadería. El clima es cálido húmedo y está ubicada la ciudad a 1 hora y media de la playa (pedernales).
En este lugar vive el señor Jipson, tiene 24  años de edad y tenía una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años. Vive el en casa de los papás.
Jipson con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de licores, perfumes importados  y ropa de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días más que todo los fines de semana ya que le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. También alquilo una finca para sembrar matas de plátanos ya que también es rentable el negocio de venta de racimas de plátano de  buena calidad para exportación. Tiene un año y medio arrendando y le ha ido muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar licores, perfumes  y ropa de niños. En el Grupo De Crédito tiene dos ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin muchos papeles. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar su carrera de administración de empresas y tener una finca propia.
texts.en:
Jipson lives in an area where most residents work growing plantains and cacao, as well as raising livestock. The weather is warm and humid, and the town is an hour and a half away from the beach.

Jipson is 24 years old and has a two-year-old son from a previous relationship. He lives in his parents' house. In order to make his own income, Jipson works selling liqueurs, imported perfumes, and all types of clothing. He works every day, but weekends are his busiest. He has been in business for two years and things have gone very well for him because he has quite a few customers. He also grows plantains on a property he rents, because selling high-quality plantains for export is a profitable business. He has been doing this for a year and a half and this business is also going very well.

He will use this loan to buy liqueurs, perfumes, and children's clothing. He has been with his communal bank for two cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans are quick and don't require a lot of paperwork. His dreams are to finish his degree in Business Administration and buy a property.

loans.use: to buy liqueurs, perfume, and children's clothing.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Cayetano 2 está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes, y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodora quien a través de su esfuerzo, trabajo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, también gracias al negocio que tiene, el cual es una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas todos los días.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, carne, panificados, enlatados, bebidas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Cayetano 2 Group is doing the "Poverty Stoplight" survey as a way to find out the life situation of each member, and to work to improve.

One of the members is Teodora, who is getting ahead and has the means to be able to help her family through her effort, work, and sacrifice--as well as through her business, a well-supplied store where she works every day beginning early in the morning.

She's requesting this loan to be able to stock her business with vegetables, meat, baked goods, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

She's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell, including vegetables, meat, baked goods, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Lydia Evangeline

texts.fr:
Lydia est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde  de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est employé de bureau dans une entreprise de construction. Le couple a deux enfants, âgés de 11 et 9 ans respectivement. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée et sont en classe 5ème et 7ème.
Lydia tient un kiosque de taxiphone et est artisane talentueuse à la fois, elle fabrique des  jolis bibelots avec des  argiles. Elle en est à son 4eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle a choisi ces activités car elle s’est aperçue qu’elles étaient rentables et mieux adaptées à elle, complémentaires. Elle est est passionnée de ses activités 
Son objectif est de pouvoir construire leur propre maison grâce à l’épargne pour éviter de payer le loyer pendant long temps.
texts.en:
Lydia is a 46-year-old woman who is hard-working and resourceful. She is married, and her husband is an office worker in a construction enterprise. The couple have two children, aged 11 and 9, both are in a private school (7th grade and 5th grade).

Lydia has a payphone kiosk, and she is also a talented artisan. She makes pretty ornaments and knicknacks made of clay. She is on her 4th loan with CEFOR. She chose these businesses because of their perceived profitability and suitability for herself and their complementary nature.

Her goal is to able to build a house of their own through their savings, so as to avoid paying rent for long.

loans.use: to purchase phone-minutes card and a telephone.

loans.name: Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se unió para poder trabajar de manera unida, y por medio de su esfuerzo en común dar a sus seres queridos una mejor calidad de vida. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Auda, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas variadas y también vende helados. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de sillas, mesas y bebidas varias para ofrecer un mejor servicio para sus clientes. Ella es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group has come together to work united, and to give their loved ones a better quality of life through their common effort. They are in the program of Poverty Elimination, putting effort to improve each day.

One of the members is Ms. Auda, who sells various drinks and ice cream for work. She is a very hard-working woman who works to improve her and her loved ones' conditions of life.
She is requesting this loan to buy chairs, tables, and various drinks to offer a better service for her customers. She is a person who is putting all her effort to improve and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: buy chairs, tables, and various drinks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una cliente recurrente en la fundación paraguaya y kiva, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, en su despensa se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, y comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar su negocio.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para pode comprar bebida variadas, verduras, lácteos y otros productos para poder seguir surtiendo su despensa y continuar de esa forma con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francisca's a returning client of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She's a very hardworking person. She earns an honest and decent living with her store. She says the previous loan has been a big help for her in being able to improve her business.

She's requesting this new loan so she can buy a variety of beverages, vegetables, dairy products, and other items to keep stocking her store and making sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages, vegetables, dairy products, and other items

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a widowed woman who is 68 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Norma has a dried fish processing business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials.

Norma has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Jeanne Philipine

texts.fr:
Jeanne est une femme très simple mais travailleuse de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est vendeur d’articles artisanaux. Le couple a 3 enfants de 7 à 13 ans et  ils sont tous scolarisés. Leur objectif est de réhabiliter leur domicile atteint d’un incendie et aussi de l’agrandir.
