Jeanne est dans la vente des chaussures à l'occasion et des paniers en palmier. Elle est à son 2eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle a décidé de monter son affaire en mars 2005 et s’est aperçue que l’activité est rentable. C'est pourquoi, elle voudrait à tout prix la développer et l'améliorer.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a quite simple but hard-working 45-year-old woman. She is married and her husband sells handicrafts. The couple has three children whose ages range from 7 to 13 years and are all in school. Their goal is to rehabilitate their home, which was damaged by fire, and also to enlarge it.

Jeanne is involved in selling used shoes and palm-frond baskets. She is on her second loan with CEFOR. She decided to start her business in March 2005 and has found that the activity is profitable. That is why she wants to develop and improve it at any cost.

loans.use: buy used shoes and palm-frond baskets.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and has six children who are already done with their studies. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a farming business for the past 20 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. Her dreams are: expanding to large scale farming and adopting modern farning methods in the future. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase more seedlings and cultivate her land. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and cultivate her land

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La Sra. Victorian es de la ciudad de Luque, tiene una despensa en la que la familia se ayuda para poder mantenerla, está casada y tiene hijos.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser lácteos, bebidas, enlatados, carne etc., logrando así ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoriana is from the city of Luque, is married and has children. She has a pantry, which she maintains with the help of her family.  

She is a hardworking woman who gives her all in order to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase supplies for her pantry such as dairy products, drinks, canned goods, meats, etc. – allowing her therefore to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy pantry supplies such as dairy products, drinks, canned goods, meats, etc.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is a married woman who is 55 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nelfa has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nelfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials.

Nelfa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 51 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Nenita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married lady and has eight kids who attend school. They live at a their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a farming business for the past 15 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and residents. She dreams of expanding to large scale farming in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more seedlings and cultivate her land. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and cultivate her land

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married lady and has been blessed with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated an agricultural business, selling at the market to local residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. He dreams include adopting modern farming methods to increase yields.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase vegetable seeds and cultivate her land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and cultivate her land

loans.name: Viviane Lucienne

texts.fr:
Viviane est une femme divorcée de 57 ans. C'est une exemple de courage et de force. Elle a trois enfants âgés de 27, 24, et 18 ans dont l’aîné est allé travailler à l’extérieur (Liban), le second vient d’obtenir sa licence, le dernier est en classe de terminale dans un lycée. C’est elle seule qui s’occupe de ses enfants .Son principal objectif est la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études, l’obtention d’au moins le diplôme de licence. 
Viviane a 15 ans d’expériences dans la gestion d’une petite unité de quincaillerie. Pour une bonne présentation des produits , elle a décidé de remplacer l’étage en bois en fer. Cette activité est exercée par presque  toute la famille (sa sœur,  sa belle sœur)   L’unité bénéficie de sa localisation au bord de la route. Le développement de l’activité dépend de la quantité et diversification de stocks disponible. 
Le prêt sert à acheter  des  vachettes,  peinture, white spirit  pour les revendre et du fer pour la réparation de l’étalage.
texts.en:
Viviane is a 57-year-old divorcee. She is an example of courage and strength. She has three children, ages 27, 24, and 18, the eldest of whom left for work (Libya), the second just got his bachelor’s degree, and the last of whom is in his last year of high school. She alone takes care of the children. Her main objective is the success of her children in their studies, having them get at least their bachelor’s degrees.

Viviane has 15 years of experience running a small hardware store. To display her products well, she has decided to replace wooden shelves with iron ones. This business is run by almost the whole family (her sister, her sister-in-law). The business benefits from its location roadside. The development of the business depends on the quantity and diversity of the available inventory.

The loan will serve to buy calfskin, paints, and white spirit to sell and some iron for the shelf repairs.

loans.use: to buy calfskin, paints, white spirit, and iron.

loans.name: Heritiana Louisette

texts.fr:
Heritiana vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Ceci lui a permis d'acheter des poulardes et poulets pour augmenter les nombres des cheptels et des viandes à vendre. Elle a pu avec les bénéfices construire un poulailler de plus qui est pour 150 têtes de poules. Ce développement de l'activité la motive et la pousse à continuer d'étendre et d'améliorer l'exploitation. N'oublions pas que son objectif est de bâtir une très grande ferme dans l'avenir, et elle commence dès maintenant petit à petit.
C'est une femme très active et travailleuse qui n'arrive pas à ne rien faire même pendant un peu de temps et qui ne laisse jamais passer une opportunité ou une bonne occasion d'améliorer son affaire.
texts.en:
Heritiana thanks you so much for the loan you last granted her. It allowed her to buy young fat chickens and hens to increase the number of livestock and meat to sell. With the earnings, she was able to build an extra chicken coop for 150 hens. This development of her business motivates and pushes her to continue to expand and improve her farming. Let us not forget that her objective is to build a very large farm in the future, and she is starting now, little by little.

She is a very active and hardworking woman who is unable to sit still, even during free time, and who never passes up an opportunity or chance to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy Madagascan young fat chickens and hens.

loans.name: Ma. Melanie

texts.en:
Ma. Melanie is 45 years old and married with two children. Her two children are presently in school, and Ma. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines. She had requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products.

Ma. Melanie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Melanie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselia is 42 years old and all seven of her children are enrolled in school.

Roselia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roselia requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Roselia has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Roselia would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Holiness

texts.en:
Holiness is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but doesn't have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a wholesale in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase additional stock, for example green vegetables, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married lady with three children who go to school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar from a shop to the residents in the area. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from fellow business persons. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and related goods.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan  tiene 59 años, es casado vive con su esposa y   con  sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Ybycuí.
Comenta que desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la ganadería (venta de leche) año tras años de esfuerzo y trabajo arduo pudo conseguir el capital suficiente para poder montar una despensa en su propia casa, que administra la esposa, son una pareja muy trabajadora que se ayudan ambos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir la despensa que tiene con productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Juan, 59 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the city of Ybycuí.

Juan shared that from a very young age he has made a living through raising livestock and selling milk. Year after year, he worked hard to be able to obtain enough capital to set up a pantry in his own home – which his wife manages. They are a very hardworking pair that help each other. 

He is asking for this loan in order to purchase supplies to stock the pantry with basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to stock his pantry.

loans.name: Heriniaina Baby  Angel

texts.fr:
Heriniaina Baby est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant de 10ans, scolarisé. Son mari travail avec elle. Le couple est propriétaire de son domicile. Ils ont pour objectif d’étendre leur activité et ainsi ils n’auront plus à pratiquer le prêt dans l'avenir mais pouvoir utiliser leur propre argent.
Elle exerce une activité de vente des sandales, des pantalons slim et des châles depuis 2010. Avant son travail actuel, elle a été serveuse et l’a abandonnée car elle trouve cette activité plus intéressante c'est pourquoi, elle voudrait la développer et l'étendre petit à petit selon ses possibilités. Le prêt servira à acheter des habillages pour femme : Ballerine, Châles, pantalon Slim
texts.en:
Heriniaina Baby is 30 years old. She is married and has a 10-year-old child who attends school. Her husband works with her and the couple owns their home. They aim to expand their business so that they will not need loans in the future but will use their own funds.

Since 2010 she runs a business selling sandals, skinny pants and shawls. Before her current activity, she was a waitress and quit because this activity was more interesting.

That is why she wants to develop and gradually expand her business when possible to do so. The loan will be used to buy women's clothing: ballerina shoes, shawls, skinny pants.

loans.use: buy sandals, ballerina shoes, shawls, skinny pants, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a door mat making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase materials such as cloth, thread and other materials.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cloth, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline is 44 years old and married with four children.

Jacquiline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jacquiline has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jacquiline aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 51 years old, married, and has two children.

Gina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 52-year-old mother of two children residing at Baliangao Misamis Occidental with her family. She works on their own farm with her husband to make a living. She had been doing this for more than eight years and earns money to meet the needs of the family. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and took out a loan to be used for fertilization costs of her rice farm.

She wants to expand her farm and dreams of owning a rice mill to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to be used for fertilization costs of her rice farm.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын, 30 лет, замужем, есть 2 дочери. У нее - среднее образование, на протяжении 4 лет, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Айсалкын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 3 коровы. Также есть 0,60 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу. Всю экологически чистую продукцию Айсалкын реализует. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 7,000 сом (KGS). Айсалкын обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 30 years old, married, and has 2 daughters. She has a secondary-level education, and over the last 4 years, she has done agricultural work as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Aisalkyn's very hard work, her farm now has livestock -- 3 cows. It also has 0.60 hectares of Aisalkyn's own land, where she grows corn. Aisalkyn sells all of her organic produce. Her monthly profit is around 7,000 som (KGS).

Aisalkyn has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 calves to fatten and resell. Aisalkyn plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Janet is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Janet has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Janet has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Colobane Magasin-Ps2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. Il est constitué de femmes qui font généralement le commerce. Madame Adama qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de trente huit ans et mère d'un garçon. Elle évolue dans cette activité depuis plus d'une dizaine d'années. Elle compte avec ce crédit acheter du riz, des légumes, de l'huile pour son restaurant. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la santé de son fils et à augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en: The banc villageois of which this group is a part was launched in May 2007. It is comprised of women who generally sell things. Mrs. Adama, who is in the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is a single, 38-year-old mother of a boy. She has been evolving in this business for more than ten years. With this loan, she plans to buy rice, vegetables, and oil for her restaurant. The profits will allow her to ensure her son’s health and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her restaurant.

loans.name: Olivololona

texts.fr:
Olivololona vous remercie beaucoup pour le credit, avec lequel, elle a pu renforcé le fonds de roulement et avec les bénéfices et quelques épargnes, elle a pu réhabiliter le magasin en dur. Ainsi, elle a pu formaliser l'activité, les papiers sont actuellement en règle. 
Elle devient plus active et plus motivée à continuer à développer et améliorer l'activité et tout cela , grâce à vous disait-elle. Elle espère encore votre coup de pouce si possible. Elle voudrait toujours le meilleur pour sa famille, elle vient d'avoir son quatrième enfant il y a quatre mois.
texts.en:
Olivololona thanks you so much for the loan with which she was able to reinforce her working capital, and with the profits and some savings, she was able to build a permanent structure for her store. Thus, she was able to make her business official, the papers currently in order.

She is becoming more active and motivated to continue to develop and improve the business, all of which she says is thanks to you. She is hoping for another helping hand if possible. She would always like the best for her family. She just had her fourth child four months ago.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice, 1 bag of flour, 2 bags of sugar, 10 packs of water, and supplemental general merchandise.

loans.name: Maryuris Isabel

texts.es:
Maryuris es una de las jóvenes que rompe el estereotipo de ser hija de padres agricultores y seguir la tradición de trabajar en el campo, al contrario, desde pequeña esta joven de 25 años de edad. Se vio  interesada por los números lo que le facilitó al crecer, saber qué iba a estudiar. Actualmente cursa el quinto año de la carrera de Contabilidad Pública y Finanzas, además de ya estar trabajando en el área de contabilidad.
El apoyo del esposo de Maryuri le ha permitido sentirse motivada por salir adelante, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y los gastos de la promoción, esto le brindará una oportunidad para adquirir su título sin ningún problema y poder disfrutar de este gran logro. En sus metas está seguir dando lo mejor en su trabajo y estudiar una especialización para aumentar sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Maryuris, 25 years old, is one of the young people who has broken the stereotype of being a daughter of farming parents and following in the tradition of working in the field from a young age. 

She became interested in numbers, which supported her growth – and she knew that it was what she was going to study. Currently, she is in her fifth year of a public accounting and finance degree, and she is already working the field of accounting. 

The support of Maryuri’s husband has allowed her to feel motivated in getting ahead in life – and a reason why she has requested a loan to pay for her degree and educational expenses. This would provide her with an opportunity to obtain her degree without any issues and to be able to enjoy this great success.  

Her goals are to continue doing her best in her work and to study a specialization to increase her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her degree and educational expenses.

loans.name: Colobane Magasin-Ps1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. Il est composé de femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Madame Pauline qui est sur la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe.Elle est mariée, âgée de soixante cinq ans et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon. Elle est dans cette activité depuis plus de dix ans.Elle compte avec le montant sollicité acheter vingt litres d'huile de palme qu'elle va revendre. Les bénéfices vont servir à la scolarité, à la santé de ses enfants et augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en: The banc villageois of which this group is a part was launched in May 2007. It is comprised of women who generally sell things. Mrs. Pauline, who is in the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is a 65-year-old married mother of three, one of whom is a boy. She has been in this business for more than ten years. With the loan, she plans to buy twenty liters of palm oil, which she will resell. The profits will allow her to ensure her children’s health and education and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to buy palm oil.

loans.name: Colobane Magasin-Pc1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois qui abrite ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. C'est un groupe composé de femmes dynamiques qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Aminata qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de soixante trois et mère de quatre enfants dont trois filles. Elle commercialise des produits alimentaires depuis plus de dix ans. Elle compte avec le prêt sollicité acheter cinq bidons d'huile de palme et cinq bidons de jus de citron. Les bénéfices serviront à assurer l'éducation de ses enfants, la santé, les dépenses quotidiennes et à augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en: The banc villageois which hosts this group was launched in May 2007. It is a group made up of energetic women who are developing businesses. Mrs. Aminata, who in the photo is raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is a 63-year-old married mother of four, three of whom are girls. She has been selling food products for more than ten years. With the loan, she plans to buy five containers of palm oil and five containers of lemon juice. The profits will allow her to ensure her children’s education and health, help with daily expenses, and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemons.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene un hijo, está acompañado, y tanto el cómo su pareja se esfuerzan por su hijo para darle una vida sin necesidades. 
Él es de familia muy humilde razón por la cual desde muy temprana edad se dedicó a las ventas ambulantes de todo tipo de productos. Con ayuda de sus familiares se hizo de capital para realizar dicha actividad. Con el correr de los tiempos fue agrandando su zona para de esa manera ir aumentado su ingreso y tener una mayor clientela formada.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juan is in a common-law marriage and has a son, and he and his partner strive to give their son a life where his needs are met.  

He is from a very humble family – and why from an early age he has made a living as a street vendor selling various types of products. With the help of his relatives, he has made enough money to be able to carry out this business. Over time, he has grown the area where he does business to increase his income and to have a greater base of customers.    

He is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing, shoes and other miscellaneous items to be able to continue his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell such as clothing, shoes and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jennifer Scarleth

texts.es:
Al cantón el Carmen se la denomina “La Puerta de Oro de Manabí”, por su producción de plátano barraganete, único en el país y exportado al mundo.En este lugar se reúne el banco comunal 15 de junio que se reúne cada quince días.
En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer tiene 19 años de edad, va a ser madre soltera porque  está embarazada. Ella vive en casa de sus abuelitos.
Jennfer con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catálogo y carteras, trabaja de lunes a sábados más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace un año y le ha ido muy bien, compra la mercadería en la ciudad de Guayaquil, lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar carteras, sandalias, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos que su clientela le solicita. Está en el grupo de crédito recién y agradece la rapidez ya que son mínimos los requisitos. Su sueño es tener casa propia y tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen is called "The Golden Door of Manabi" for its production of the barraganete plantain, unique to Ecuador and exported worldwide. Here, the communal bank "June 15th" meets every fifteen days. This is also where Jennifer, 19 years old and pregnant, will become a single mother. Jennifer lives at home with her grandparents, and with the goal of earning her own money she sells products out of catalogs, including Avon, Esika, and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She also sells clothing by catalog and portfolio.

Jennifer works from Monday to Saturday, usually in the morning because at these hours it is easier for her to complete her rounds as she sells door to door with weekly collections. She loves to sell, and has been doing it for a year with good results. She purchases her merchandise in the city of Guayaquil, with most of what she sells being cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this loan to purchase wallets, sandals, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products that her clients request. She is a recent member of the group and appreciates its speed due to its minimal requirements. Her dream is to have her own home and a big store.

loans.use: to buy wallets, sandals, perfumes, imitation jewelry, cosmetics, cream, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena’s husband is a fisherman and they live in Iloilo, Philippines.  She helps her husband with his livelihood to assist with their financial stability.  They have been proficient fisherman for 20 years, providing for the needs of their family.  They have raised their child, who is already grown up now, through this business. 

Lorena dreams of uplifting their livelihood.  In order to have better means of living in the future, she is requesting a larger loan amount to repair their fishing boat.  This will allow them to continue their business and enhance their catch.

loans.use: to repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Santa Benedicta

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen se destaca en la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, café, cacao, maíz y gran variedad de frutas (piñas, naranjas, maracuyá, etc.). En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral.
En este lugar vive la señorita Benedicta tiene 57 años de edad, soltera y no tiene hijos,  aunque un sobrino de 13 años es criado por ella como si fuese su hijo. Tiene casa propia.
Benedicta con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de  trabajar en una empacadora de camarones armando cajas de empaque, también cría pollos durante dos o tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras por su casa y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa.  En una pequeña finca también tiene sembrado matas de plátanos. Por las tardes realiza la venta de sus productos ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace 9 años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar abono y alimento para los pollos. Le gusta estar en el grupo de crédito por la facilidad y los bajos intereses, esta hace 5 meses y es la tesorera del grupo. Su sueño es tener su casa nueva y reformar algunos sectores de su finca para sembrar otros productos como pimientos de ciclos cortos y cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen is known for agriculture; bananas, coffee, cocoa, corn and a great variety of fruits are grown here. The main livestock animals are cattle, horses, pigs and poultry. Benedicta lives here. She is 57 years old and single with no children, although she is raising a 13-year-old nephew as if her were her own son. She has her own home.

In order to have her own income, Benedicta works selling products from catalogues including Avon, Esika, Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She also works in a shrimp-packing company assembling packing boxes. In addition to this she raises chickens during the two-or-three month period until they are ready to sell. After this period she takes them to stores in the area or sells them by the pound from her home and to sellers who come to her house. In a small farm she has also planted bananas. In the afternoons she sells her products, because it is easier at this time to do her routes. She sells door to door and collects weekly. She loves selling, and because she has been doing this for 9 years it is going well and she has many customers. The things she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizer and chicken feed. She likes being in the credit group because it is easy and the interest is low. She has been a member for 5 months and is treasurer for the group. Her dream is to have a new house and renovate parts of her farm to grow fast-growing peppers and organic cocoa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en:
Darryl is married and operates a transportation business for a living. He has been running a transportation business for many years and has successfully repaid his previous loan used to buy new tires for his motorcycle to replace the old ones.

Aside from this service, he is also engaged in a tailoring business, offering repairs and dressmaking services. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase new materials needed in his tailoring shop, like a sewing machine and accessories. In the future, he wants to improve their business to reach their dreams of having a better living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new materials needed in his tailoring shop like a sewing machine and accessories.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 31 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cheryl has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Cheryl has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janita is 47 years old, and three of her children are presently in school.

Janita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Janita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Janita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Rita Elena

texts.es:
Migrar a la capital es uno de los grandes deseos de muchos de los ciudadanos de las zonas rurales, pues lo miran como una opción de superación personal y profesional. Rita es una de las que decidió establecer su futuro con fondos propios, vendiendo comida desde hacer nueve años. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con el que tuvo grande resultados, por lo que agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron. 
Rita tiene 42 años de edad y mira un futuro prometedor con su familia y con su negocio de venta comida. El mayor de sus hijos, de 19 años de edad, se ha convertido en su apoyo principal en su trabajo y quien le ha ayudado a inyectar energías para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar harina, frijoles, leche, gas, arroz, azúcar, entre otros ingredientes para hacer una producción de calidad y así obtener mejores ganancias. En sus metas está capitalizar su negocio, ayudar a que todos sus hijos se profesionalicen y mejorar la estructura de su establecimiento.
texts.en:
To migrate to the capital is one of the great desires of many residents of rural areas, because they view it as an opportunity to get ahead personally and professionally. Rita is one of them who decided to establish her future with her own funds. She has been selling food for nine years. She previously requested a loan to invest in her business, with which she had great results, and she is grateful to everyone who supported her.

Rita is 42 years old and sees a promising future for her family and her food sales business. Her oldest child is 19 years old, and has become her main support in her work, helping to give her the energy to continue investing in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, beans, milk, gas, rice, sugar and other ingredients to produce more and earn more income. Among her goals are to obtain capital for her business, help all of her children become professionals, and improve the structure of her establishment.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, milk, gas, rice, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 38-year-old, married woman. She is a very dedicated mother of five children. She has been running a business of making and selling woolen products such as hand-made sweaters, caps, etc. She has been supporting her family with the help of the income from this business.

She has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She wants to purchase spools of wool and yarn along with packs of needles for meeting the demand of her customers consistently and fulfilling her dream of giving her children the best education and health facilities that she can afford.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and yarn along with packs of needles for meeting the demand of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.es:
La Sra.  Eufracia es madre de 4 hijos, ahora  mayores. Ella desde muy joven se dedicó a la elaboración de artesanía, confección de sobrecamas. Es oriunda de una  compañía cercana a  la ciudad de Carapeguá, se casó, siguió dedicándose  a la artesanía y cuidando de sus hijos y su esposo se dedicaba a las ventas ambulantes.  
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar sobrecamas en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en: Eufracia is a mother of 4 grown children. Since she was very young she has worked making bedspreads. She comes from a community near the city of Carapegua. She married, and continuing making her products and caring for her children and her husband, who is a mobile salesman. She is requesting this loan to buy large quantities of bedspreads, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads in large quantity to sell.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 47 años de edad ,es casado tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar , tiene una fábrica de ladrillos donde trabaja en este desde el año 1993, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre les hace muchos pedidos.
Su esposa trabaja en la casa criando  gallinas y cerdos, todo lo que obtiene es gracias a su esfuerzo. 
El préstamo lo solicita para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla para que pueda seguir haciendo sus ladrillos y continuar de esa forma con sus ventas.
texts.en: Hugo is 47 years old, and is married with 2 school-aged children. He has a brick-making workshop where he has worked since 1993, so that he has a large number of customers who give him many orders. His wife works at home raising chickens and pigs, and everything that she earns is thanks to her efforts. The loan will be used to buy clay so that he can continue making his bricks and thereby continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene integrantes, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana quien vende artículos de primera necesidad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Rossana solicita  este préstamo para la compra de azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina por bolsas para mejorar el precio de sus productos y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. En la foto del grupo hay 15 personas ya que el grupo tiene 15 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 14 de ellas piden de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Each member of this group makes the greatest effort to improve her quality of life. They are part of the poverty elimination program to get better every day. One of the members is Rossana, who sells basic grocery items. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who wants to improve the living conditions for herself and her loved ones. She is grateful for the chance that she is receiving to be able to grow and get ahead.

Rossana is requesting this loan to buy sugar, pasta, rice, and bags of flour, to improve the prices of her products and continue with her sales as she has been doing. In the group photo there are 15 people, but in this cycle only 14 of them are requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery items to sell, such as sugar, pasta, rice, and bags of flour, to improve the prices of her products.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old and married woman with 6 children.

She runs a small business selling cabbages, egg plant, beans, etc. in her community, and she has been doing this for 2 years.

Susana has requested a loan to buy a spade, chemicals, a rake, seeds, fertiliser, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Susana will hope to give the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy a spade, chemicals, a rake, seeds, fertiliser, etc.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leny has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a 37-year-old lady; she is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to maintain motorbikes. He is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the bikes in no time. He must use various types of tools for the repairs. A few days ago, he moved his workshop to another place, and during this relocation, some important and expensive tools were misplaced.

Munawar has requested a loan for her husband so that he can compensate for this loss. He will buy repairing tools, lubricants, spare parts, tires, brake shoes, etc. for his motorbike repair workshop.

Munawar wants to provide better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in positive way and his monthly income will increase. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools, lubricants, spare parts, tires, and brake shoes for her husband's motorbike repair workshop.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
For the past five years, Celia has been engaged in making dust pans. Her husband is a carpenter. Celia is a 33-year-old married woman and has two young children. In addition, she also sells folding beds.

She would like to improve her earnings and would like to produce more finished products, but the problem is that the availability of funds is very low.
.
Celia has requested a loan to invest in materials like wood, nails, and metal. These could help enhance her source of income and slowly help her to settle her obligation. Thus, she could roll-out her capital and slowly expand her business.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to invest in materials like wood, nails, and metal.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old, and she is married with four children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 58 years old and widowed, and she has one child.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Elvie

texts.en:
Ma. Elvie is 34 years old, and she is married with one child.

Ma. Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Ma. Elvie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a 41-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Priscila has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials. She has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Yonice

texts.en:
Yonice is 35 years old and married with three children.

Yonice works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for six years.

Yonice aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees for the kids.

For the past five years, Saumu has operated a cereal shop business, selling from a shop to the residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and stiff competition from fellow people in the same business. Saumu dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more cereal stock. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal stock.

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to other residents. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of opening another shop outlet in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Rubinita

texts.en:
Rubinita is a married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old.

Rubinita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fish, salt, bamboo, and other materials.

Rubinita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, bamboo, and other materials.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 34 years old, and she is married with three children.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Riza has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Realyn works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy raw materials like wood, nails, varnish, and maintenance for her business.

Realyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, nails, varnish, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 42-year-old married woman.

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their 3 children.

Recently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, in order to cater to a maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income.

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend a part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, in order to cater to a maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Melgina

texts.en:
Melgina is 40 years old and widowed, and she has two children who are still in school.

Melgina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melgina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Holliness

texts.en:
Holliness is a married woman and a mother of two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She dreams of expanding her business.

Holliness is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for resale. She joined Yehu to get funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. She is a 35-year-old married woman and is blessed with an 8-year-old daughter. Maricar wishes to be a good mother to her child and a good wife to her husband, by giving her daughter a good education and supporting her husband financially.

Maricar is asking for a loan to help her improve her sari-sari store business. She plans to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, snack foods, drinks, and a sack of rice. In the future, Maricar aims to uplift their livelihood for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, snack foods, drinks, and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea lives a simple life with her family in a town of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 11, 4, and 3.

Rhea is engaged in buying and selling medicines. She successfully started this business a few months ago to support her husband in raising their children. She is asking for a bigger amount loans for additional capital to buy medicines to sell. In this way, she will be able to augment her profit.

Forty-five-year-old Rebecca dreams of improving her livelihood and having enough money to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 74 years old.

Thelma has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

Thelma has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lolita has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 48 years old, and she is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Felomina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Felomina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 54 years old, married, and a mother of four. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Virgincita sells dried fish to the local community. She is also engaged in planting and harvesting bananas and then selling them to the local community. She earn a total average of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from her own farm.

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, Virgincita hopes to expand her business and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Musarat Parveen

texts.en:
Musarat Parveen is very vigilant and a good manager, as she manages her household and clothing shop simultaneously. She is married, age 56, and a mother of six children. She lives with her husband in Multan, Pakistan.

Musarat Parveen manages her business alone with proper procedure and is benefiting from her business very much, but now she falls short of the savings that she needs in her account to buy the seasonal inventory for her business. Therefore, she applied for the loan and is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her clothing selling business.

loans.name: Toktobubu

texts.ru: Токтобубу, 49 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. На протяжении 20 лет, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у Токтобубу есть 5 коров, 15 овец и 3 лошади. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает люцерну и ячмень. Доходы от бизнеса составляют около 26,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтобубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку автомобиля для бизнеса. Вырученные доходы Токтобубу планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить на проведение свадьбы сына.
texts.en:
Toktobubu is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has worked with agriculture for a period of 20 years. Currently Toktobubu has five cows, 15 sheep and three horses. She grows alfalfa and barley on 3.0 hectares of land. The income from the business is around 26,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further develop her business, Toktobubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase a car for her business. Toktobubu plans to invest the income in developing her business and would like to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her business.

loans.name: Aitkul

texts.ru: Айткул, 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айткул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айткул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айткул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aitkul is 59 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. She has secondary education. As a main income for her family she works with livestock breeding, after having started a business with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aitkul's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows and 30 sheep. The monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Aitkul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow with calf to increase her herd. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for renovating her home.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with calf in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Casimira Mercedes

texts.es:
Por más de 16 años, Casimira entró al mundo de los emprendedores y emprendedoras sin ningún problema. A sus 65 años de edad, ella se siente muy orgullosa por haber logrado y haber visto a sus tres hijos independientes debido al gran esfuerzo que ha dado al establecer su negocio.
Casimira cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos y sueña ver crecer su pulpería para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, tomate, jugos y golosinas, productos de alta demanda diariamente. Con este paso ella planea construir una nueva casa y también mejorar su casa, siempre con el apoyo de sus hijos que tanto la admiran.
texts.en:
More than 16 years ago, Casmira easily entered into the world of entrepreneurship. At 65 years old, she is very proud of having achieved seeing her three children grow up to be independent. This is owing to the hard work that she has put in to her business.

Casmira receives financial support from her children, and dreams of expanding her grocery store in order to improve her living conditions. Casmira is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy rice, beans, corn, tomatoes, juices and sweets, all products that are in high demand every day. With this new step in her life, Casmira plans to make improvements to her home with the support of her children whom she so admires.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, tomatoes, juices and sweets.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela, ella vive sola con sus hijos. 
Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para que a sus hijos no les falte nada, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de plástico como, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos, platos, cucharas y muchos otros artículos, sale casi  todos los días por la localidad y sitios cercanos donde cuenta con buena clientela, ella vende al contado y también entrega a crédito, lleva  más de 10 años con esta actividad, la cual puede sacar adelante gracias a los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos y muchos otros productos que vende. Lleva 4 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los  créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son que nunca les falte nada a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the credit group '24 de Diciembre' get together in the town of el Canton de Montecristi. This town is well-known both nationally and internationally for the famous 'Panama Hats'.

Sonia is part of this group. She is 36 and is the single mother of two children aged 11 and nine. She lives alone with them and they are both studying at school.

She is a very hard-working person, putting in a lot of effort every day to make sure that her children are not in need of anything.

She dedicates her time to commerce, selling all types of clothes and plastic goods such as containers, baskets, jars, glasses, plates, spoons and many other things.

She sells her goods on the streets every day to her customers who pay in cash or by credit. She has been doing this for more than ten years and has been able to forge ahead thanks to the loan system.

Therefore, she is very grateful for the loans she has received in the past. She will use this new loan to buy clothes, containers, baskets, jugs, glasses and many other things which she can sell.

She has been in the loan cycle for four years now, which has helped her to be successful.

Her aim in life is to always be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer Evelyn

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 5 y 3 años y de 8 meses el menor. Su esposo no tiene trabajo fijo.
Jennifer es una muy buena mujer que al ver que su marido no cuenta con algo fijo se vio en la necesidad de realizar una actividad que le genere sus propios ingresos y así salir adelante junto a su familia, para esto ella  se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta en las mañanas o noches y en ocasiones su marido le ayuda con sus ventas, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda,  deja a crédito  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual puede solventar por los créditos que recibe razón por lo cual ella está muy agradecida con la fundación.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The credit group called '24 de Diciembre' get together every 15 days in the town of El Canton Montecristi. This place is well-known, both in this country and internationally, for its famous 'Panama Hats'.

Jennifer, 20, is a member of this group. She is married and has three children aged five, three and eight months. Her husband has not got a permanent job.

Jennifer is a good person. Given that her husband has no steady work, she decided to go into business herself and generate her own income so she can look after the family.

She dedicates her time to commerce, selling all types of clothes door-to-door in the mornings and evenings. At times, her husband helps her with the sales.

She also sells from home where she receives visits from clients who may be looking for something in particular. She sells on credit and collects the money every week.

She has been doing this for three years and has been able to set herself up thanks to the loan system, which she has been part of for three cycles. She is therefore, very grateful to the loan organization.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothes. Her aim in life is to make sure her children have the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Roxana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10  y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Roxana es una mujer como muchas en nuestra sociedad que le gusta ganarse sus propios recursos y así contribuir con los gastos del hogar, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días en  las horas de la mañana sale a vender a conocidos del lugar, ella también vende en su casa si así lo prefieren sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el mismo que empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo, ella agradece mucho a las personas que le permiten obtener sus créditos ya que así como sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Lleva más de 11 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The credit group called '24 de Diciembre' get together every 15 days in the town of El Canton Montecristi. This place is well-known, both in this country and internationally, for its famous 'Panama Hats'.

Roxana, 29, is part of this group. She is married and has two children aged ten and five. Both are studying at school. Her husband works as a general building contactor.

Like so many women in this society, Roxana likes to generate her own income to contribute to the household expenses. She sells shoes by catalogue. Part of her sales are done door-to-door. She goes out every day in the morning, selling to local residents.

She also sells from home, if her customers prefer to visit her there. She sells on credit and collects payment every eight days.

She has been in this business for more than five years and was able to set it up thanks to the loans she received. For this reason she is very grateful to the loan organization. She has been with the credit group for more than 11 years now.

She will use this loan to buy more shoes, as she has several orders pending which need to be delivered.

Her main aim in life is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
Ser técnico en relojería, es una tradición que tiene la familia de Carlos, un emprendedor de 53 años de edad que ha trabajado desde sus veinte años para salir adelante con su familia. El negocio de este hombre trabajador ya lleva más de 26 años, donde le ha tocado aprender de las experiencias fuertes, como la de un robo, hasta volver a iniciar de cero y seguir sosteniendo tan excelente trabajo como ahorita.
Carlos sueña con ver crecer su negocio y aumentar su clientela, por lo que ha decidido invertirle más. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar herramientas como tenaza, fajas, hilo, puntero, entre otra mercadería necesaria para poder ofrecer un producto de calidad. En sus planes está mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y diversificar los productos.
texts.en:
Carlos follows in the family tradition of being a watchmaker. He is 53 and has been working since he was 20, striving to get along in life.

This hard-working man has overcome many obstacles in the 26 years that he has had this business. At one time, he was the victim of a robbery and had to start again from scratch. However, he was able to get back on track and now runs a successful business.

He dreams of seeing his business grow and attract more customers, so he has decided to invest more money into it. For this reason, he is asking for a loan so that he can buy tools such as pliers, belts, thread, pointers and other material so that he can offer a quality product.

In the future, he would like to improve his business property and diversify his products.

loans.use: to buy equipment to make and repair watches.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a single lady with no kids. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a green grocery stall where she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality at her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase additional stock for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for resale

loans.name: Gloria Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 65 años de edad que se dedica a la cría y venta de pescado, siempre está llena de energía, dispuesta a trabajar entre 8 y 10 horas en el estanque, pescando y preparando el pescado para venderlo en las calles de Barbosa.
Es casada y fruto de su matrimonio nacieron media docenas de hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad.
Esta guerrera mujer no desiste de su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, es el sueño por el cual se levanta todos los días y espera lograrlo antes de partir.
Actualmente la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de alimento para pescado, realiza mejoras a los tanques para hacerlo más amplio y también a las cavas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 65, farms and sells fish. She is always full of energy and willing to work between eight and ten hours a day at the pond, fishing and preparing the fish to sell on the streets of Barbosa.

She is married and has six children, who are now all grown up.

This tenacious woman will not give up on her dream of being able to buy her own home. This motivates her to get up early every day and fulfil her objectives before she goes home.

She is asking for a loan to buy fish food and to make improvements to the ponds so they are bigger and deeper.

loans.use: to buy small fish to farm and food for them.

loans.name: Cenelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Su pasión por enseñar a los demás, ha hecho de Cenelia una de las mejores estudiantes de su carrera para ser maestra de Ciencias Naturales. A sus 32 años de edad, se encuentra en el quinto año de la licenciatura, poniendo todo su desempeño, con el apoyo de su esposo, de sus cuatro hijos y de un hermano que le envía remesas.
Cenelia decidió estudiar Ciencias Naturales con el objetivo de proyectar y compartir sus conocimientos de la materia favorita de su infancia. Razón por la cual ha dado todo de sí y no quiere tener ningún obstáculo para terminar sus estudios. De manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y que le facilitará los procesos investigativos y de entrega de informes en clases. En sus planes está optar por un trabajo y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
The passion to teach others drove Cenelia to be one of the best students so she can graduate as a teacher in Natural Science.

She is 32, and is in her fifth year of study. She works hard every day, putting in all her effort. She has the support of her husband and four children, as well as her brother who sends her some money every month.

She decided to study Science because she wanted to be able to share her knowledge on that subject which had been her favorite since she was a child.

That is why she has given her all and does not want to have to give up her studies for any reason.

She is asking for a loan to buy a computer which will help her do her research and produce her class reports.

She hopes to be able to start work in the near future and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar owns a boarding house for rent. He has been managing a boarding house for two years now. He is a 68-year-old, married man and has four grown children. He lives in his own home with his wife.  

At the present time, he has made renovations and repairs on the back portion and he would like to access financial services that would fit his needs.

Cesar is asking for a loan to purchase materials like electric bulbs, paint, and cement. These resources will improve the condition of his property and provide comfort to his respective clients .

In the future, he is hoping that he can invest other sources of income to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase materials like electric bulbs, paint, and cement

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and blessed with four children who attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to the public. She cites seasonality to be her major challenge. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура, 44 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. На протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Манзуры среднее образование. Она достигла хороших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 2 лошади, есть земельные наделы. Совокупная прибыль Манзуры составляет около 37,000 сом (KGS). Манзура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств она направит на обработку земли и посадку лука. Это позволит Манзуре развить бизнес и увеличить доход от бизнес деятельности.
texts.en:
Manzura is 44 years old, married, and has four children. For 20 years she has worked in animal husbandry and agriculture, and is experienced at her job. Manzura has secondary education. She has achieved good success in her business. On her farm there are two cows, two horses, and a land plot. Manzura's total income is about 37,000 som (KGS). 

Manzura has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy some livestock, and she will use part of the funds to cultivate her land and plant onions. This will allow Manzura to develop her business and increase her income from the business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and to cultivate her land for growing organic onion

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гульнура, 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи Гульнура занимается сельским хозяйством. Начатый со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) бизнес на сегодня приносит около 24,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 10 коров, на 1,04 Га земли она выращивает арбузы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнура обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на оплату осенне-полевых работ (покупку семян и оплату услуг рабочих). Доходы от кредита Гульнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulnura is 28 years old, married, and raising three children. Gulnura has secondary-specialist education, and she farms as a source of income for her family. The business started from a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), and today it brings in about 24,000 som (KGS) a month. On the farm there are ten cows, and on 1.04 hectares of land she cultivates watermelons. 

With the view of further developing her business, Gulnura has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to pay for autumn field works (buying seeds and paying workers). Gulnura plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and renovating her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay employees for land cultivation

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is from Carles, Iloilo. She is 43 years old and a mother of five children, one adult and four dependents who are in college. She and her husband support their studies through selling meat. They have been earning with this livelihood for 15 years. Nerissa’s goal in the future is to improve her meat shop business. To do this, she needs a bigger loan for additional capital to buy different kinds of meat such as pork, beef, and goat’s meat (chevon). In this way, she and her husband will be able to augment their profit.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of meat such as pork, beef, and goat’s meat (chevon)

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann is 26 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mae Ann has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Mae Ann requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spare parts to sell.

Mae Ann has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mae Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sonya

texts.ru: Соня погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании.
