The challenge he meets is high transport costs to go from the place where he buys his shoes to his shop where he sells from. Besides that, he has future prospects of also buying children’s shoes for selling so as to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is aged 40 years, married with 6 children, and is a resident of Hoima, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of providing them with all their basic needs and all attend school.

He is a very hardworking man who sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil among other items on a retail basis and works 12 hours a day. In order to supplement his income he practices farming, predominantly growing cassava and beans. He intends to educate his children and develop his business more and he is requesting a loan to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap for selling.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred aged 45 is every hard working married lady, charged with the responsibility of taking care of 4 children, who all attend school in Hoima Uganda. She ventured into buying and selling of produce chiefly selling rice,maize and beans among other items. In turn she carries out farming mostly growing maize in order to supplement her incomes.

She intends to grow and expand her business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital and seasonal changes. She is seeking for credit to buy more maize and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize and rice  for selling.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
For a year and a half, Floriana has been engaged in hog raising as a livelihood. She raises and sells pigs to the locals in the community where she lives. She is forty-nine years old and a married woman with six children, of whom two are still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses. Together with her family, she resides in the town of Sierra Bullones.

She decided to imcrease the number of livestock she is about to raise. She has requested a loan to purchase pigs and feed for them. In this way, she should able to produce quality hogs and eventually, that could cause her to have a financial gain.

In the future, Floriana is determined that she must able to continue to manage her livelihood so as to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Cesaltina

texts.en:
Cesaltina lives in Dili B and she is a business woman. She has been involving in business activities a few year ago with her own working capital and she make her best on it. She has very high interest in doing business.

She has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including aqua, eggs, detergents, biscuits, candies, soaps, sugar, cooking oils, including soft drinks and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy aqua, eggs, detergents, biscuits, candies, soaps, sugar, cooking oils, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 48-year-old married mother of two. Eleven years ago, she started working as a tailor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business.

Almost a year ago, she opened a $1 shop, as a second source of income. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and products to better satisfy her customers' requests.

Ghada hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new $1 items and products.

loans.name: Crimilda

texts.pt:
A senhora Cremilda, cabeleireira de 32 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais 01 a frequentar o ensino primário, 01 a frequentar o ensino secundário e o outro ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria, e não sustenta a mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar, 02 secadores, produtos para o tratamento de cabelos, mechas, tessagem, extensões, para melhorar os seus serviços de cabeleireira. 
 
O seu sonho e ver o seu negocio a crescer, concluir a sua casa, comprar carro pra o uso particular.
O seu maior desafio é lutar contra a pobreza e doenças, tem insuficiência de fundos, mas esta trabalhando para superar, com o crédito anterior construi-o a casa em que vive hoje.
texts.en:
Cremilda is a hair stylist. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children; one goes to primary school, one to secondary school, and one is not of school age yet. She owns the house where she lives and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, she will buy two hair dryers, hair treatments, artificial hair, hair locks, and hair extensions to improve her hair salon.

Her dream is to see her business grow, finish building her house, and buy a vehicle for personal use.

Her biggest challenge is to fight against poverty and illness. She does not have enough money, but she is fighting to overcome that obstacle. With the previous loan, she built the house where she lives today.

loans.use: to buy two hair dryers, hair products, artificial hair, hair locks, and hair extensions to improve her hair salon.

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.es:
Felizardo con 48 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos para su terreno de cultivo. De esta manera logrará mejores rendimientos en su cultivo.

Felizardo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Felizardo is 48 years old. He lives with his partner and their children in the district of Callayuc, province of Cutervo, departament of Cajamarca, in Perú.
He has great personal and work references from his neighbors. The members of this community mostly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.
He is a farmer, specifically coffee farmer, with 15 years of experience in the field. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his field. This way, he can get better results from the crops.
Felizardo is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 41-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married with four children. The oldest child is 19 while the youngest child is 7 years old. Her husband is a driver and Arlene is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been running this business for three years.

Arlene and her husband work together to provide the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them as well. In this way, Arlene will be able to improve her sales and augment her profit. In the future, she wants to expand this business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from farming rice and her clothing retail business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and spare parts for her tricycle.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en:
Doviko is a talented man of 50 years of age, living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with three children who all attend school. This makes him happy because he is sure that in future his children will get good qualifications to be able to compete for good jobs in this country. Doviko's main business is produce-selling alongside farming for additional income. He has been in the produce business since 2008, having started with an ambition of taking good care of his family.

Doviko is requesting a loan to buy a stock of maize to sell ahead of the peak season. The only problem affecting his business is high transport costs to transport his goods to his produce store.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
For 25 years, Carmen has earned a living by selling food (snacks) to the community of Mahaplag, Leyte. She and her family lived a simple life in that town. Carmen is a 59-year-old woman and has five children, who are already grown up.

Her goal in life is to is to start a small sari-sari store for additional income and for sustainability. With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and banana fruit. In this way, she will be able to improve her earnings and save money to start a store someday.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and banana fruit

loans.name: Willy Trinidad

texts.es:
Willy Trinidad con 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a prestar servicio como operario de construcción en esta misma zona, con una experiencia en el rubro desde más de 15 años. Cuenta con sus propios materiales de construcción. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo para dar mantenimiento a sus materiales de construcción, la cuál le generará ingresos.

Willy Trinidad no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Willy Trinidad is 42 years old. He is single and he lives with his family in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, departament of Lambayeque, in Perú. 
He has great personal and work references from his neighbors. The members of this community mostly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.
He works as a construction worker in the area with more than 15 years of experience in the field. He works with his own construction materials.
He is asking for a loan to pay for labor to maintain his construction materials and generate a better income.
Willy Trinidad has no other experiences with asking for loans. He is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to pay for labor to maintain his construction materials.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 22 years old, married to Felix and blessed with one child of 2 years. She has been into a salon business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more braids, weaves and hairpieces. She anticipates to save and help her husband in paying school fees for their child from the expanded business profits.

loans.use: to purchase braids and hair additions

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 42 years old and married with two children. Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Mylene has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 35-year-old married woman with 2 children, all living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She owns a bakery business where she works 12 hours a day, and has been doing this business for a period of 4 years. She started this business keeping in mind that she will be in a position to support her family and meet all the basic needs at home. She faces the challenge of her customers defaulting on her which delays the growth of her business. However, she is working very hard to make sure she builds a residential house for her children in the future and expand her business to new areas so as to raise more income.

Stella has asked for a loan to buy cooking oil, baking flour, and cassava flour as materials to use in her baking business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking flour, and cassava flour as materials to use in her baking business.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: Luz es una mujer soltera de 47 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia que lucha día a día por sacar a su hijo adelante,  ella es empleada en un restaurante y se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de cocina express (comidas rápidas) dictado en la corporación Interactuar, con el ánimo de capacitarse y mejorar en su profesión con el ánimo de en un futuro montar su negocio y generar mejores recursos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 47 years old, she is single, head of the family who fights every day to support her son. She works at a restaurant and she is asking for a loan to pay for an accelerated cooking class (quick meals) set up by Interactuar. She is excited about training to improve her skills with the goal of opening a business in the future and generate a better income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for an accelerated cooking class (quick meals)

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 31-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and is blessed with a two-year-old baby girl. Her husband is a driver and works hard to make a better living.

Eva helps her husband financially by doing a hog-raising business. She successfully started this business six years ago.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed as well. Daisy is still thinking of other business opportunities that will help augment their livelihood. In the future, she wants to expand their hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a woman with determination. She is 59 years old and a married woman. For more than 32 years, she has been engaged in basket making to help her husband to improve their financial stability. As well as this, her husband works hard as a vendor, and with great effort they have raised their big family. They have nine children — six adults and three school-aged children.

Now Elsa is thinking of other business opportunities to enhance their livelihood, so she is asking for a loan to buy a “pedicab” (a cycle rickshaw, which is moved by foot pedals). Aside from this, she and her husband will also buy raw materials for basket making; specifically, they will use rattan stem (rattan is a tropical palm). In this way, they will improve their earnings and be able to send her school-aged children to college in order to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for basket making, specifically rattan stem, and buy a pedicab.

loans.name: Stepanila

texts.en:
Stepanila is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. 

Her business is an agro vet shop. She has been in the business for 3 years. 

She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicken feeds, veterinary drugs and fertilizers for sale. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a big business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds, veterinary drugs and fertilizers for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Ester

texts.es:
Rosa está solicitando un nuevo crédito, ya que para ella es una herramienta muy útil con la que su negocio se fortalece en corto tiempo y también desea aprovechar la temporada navideña, lo invertirá en granos básicos, bebidas, condimentos, jugos, gaseosas, entre otros productos de la canasta básica para disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes y tener los recursos económicos para salir adelante con su familia.
Con el crédito anterior Rosa ha tenido un impacto positivo en el mejoramiento de su negocio, ha aumentado su clientela, a pesar de que las ventas tienen altas y bajas manifiesta que ha logrado tener estabilidad financiera, su familia se mantiene y comparten un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a new loan, because for her it is a very good tool to fortify her business in a short time. She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season. She will invest in basic grains, beverages, seasonings, juices, sodas, and more staple products to meet the needs of her customers and have the financial resources to get ahead with her family.

With the previous loan, Rosa has seen a positive impact on her business' improvement. She has increased her clientele. Despite sales having highs and lows, she says that she has been able to achieve financial stability. Her family is supported and they share a more decent lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, beverages, seasonings, juices, sodas, and other staple products to met the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman and has been blessed with one kid who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Lucy operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Lucy dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en: Chin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Chin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one youngest child in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo de 26 años de edad, vive al lado de su madre de avanzada edad y sus hermanos de 10 y 15 años de edad. Él es una persona muy responsable quien día con día se esfuerza en su trabajo para que a su familia no le falte nada. Y buscando la manera de poder mejorar su condición de vida Eliseo solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, caja térmica y demás herramientas para la instalación de energía eléctrica. Ya que su vivienda ha sido construida de manera muy humilde y aún no cuenta con este servicio el cual es muy importante e indispensable.
texts.en: Eliseo is 26 years old. He lives with his elderly mother and his 10 and 15 year old brothers. He is a very responsible person who works hard at his job day to day so that his family won't lack anything. Seeking a way to improve his living conditions,  Eliseo is asking for a loan FUSAI to invest in: electrical cables,a thermal protection box and other tools to install electricity. His house was built in a very humble way and it still does not have this very important and indispensable utility.

loans.use: to invest in electrical cables, a thermal protection device, and other tools to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 57-year-old married mother of eight. Five years ago, she started selling sports clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to develop her family's living conditions.

Today, Hiyam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house's roof before winter to make it waterproof. She hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her sports clothes warehouse to increase her income and stay capable of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house's roof before winter, to make it waterproof.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sold basic merchandise like biscuits, eggs,  noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is married woman  and has three children, whom one is still attending school.

She caters mostly neighbors in her place, where in her wati-sari (variety) store is located in front of her house. She  would like to improve her main source of income  to become more productive and improve the family’s living condition.

Veronica would like  to purchase additional groceries like soft drinks, rice, and beverages.
In that way she could felt financial again and start to expand her business to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like soft drinks, rice, and beverages.

loans.name: Rexes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rexes works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell chicken meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell frozen foods. Rexes is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional chicken meat to sell to her local market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rexes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional chicken meat to sell to her local market

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: With the previous loan, Victoria used it to purchase more maize seeds for planting. She is a farmer growing banana and operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour and fresh foods. Victoria also owns a bar that contributes more income for her family needs. She is facing challenges of price changes, limited capital and seasonality changes. However, she has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning and expanding her retail shop to new areas in order to raise  more income. Victoria has asked for another loan to weed, prune and add manure in her banana plantation.

loans.use: to  weed, prune and add manure in her banana plantation.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret a 47 year old married woman is a resident of Hoima District. She is in charge of taking care of 8 children of whom six are in school. She is into selling general merchandise at both retail and wholesale trading. To supplement her incomes, she deals in farming. Margret meets a difficulty of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to stock for the Christmas season.

That’s is why she is seeking for Kiva help through Hofokam to buy stock of beer, rice, cooking oil and others for selling this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer, rice, cooking oil and others for selling this Christmas season.

loans.name: Diane

texts.es:
Diane es una señora soltera dedicada a cuidar de su familia y atender a su propio negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad, ella tiene la responsabilidad de abastecer a su familia de alimentación, educación y vestuario, manifiesta haber fundado su negocio por iniciativa propia, lo atiende junto a una empleada de seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, su mayor ventaja es la experiencia que ha adquirido con el paso del tiempo.
Con la visión de atender a más clientes y generar mayores ganancias solicita un crédito con el que podrá realizar la compra de tomates, cebollas, pepinos, guineos, lichas, guayabas, aguacates, etc., para abastecer su negocio y abrir otro punto de venta, el riesgo de la inversión es que el producto es perecedero.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio con vida, lograr establecer el nuevo punto de venta y sobre todo apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Diane is single and she takes care of her family and runs a booth selling fruits and vegetables. She is mother to a 17-year-old and a 16-year-old. She is responsible to provide her family with food and clothes and an education. She says she set up her business on her own and she runs it with an employee from six in the morning until six in the evening. Her biggest advantage is the experience she has accumulated over the years.
With the vision to take care of more customers and generate a better income she is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, babanas, lichas, guayabas, avocados, to stock her business and open another booth. The only risk with this investment is that the products have a short shelf life.
Her dreams are to keep her business afloat, establish a new sales location and above all support her children to they can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, babanas, lichas, guayabas, avocados, to stock her business and open another booth

loans.name: Luis Genaro

texts.es: Genaro tiene 53 años de edad de estado civil soltero vive con su madre que tiene 78 años de edad hace diez años de dedica a la crianza de terneros pero también trabaja al jornal muy temprano se levanta todos los días a dejar los animales en el campo luego se va a trabajar. Genaro  con el dinero comprara una vacona obteniendo mejor utilidad para pagar la alimentación y  medicinas  de su madre de avanzada edad.
texts.en:
Genaro is 53 years old. He is single and he lives with his 78-year-old mother. He's been raising calves for 10 years, but he is also a day laborer who starts the day very early in the morning. He gets up every day to let the animals out in the field and then he goes to work.
Genaro will use this loan to buy a cow that can generate more money to pay for food and medication for his elderly mother.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin is 28 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his mother and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow different kinds of fruits. Roin sells the harvested fruits and generates income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 USD. With the received credit, he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. He will serve locals as a taxi driver and will generate a stable income.

Roin is very motivated and awaits your support to start his taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve locals as a taxi driver in order to generate income

loans.name: Anibal Rigoberto

texts.es: Aníbal tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil divorciado, tiene una hija Jennifer de 17 años de edad estudia en una unidad educativa del sector, es muy trabajador y responsable vive en el campo desde muy pequeño inicio con la crianza de terneros hoy Aníbal necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca lechera obtendría mejores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas del  hogar.
texts.en:
Anibal, age 52, is divorced. He has a daughter, Jennifer, who is 17 years old. She goes to a neighborhood school. He is very hard-working and responsible. He lives in the countryside. When he was very little he started raising calves.

Now Anibal needs the money to buy a dairy cow. He will get better earnings to cover the basic household necessities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre de 66 años de edad, pensionado el cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso dictado por la corporación Interactuar de cocina saludable.
Es muy consciente de su edad y quiere aprender a realizar preparaciones que ayuden a mantenerlo saludable, al igual que lo compartirá con su pareja e hijos para tratar de cambiar un poco los hábitos alimenticios y evitar tantos problemas que traen consigo una mala alimentación.
texts.en:
Hernán, age 66, is retired. He is requesting a loan to pay for a course on healthy cooking that is taught by the Interactuar corporation.

He is very aware of his age, and he wants to learn how to prepare food that will help him to stay healthy. He will share this with his life partner and his children in order to try to change their eating habits a little and avoid the many problems that come with bad eating habits.

loans.use: to pay for a healthy cooking course.

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije is very grateful to all the Kiva lenders for the previous loan that she was given. She was able to use the loan to purchase materials for her handicraft business and has already seen an increase in her client base and income. She has been very happy with her job and the results, being able to improve the living conditions for her family.

Now, she is requesting another loan for her same business in order to satisfy her client's needs once again. She has been very satisfied with the loan process and the improvements that have been made for her business already, and looks forward to having the same experience and results again. She thanks the Kiva lenders to be able to continue to expand her business, allowing her to provide a better life for her family. She appreciates the lenders for both of the loans.

loans.use: to buy material for making her handicraft items in order to satisfy her client's needs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock and sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and sell.

loans.name: Arisensio

texts.en:
Arisensio, aged 36, is a very hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

He deals in produce primarily buying and selling maize and beans on a small scale around Hoima town. As his main business, he has fetched an average income to support his family. In order to supplement his income, he carries out farming, predominantly growing beans, soybeans, and nuts among other items.

He desires to grow and expand his business so as to improve his family's standard of living but is limited by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. He is seeking a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ndeba

texts.en: Ndeba is a 28 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes and Irish potatoes on a large scale, he has been doing this since 2008 and is always in his business 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He started the business with a hope of raising more income for his family. He is challenged by price  and unpredictable weather changes. However, he is looking at constructing a permanent house at home. Ndeba has asked for a loan to help him  buy fertilizers and tomato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and tomato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus a resident of Hoima district is married with four children. He is involved in farming and bar business having started in 2006. His businesses have supported him in looking after his family and above all educating his children. As we approach the festive season, Justus is getting bookings for customers who want to get drinks from his bar. However, the money at hand is not enough to buy the required stock. He is thus asking for a Kiva loan through Hofokam to buy beers, wines, spirits and sodas among others to sell in his bar.

loans.use: to buy beers, wines, spirits and sodas among others to sell

loans.name: Pascalina

texts.en:
Pascalina is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a single mother of one child, who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, se siente muy agradecida por haberle apoyado con el crédito anterior, hoy en día su negocio mantiene la continuidad y le está dando mayores utilidades, además cuenta con clientes más satisfechos y fieles, además a incluido la venta de otros productos, su grupo familiar se mantiene y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar día con día.
Considerando que a su negocio lo visitan nuevos clientes debe mantener un inventario surtido, por lo que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que planea comprar pan, tomates, aderezos, lechuga, bebidas, etc., para preparar hamburguesas y panes con pollo.
texts.en:
Doris is very grateful for the support she received on her previous loan. Today, her business has been running strong and it has been really fruitful. She also has many satisfied and loyal customers and she's added new products for sale. Her family is going well and she hasn't had any problems working every day.
Given that she has new customers coming in all the time, she needs to keep the store stocked, so she decided to ask for a new loan to buy bread, tomatoes, spices, lettuce, drinks, etc., to make burgers and chicken sandwitches.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, spices, lettuce, drinks, etc., to make burgers and chicken sandwitches.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en: Long ’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Long  makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en: Kheang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kheang makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer and village coordinator to support his family. He has one youngest child in his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mirvete

texts.en:
Mirveta is a mother of three children between the ages of 9 and 11 years old. She lives in one of the minority communities, and like most of the people in these communities, life is very difficult. Although her husband works in construction, he has a very low salary and their living conditions are substandard. She used to have a greenhouse to plant vegetables such as peppers and tomatoes to use for her family's consumption and to sell at the market for extra income. However, from bad weather conditions, the greenhouse was destroyed and she has not been able to build a new one.

At this time she is requesting a loan in order to rebuild her greenhouse and be able to start planting vegetables again. She already knows from experience that she will be able to save money on her food bills and increase her income from the sales. This will allow her to be able to improve life for her family. She appreciates the help from the lenders to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to rebuild her greenhouse and be able to start planting vegetables and increase her income from the sales

loans.name: Manekto Group

texts.en:
The Manekto group is made up of six women who are neighbors. Oktofiana, 48, is standing on the left with the yellow shirt and has been appointed as the leader of the group. Oktofiana lives with her husband, Nikolas, a 51-year-old farmer, and is blessed with two children. One is married, and the second one, Ayu, 19, is still enrolled at college.

Oktofiana owns a business of producing and selling fried corn, and it has been running for the last three years. The income earned from this business allows her to support Nikolas in managing their living. She desires to enhance the stock of corn and sell petrol, as well.

One day, an account officer visited the village and introduced the group loan product from TLM. Six women, including Oktofiana, were interested and applied for a loan of totaling IDR 10,500,000 from TLM. She would like to buy corn in a larger quantity and a jerrycan of petrol. The other women also would like to invest their portion in their own business and other things.

Even though Kiva is a new thing for them, they are grateful that Kiva gives them a good chance for better lives and businesses ahead.

loans.use: to buy more corn and petrol.

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en: Roukaya is a 44-Year-old married woman living with her husband and four children, two of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family, He is a farmer and works as a constructor for extra money. With the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a heavy life and helped them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to be able to pay school educational fees for her children

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 20 years old. He was born in Imishli. Currrently his parents and elder brothers live there which is south part of Azerbaijan. His is the eldest amongst his siblings and wants to set an example for them. Ramil is student in Baku for 2 years now.

Ramil has specialized in Psychology. He wants to become a Psychologist and wants to be an expert in his field. There aren't many expert psychologists in Azerbaijan. Ramil loves this study and wants to be excellent there. He usually takes his teachers study materials seriously and get well-prepared for finals. Teachers are proud of him and always appreciate his hard work.

Ramil also set a target for himself for making his family proud of him. He has set his mind to make himself a carrier. Currently he has financial difficulty. He can't pay his tuition fees. He needs 1600 AZN loan. He hopes Kiva lenders will show him kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees for a BSc. in Psychology

loans.name: Nataly Judith

texts.es:
Nataly Judith con 26 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y su hija, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y bebidas como chicha,cerveza y gaseosa. Así mismo su esposo se dedica a conducir una mototaxi lo cuál genera ingresos a su hogar. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de calaminas,esteras y mobiliario para la mejora de su local, así como cascos de cerveza para atender incremento de demanda de bebidas frías en el local. con ello tendrá una mejor atención a sus clientes y así generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Nataly Judith con experiencia crediticia con bancos, con pagos puntuales.Es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Nataly Judith is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their daughter in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru. They live in an urban area. She has very good personal and work references from the area residents. The residents of this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

She mostly works selling prepared foods and beverages such as chicha, beer and sodas. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi, which generates income for the home. She is asking for the loan to invest in corrugated iron, matting and furniture to improve her locale. She will also invest in cases of beer to meet the increased demand for cold beverages in the business. With this, she will have better attention for her customers and thus generate income to improve her quality of life.

Nataly Judith has credit experience with banks, and has paid on time. She is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in buying corrugated iron, matting, and furniture to improve her locale.

loans.name: Edeline

texts.en:
Edeline has been a member of GDMPC for already seven years, and her previous loan was successfully paid.

She is a married woman and blessed with five children. Her husband is working in a neighboring town with a minimum salary. To help her husband to earn a living, she needs to look for additional income. Now, she has already 10 years experience in a tailoring business.

As the years go on, her customers are increasing in number. She needs additional funds to buy an additional sewing machine. She went to GDMPC to renew her loan amount to PHP 5,000.

Edeline aims to double her income from the business and make it big in the near future for her to continue providing for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Enilsa

texts.es:
Enilsa es una mujer de 32 años de edad la cual se encuentra solicitando su primer préstamo para estimular su profesión de cría de cerdos, ya que tiene su negocio muy caído debido a la falta de capital.
Ella es una mujer honesta y muy humilde que quiere salir adelante y aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
El dinero del préstamo será usado en la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde ya que lo alimenta con sobras de comida.
Espera que con la inversión su negocio crezca y pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Enilsa is 32 years old. She is asking for her first loan to boost her job raising pigs, as business has been really slow due to her lack of funds.
She is very honest and humble and she wants to get ahead and have a better quality of life.
She will use this loan to buy pigs and fattening feed as she is currently feeding them scraps. She hopes to grow her business with this investment so she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and fattening feed as she is currently feeding them scraps to improve her sales

loans.name: Indra

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! This is Indra, one of Ruma's agents. Together with his wife, they live in Bekasi, the satellite city located at the east of Jakarta. 

As the head of the family, his main source of income comes from the small stall he manages that sells mobile phone airtime credits and accessories. He decided to join Ruma last year so he can learn about how to manage a business better.

As the business runs bigger, Indra hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more of mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Uslizar plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he serves, such as e-commerce for low income communities, a Ruma latest product called Mapan. Indra is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en: Drita wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous two loans. She has been able to consistently improve her living conditions for her family through the support of the lenders. Recently, she has added one more business, selling used clothing in a market together with her husband. They are able to purchase clothing at cheap prices and then sell the clothing in a market for a profit. For the third time, she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the second hand clothing to resell. She is hoping that working with her handicraft business and selling the clothing, she will be able to provide a much better life for her children, being able to afford better education and improve their standards of living. She promises to pay on time again and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the second hand clothing to resell  to provide better children education and improve the standards of living

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Bahlul is 20 years old. His family of parents live in Imishli and doesn't have any siblings. Bahlul is a student at university and it is his second year. His family love him a lot and they miss him. Sometimes he himself becomes homesick but he is passionate about studies.

He studies in Baku. He comes home on holidays and sometimes for weekends and during this time he helps his family with farming. Bahlul has one aim in life to become a great Sociologist. He knows that it an ambitious target, but he studies hard and fights for his principles in life. He is very studious and always reads additional materials, searches on internet about new things and also is a very sociable personality. He prepares for classes everyday and makes his professors both amazed and proud. He is believed that to become a great sociologist because he shows great enthusiasm. He is taking his studies on this subject very seriously and also has great ambition.

Bahlul knows that a growing Azerbaijan requires great professionals in every field. The success of a nation is through knowledge and educated people. He tries his best for this purpose. Currently due to family's difficulty he needs 1500 AZN. This amount he will use for paying the tuition fees. He is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: paying his university tuition fees, for a BSc. in Sociology

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old she is single, living with her parents. Nancy invested some money and she paid for the construction of a new room for herself.

Nancy is a farmer and she sells flowers such as roses, so she goes to many fairs to offer her products and seeds. Nancy helps her parents at the farm, so she needs a loan to buy cattle for the family business. She hopes you can help her She is at her parents house in the picture

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 44-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three children aged 16, 15 and 9 years.

Her husband works hard as a painter while Susana runs a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. She has been running this for two years.

She is asking for a loan to improve her store. She will buy grocery items such as noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

In the future, Susana wishes to expand her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has three children, ages 18, 19, and one adult. To earn a living, Clotilde is running a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy additional goods to increase her sales.

Clotilde will buy drinks, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, salt, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, and juice. Clotilde is a woman who dreams of a good life for her family. She wants to have enough money to send her children to school and see them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy drinks, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, salt, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

loans.name: Nowerine

texts.en:
Nowerine is asking for a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell in her boutique. She is married with two children, living in Hoima, Uganda. Feeling she needed to develop herself and the family in general, she engaged in business and has no regrets since she has achieved a lot.

Nowerine serves men and women in her area and has a vision of buying a new plot to construct a dream family house. Her business is affected by bad debtors who fail to pay her on time yet she wants to reinvest the funds. Nowerine will be grateful if her request is granted.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell in her boutique

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old, married, and she has twelve children.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old and married with one child. Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, etc.

Cristina has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en:
Kwaku is in his late 30s. He is married with two children in school. He has been running a car radiator store for four years now. He works from 6am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kwaku fifth loan from ID-Ghana. He will use this loan to buy stock of car radiators in his store. He dreams of expanding his business into a distribution platform thus wholesale bases.

Kwaku will share this loan with his loan group Yehowada which consists of three members with him included, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of car radiators for his store.

loans.name: Madline

texts.en:
Madline is a widow with three children and one of them attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to start a new business of selling poultry with the loan she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her new business.She decided to join yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her new business

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. She is a housewife taking care of her children, and her husband is covering their needs. He works in the agriculture field.

Due to their hard financial situation, she is in need to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school registration fees. She said that she is very happy and eager always to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay school registration fees.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man aged 40 living in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in clothing sales. In order to supplement his income, he ventured into the farming of beans and maize so as to raise more income for his family and to have more food security in his village and the areas surrounding him.

He started business in 2001 on realizing a need to supplement his income. His dream is to develop and expand his business so as to improve the standards of living of his family.

He is seeking a loan to buy more clothes to sell. However, high rental fees and stiff competition affect his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, 49 years old, has been making amakan (bamboo) matting for many years now. Amakan matting is used mainly for walls in native houses in the Philippines. Patricia is a married woman and has a 12-year-old child. Together with her family, she resides in the rural town of Batuan.

Patricia is asking for a Kiva loan to purchase more stock of bamboo . She would like to boost her business and also improve her weekly production. In this way, she could make bulk purchases on materials needed. Her earnings would augment and she could continue to seek ways to become more sustainable.

Patricia is determined that she could be more productive to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more  stock of bamboo for her weaving.

loans.name: Shallon

texts.en:
Shallon owns a bar in Hoima district as her only source of income. Her age is 38 and she is married with three children, two of whom attend school. Having ventured into business so as to earn a living and for family development, Shallon complains of high competition and high rental fees.

Shallon's business dream is to expand her business as well as stock enough for the Christmas season. Her family dream is to educate her children to the desired level. She requests a loan to buy sodas and beers for sale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her village. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a divorced woman staying with her three children . She owns a house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food . 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of charcoal  in the village. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Hasije

texts.en:
Hasije is a very lovely woman living in the southern part of Kosovo. She is a mother of four children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. Hasije loves her children very much and works hard to give them a better education and a much better future. Although her husband works as a construction worker, his salary is not enough for their family to meet their needs and provide better opportunities.

In the past, Hasije had kept a cow to sell and use the milk and dairy products. However, she had to sell the cows during a time which her husband was not able to work and they had no income. Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan to purchase a milking cow. She is very happy for this opportunity to be able to sell milk again and to generate income for her family. She is very grateful to have the support of the lenders and looks forward to giving her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow to sell its milk and increase her income to give her children a better education

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana is 33. She is married with an 8-year-old daughter. Maryana sells plastic bags wholesale in Pavlograd. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Maryana uses a vehicle to move around from business to business offering and selling her merchandise to different enterprises.

Maryana is planning to use 10 000 Grivnyas to buy an additional batch of disposable plastic bags wholesale for further retail sale to various ventures in her home town. Maryana says that it always hits her business the hardest when they lose a wholesale buyer. However, there are usually other potential customers who step in and help her business balance out fast.

loans.use: to buy an additional batch of disposable plastic bags wholesale for further retail sale to various ventures

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 25 years old married lady from Busia Kenya. Her spouse provides additional family income.

For the past two years Sarah's poultry business has gone very well. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business.

Sarah will use the loan to purchase feed for her poultry, and use the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

Sarah hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 57 years old and supports his family of six. He is married to Winfred, who also provides income, and they are blessed with four children who are grown ups.

Joseph sells tea leaves and has been in business for the last 15 years, doing very well. He is requesting his first loan with Visionfund Kenya to purchase more tea leaves to sell which eventually will help him realize his goals. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase food for the family and the pay back the loan.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves.

loans.name: Sube

texts.en:
As a previous member of Gata Daku MPC, Sube is planning to expand her business by being funded again. Sube, 38 years old, is a hardworking woman; she is married, has two children, and lives in San Juan Pana-on (a village where the main livelihood is farming). Her husband is also a farmer.

Sube helps her husband to earn a living, so she decided to plant bananas. Their business is already 15 years in existence and makes a profit of P5,000 per month. This income is not enough for them so Sube plans to have a bigger area to plant more banana trees so that she can continue to send her children to school. Her huge problem is she needs additional funds to buy fertilizers and seedlings. For this reason, she came to Gata Daku MPC to ask for help. She applied for a loan amounting to P7,000.

Sube’s main objective is to help her husband to earn a living for them so they can continue sending their children to school. She aims to have another piece of land for the expansion of her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock to meet high demand. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and increase storage space. He hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and increase storage space

loans.name: Semy

texts.en:
Semy works hard to support her family. Semy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Semy has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Semy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 54-year-old married mother of eight children, one still in school.

Rosalia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fees and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalia has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lordielyn

texts.en:
Lordielyn works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lordielyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency.

Lordielyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is 57 year old woman who lives with her husband in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region.

Leyli graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute. Starting from 1985 till today she works at the school as a teacher of physics.

Leyli has two daughters and a son; all of them are already married and live separately with their families.

Leyli’s husband is employed but he has health problems and he stays at home now.

With this loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams Leyli urgently asks that you help solve her beloved husband’s health problems.

loans.use: to pay medical bills for her beloved husband.

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.en:
Arlindo lives in Liquisa and most of his daily income comes from welding in his workshop.

He is applying for a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve his business.

Arlindo will use this loan to buy other materials to keep in his workshop such as angle steel, carbide welding, transformer, drilling machines, oils and other materials.

He started his business a few years ago, with his own capital.

Arlindo is happy with the loan, because he can improving his business.

loans.use: to buy angle steel, carbide welding, transformer, drilling machines, oils and other materials to use.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en:
Shatha is a 21-year-old single Jordanian lady. She lives with her parents who cooperate together and represent the main ‎source of income. Shatha is still attending university majoringing in Accounting. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of ‎her family members.

Today she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner to pay her university educational fees. She ‎said that she is very happy with the loan that will allow her to continue her education suitably.‎

loans.use: to pay for her university fees for a degree in Accounting

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en: Sokorn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokorn makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs. She also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Her's Group

texts.en: Her’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Her does work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is responsible mother of 4 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Robina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Robina also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Orn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Orn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 28, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a general store in their village for almost three months and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to inadequate capital, Grace would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase additional grocery items and food items to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and food items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie runs a sari-sari (convenience) store. Availing loans has been a typical practice for small business entrepreneurs like Elsie.

You can never improve your business without getting into credits, unless you have enough capital or investments. Elsie paid all her loans availed through CCT and she is very confident when applying for new ones.

She would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy assorted grocery items, toiletry products and beverages to increase her income.

Elsie believes that you will never fail her request. Once she gets the assistance, she assures that she will repay you in due time.

Elsie aims to give her children the best for their future. She dreams to expand her business and hoped for continuously flourishing profits.

She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marigie

texts.en:
Marigie manages a variety store for a living. While her husband, Clint, works as warehouse man to support their everyday needs.

Marigie continues to develop her variety store business and has applied for PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional dry goods, beverages and sacks of rice.

She anticipates an increase in sales and profits from these additional supplies.

Marigie hopes that all her income will pave the way for the completion of her children’s education and enable them to have a more comfortable life in the future.

Marigie is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods, beverages and sacks of rice to refill her store.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. She is single with one child, and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Ruby requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, beans, carrots, potato and other spices to sell in her store.

Ruby has been in this business for 10 years and also earns income from food vending and from her general store.

In the future, Ruby would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her store.

loans.name: Glory Jen

texts.en:
Glory Jen works hard to support her family. Glory Jen is married and has a oyster farm business in the Philippines.

Glory Jen is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Glory Jen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 39 years old and lives with her parents in Sevan city, Gegharkunik region. Naira has receved a higher education having graduated from Yerevan State University with a degree in mathematics.

Since 1998, she has worked as a teacher of mathematics and informatics. In her family, her father is employed as a driver. Naira is very worried about her mother’s health because she feels weak.

Naira is very hopeful that these problems are not very serious one and everything can be solved. With this Kiva loan of 1,400,000 Armenian drams, Nair hopes to treat her mother’s health problems.

loans.use: to treat her mother’s health problems.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a very hard working married man who lives in Hoima Uganda. He started his business of operating a drug shop to support his family. For an extra income, he ventured into selling of beers and sodas. He desires to expand and develop his business however; inadequate capital hinders the attainment of his desires. He is seeking for loan facility to buy more drugs for selling.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for selling.

loans.name: Horch's Group

texts.en: Horch’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Horch works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso operates a tricycle (rickshaw), a mode of transporting passengers in his town. He is married and has seven children. Three of them attend school. His family resides in Talibon, Bohol.

Celso faces a financial crisis at the moment that could prevent from supporting his livelihood.

Celso join CEVI to access loan. He wants to purchase motorcycle parts like a tire,sprocket and oil.

The loan could help him boost his income and offer comfort and safety to his passengers.

Thus, Celso is grateful to Kiva for the support, and in return he is doing his best to continue investing other sources of income to become sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts and oil.

loans.name: Rinat

texts.en:
Rinat is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband.

Her husband owns a shop in his town and Rinat has worked as a private teacher in her home since 2014. She is still studying and focusing on her education.

Today, in order to pay her university registration fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, Rinats plans to take out more Kiva loans to continue her education

loans.use: to pay her University registration fees.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are presently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Juana Carolina

texts.es:
Juana, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su negocio es muy amplio, tiene una venta de bisutería, matatas, lociones, relojes entre otros productos de fácil comercialización, además se dedica a cantar en eventos especiales, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, lo fundo hace 7 años, pero lo administra personalmente desde hace 2 años, ella es una joven trabajadora que se esmera por mantener su negocio y así tener ingresos para pagarse sus estudios.
Con el préstamo podrá comprar bisutería, lociones, cosméticos, cuadernos, libros, prendas de vestir, etc., su objetivo es incorporar nuevos productos para aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos, espera recuperar la inversión y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son culminar sus estudios, convertirse en una microempresaria reconocida y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juana is single and lives with her parents. Her business is ample: she sells jewelry, tote bags, lotions, and watches, among other products that are easy to sell. She also makes a living singing at special events, which she learned from her parents who started it 7 years ago, and which she took over 2 years ago. Juana is a young hard worker who strives to maintain her business so she can pay for her studies.

With this loan she will be able to buy jewelry, lotions, cosmetics, books, clothing, etc. Her goal is to increase her inventory to increase her sales and income, and she aims to pay pack the loan on time.

Her dreams are to complete her studies, and become a renowned small business owner and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, lotions, cosmetics, notebooks, books, clothing, etc. to add more products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María, le gusta como es atendida en la institución y por el apoyo que se le brinda cuando lo necesita, hace una nueva solicitud de capital con el que podrá comprar variedad de ropa para que sus clientes puedan encontrar lo que están buscando y así ella también tendrá los ingresos económicos para subsistir, espera tener mayores en ventas en las fechas de fin de año.
Con el aporte económico que le dan los créditos María ha podido presentar un inventario más surtido a sus clientes, sus ingresos son más estables y su familia cuenta con mejor alimentación.
texts.en:
Maria, who is grateful for the institution and for the support it offers when needed, is requesting a new loan with which she will buy a variety of clothes so that her customers can find what they are looking for and so that she can have enough income to support herself. She hopes to have increased sales during the end of year holidays.

With the financial support from the loans, Maria will be able to have an increased inventory for her customers, her revenues will be more stable, and she will provide her family with better food and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes so that her customers can find what they are looking for.

loans.name: Dern's Group

texts.en:
Dern’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Dern makes a living cultivating rice and he also is a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as time and fuel boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
