loans.name: Phoun's Group

texts.en:
Phoun’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Phoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and in security to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
En el año 2012 inició el sueño como empresaria independiente de la señora Carmen, ella monto un negocio de manicura y pedicura con la ilusión de generar buenos recursos para mantener su hogar conformado por ella y sus dos hijos de 11 y 15, es una madre cabeza de familia, luchadora, protectora, celosa, que entrega todo de sí para ganar los recursos con los que alimenta a su familia.
El principal deseo de Carmen es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y no dejar que en su casa pasen necesidades.
Carmen se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para mejorar el confort de su negocio, por ello el dinero será para la compra de un televisor LCD, tratamientos y un sofá de espera, buscando mejorar la comodidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In 2012, Carmen began her dream of becoming an independent entrepreneur. She started a manicure and pedicure business with the goal of earning a good income to support her household, which is composed of herself and her two children, ages 11 and 15. She is a female head of household, a fighter, protector, and vigilant, who gives it her all to get the resources to feed her family.

Her main wish is to be able to pay for the education of her children and not allow her home to want for anything.

Carmen is requesting this loan to improve the comfort of her business. The money will allow her to do this in purchasing an LCD television, hair treatments, and a waiting room sofa in order to improve her clients' comfort.

loans.use: to buy an LCD television, hair treatments, and a waiting room sofa to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.name: Judis Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Judis una madre de familia, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 4 y 1 años de edad, es su familia representan absolutamente todo en sus vidas, ella quiere trabajar, progresar, generar buenos ingresos para asegurar su educación y construir un camino de progreso para su amada familia.
Se dedica a la cría de aves y ganado porcino, con esta actividad espera cumplir sus objetivos y de su parte pondrá el máximo esfuerzo porque así sea.
Judis solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con cerdos y aves, principalmente cerdos ya que obtuvo buenas ventas y quedo sin animales y espera estar preparada para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
This is Judis, the mother of a family. She has 4 children who are 11, 9, 4 and 1. The family means everything to one another. She wants to work, progress, generate good income to ensure their education, and build a road of progression for her beloved family. She makes a living by raising poultry and pigs. Through this work, she hopes to reach her objectives, and she will make every effort so that it can be that way.

Judis is requesting a loan to stock her business with pigs and chickens, primarily pigs. She needs to do this since she had good sales and ran out of animals, and she hopes to be prepared for the year-end season.

loans.use: to stock her business with pigs and chickens, primarily pigs, since she had good sales and ran out of animals.

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 32 years old and married with four children. In the photo, she is the only one who has papers in her hands. She owns a general business and this is her 10 years selling beans and sorghum. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily.

Beatha is a leader of this group, which is called ABIZERANYE. Beatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantities of beans and sorghum for sale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, reinvest in her business, and to be able to expand her general store by buying various and more new stores.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantities of beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Msangani Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu who is in her mid 30's is single with two schooling children. She has been selling fried chicken for ten years. She works from 9 am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on chicken supplies, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of finishing building her own house.

Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group Msangani which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on chicken supplies, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en: Batoul is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and one child, still attending school. Her husband works as an agriculture always ready to ensure his family a good life. Today, Batoul looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child educational fees. This is her first loan from Kiva and definitely, she eager to take additional loans in the future that will help her to ensure them a good education path.

loans.use: to pay her child educational fees.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells beverages and confectioneries. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of products. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beverages and confectioneries. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages and confectioneries

loans.name: Airis

texts.en:
Airis is a 36-year-old lady supporting eight people in her family. She has a beauty salon, a business she has been running for the last eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 35,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of salon hair products and accessories. She will use the anticipated profit to invest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of salon hair products and accessories

loans.name: Zivana

texts.en:
Zivana wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan that she was given. With the support of the lenders and the loan, she was able to purchase the tractor tools to make working much more effective and efficient and thereby increase her family's income. Zivana and her husband are still working on their land and involved in agriculture.

She is requesting a loan again to purchase wheat seeds and artificial guano. She hopes that this loan will help her to be able to generate more income again as she will be able to continue to use her land in ways to save money on her family's food costs and to earn profit selling the crops. She promises to pay on time again and appreciates Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and artificial guano to continue to use her land in ways to save money on her family's food costs and to earn profit selling the crops

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a married man with four children. He practices farming, mainly growing tea in Hoima-Uganda.

Upon realizing the need for setting up a stable income-generating activity, he ventured into business in 2013. His business is exposed to unfavorable weather conditions, yet he desires to expand and develop it more. Yahaya is requesting a loan to set up a banana plantation

loans.use: to set up a banana plantation

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 45 years old, married and has four children. One child is still in school.

Ma. Theresa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it.

Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: Sambath’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sambath makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a resident of Clarin, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and a food vending business to sustain her family.

Marcelina has been in business for 20 years with the help of her husband. Marcelina wants to operate this business continuously because this business is their main source of income.

That is why, she is asking for a loans to help her buy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, powdered juice and snack foods for her store.

Aside from this, Marcelina will buy food ingredients such as flour, rice, banana fruit, cooking oil and sugar. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and augment their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, cooking oil and other items to sell.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak  is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. Rabab provides her family with extra financial support due to her work in the agriculture sector since 2009. Malak  is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.to purchase new merchandise to her project such as seeds, seedlings for plantings... Her loan will help her improve her productivity. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits in the future

loans.use: to purchase new seedlings for her project.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 35-year-old married with 5 children from Sangay Daku, Ozamis City. Marilyn owns and operates rental transportation services to make a living.

Marilyn also manages their own farm, harvesting coconut for sale and making coconut shells into charcoal. Recently, she borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase spare parts for motor maintenance. She hopes that with this business, they can provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor maintenance.

location.town: sangay daku, ozamiz city, Mis. Occ

loans.name: Ma. Andrea

texts.en:
Ma. Andrea has run her catering business for five years now. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy materials like a food processor which she needs for the business. Ma. Andrea wants to improve her business, for she wants to ensure a better life for her family. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time in the amount of PHP 50,000, to pay for the reconstruction of her workplace, to purchase equipment like rice cooker, food keepers, gas stove, etc. and buy raw ingredients needed to make more food choices.

In the next few years, Ma. Andrea wants to see her catering business thrive, for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes also to have her own space where she can sell her products at the same time.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back their micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for workplace reconstruction and purchase equipment and ingredients needed for her catering.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, and married with one child.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, and she fattens pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her husband live in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Their children are already married and they live with their families.

Karine has a higher education; she graduated from State University in the department of Biochemistry. She works at the school as a teacher of chemistry, and already has 25 years of pedagogical experience.

Karine is a very clever and patient teacher who manages her work with great love and care in a way that her pupils mostly have good results and scores in their studying. She also offers paid private courses in chemistry to pupils who need to pass the entrance exams.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian Drams will help Karine to purchase a computer, accessories for it, and professional literature since she needs these for teaching and self-development.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, accessories for it, and professional literature since she needs these for teaching and self-development.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha greatly thanks for his first Kiva loan which was great and supporting and he is more than sure that his second partnership will be very profitable. Seryozha in the frontier village Azatamut of the Tavush region and here he lives with his wife. Both of they are engaged in farming and agriculture. In his farm he has cows, bulls, chickens, turkeys and also beehives. Agricultural works are also very developed in his farm where he cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, greens, onions, apples, plums, figs, pears, and peaches. This nice and very tasty assortment of fruits and vegetables Seryozha sells at the city wholesale market at a rented stall.

Seryozha now decided to have a farm specialized in swine breeding and he greatly relies on Kiva lenders’ support. With this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams Seryozha wants to buy piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Avdyl

texts.en:
Avdyl is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for his previous loan. He still earns a living by collecting plastic and iron that he sells to a factory as recycling. He has a van that he uses to transport all of his collection, but it is in need of service and he is not able to afford it on his own.

Avdyl is now requesting a loan to service the van and to purchase a scale to weigh his recycling. This second loan will ensure that he can continue to collect and transport his goods without any interruption in service or income and the scale will help him to accurately determine the weight of his goods and the fees that he should receive from the factory. Avdyl works hard to provide his family with a better standard of living and promises to repay his loan on time. He appreciates the lenders and their support.

loans.use: to service his van and to purchase a scale to weigh his recycling.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lina Tantely

texts.fr:
Lina Tantely est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est tireur de pousse-pousse dans le village. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont âgés de 16, 15, et 10 ans et ils tous scolarisés dans une école privée .  
L’activité est la vente de légumes depuis 8 années  Les prêts antérieurs lui ont permis de développer cette activité. C’est la principale activité. Elle cherche toujours à développer cette activité ainsi qu’à la diversification des sources de revenus d’où cette demande de sixième prêt.  Les oies sont destinées à être vendus après engraissement à la fête de  noël et de fin d’année.  Elle travaille dur car l’approvisionnement en légumes se fait chaque jour et très tôt le matin, à 4h du matin.   
Le couple prévoit  la construction d’une maison car  il vit actuellement dans une maison appartenant à ses parents.
texts.en:
Lina Tantely is a hard-working and resourceful mother who is 38 years old. She is married, and her husband is a rickshaw driver in the village. The couple has three children who are 10, 15, and 16 years old. They all go to school in a private school.

Lina Tantely has sold vegetables for eight years.

Previous loans have developed this business, which is her primary work. [However,] she is always seeking to expand by diversifying her sources of revenue. And it is for this reason, she is seeking this sixth loan.

The geese will be sold after she fattens them for Christmas and the New Year.

She works hard, because she buys vegetables very early, at 4 a.m.

The couple wishes to build their own house, because now they live in a house owned by their parents.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and geese.

loans.name: Thesa

texts.en:
Thesa is a 27-year-old woman who is married to Lazarus, a 47 year old laborer. They are blessed with 4 children, 2 attend elementary school. Thesa is a housewife who looks after her children every day. She decided to help her husband to make money to better meet their needs.

She started a home-based business to sell mobile phone credits. This business also allows her to look after her children. She invested 500,000 IDR and bought credit 5,000, 10,000 and 20,000. The business is profitable and going well. She wants to buy larger credit which is 50,000, 100,000 and the electricity credit voucher to meet customer demands.

A neighbor who has received a loan from TLM suggested that she contact TLM. She thought this is a good opportunity for her to improve her business. She requests a loan of 2,000,000 IDR from TLM. She thanked for Kiva who also helps people served by TLM. She believes the loan from Kiva benefit her business.

loans.use: to buy the mobile phone credit and the electricity credit voucher.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 19-year-old married Lebanese woman. She is living with her husband and still attending school. Her husband is the main income earner in the family and works to satisfy her needs and to always be ready to fulfill her demands.

Due to their difficult financial situation, today, Najwa is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy her school stationary. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering her school fees.

loans.use: to buy her school stationary.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 22-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and two children. She’s cooperating with her husband in order to satisfy their family needs.

As for her, she started her work in agriculture seven years ago. Today, Zahraa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase new merchandise such as seeds, seedlings for plantings, etc. ... in order to improve her business and increase her productivity.

Zahraa has big responsibilities and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and enlarge her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as seeds, seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 47-year-old man supporting 6 people, and he is married to Celestine who also provides additional income. They are blessed with 4 children who are grown ups.

He sells plastic chairs a business he has been doing for the last 7 years very well. He is requesting for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more stock of tea leaves which eventually make him realize his goals.

He will use the anticipated profit to purchase food for the family and the rest to pay back the loan.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tea leaves which eventually help him achieve his goals

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 41-year-old man from Kisumu, married and supporting six people in his family. He operates a motorcycle transport business and he has been doing this for the last three years. He makes a monthly income of KES 30,000; he has applied for his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to purchase new tracker to help him secure the motorcycle from theft.

He is planning to use he anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase tracker line which will help him in securing the motorbike

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives alone in the village Chapni of Syunik region and he is not married. He used to work at different places and workshops, but now his only occupation is farming and agriculture. He has cows, calves, chickens, and also beehives. He owns a large plot of land where he cultivates potatoes, beans, cabbage, and onions, which--with the sale of his orchard harvest (apples, pears, and nuts)--brings him a good income.

Ararat sells a lot of milk, meat, eggs, and very tasty honey right from his farm and in this way earns a living. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Ararat plans to purchase two calves and fodder for all his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder for all his cattle.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 65 years old, and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Amelita aspires to save enough money in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 55 years old, and married with one child.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, and she fattens pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Letecia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana está haciendo la solicitud de un nuevo financiamiento para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año, comprara kits de lociones,  cremas corporales, cosméticos y otros productos de revista que sus proveedores anuncian en oferta, espera adquirir la mercadería a un precio más bajo y así aumentar sus utilidades para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Al utilizar el crédito anterior en la compra de cosméticos, enchape y lociones, ha mantenido la actividad de su negocio y a tiende a sus clientes de inmediato, su estabilidad económica se mantiene por la buena administración de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is applying for a new loan to make the most of the end-of-year demand for her merchandise.  She will buy lotions, body creams, cosmetics and other catalog merchandise that suppliers are now advertising for sale.  She hopes to buy the merchandise at a good price and sell at a profit.  

Ana used a past loan to stock her business with cosmetics and other merchandise.  The investment allowed her to deliver the products her customers wanted immediately.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamia is a 67-year-old pensioner from the Ozurgeti district. He has a large family: a wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow, a calf and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow mandarin and nut trees. Mamia sells the seasonally harvested fruits to generate income.

Mamia decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a used minibus and will start trading fruits and vegetables. This will give him a chance to increase his family's income, and with an increased income, he will improve the living conditions of his family. Mamia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a used minibus and start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Sobia has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house and has two years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her by purchasing goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. Her husband appreciates for her efforts.

Sobia wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. Sobia thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders, and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Redemtta

texts.en:
Redemtta is a thirty-five-year-old lady, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from enterprise development, savings and financial management training.

She operates a grocery shop and also farms maize and beans to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan to expand her farming by buying hybrid seeds that will help boost her harvest. She will also buy more stock of kales, cabbages and fruits. She looks forward to more sales thus more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to provide better food for her family. 

 Redemtta is appreciative of Kiva and its lenders for the great help and promise to repay her loans well.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and add stock to her grocery store by buying kales,cabbages and fruits hence more income to provide better food for her family

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started with her own working capital. Now she is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to improve her business.

She has a kiosk in front of her house, and she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy additional supplies with the loan, including sardines, noodles, soaps, cooking oils, sauces, milk, eggs, slippers, candles, soft drinks and other things to sell. She will improve her management with this loan.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, soaps, cooking oils, sauces, milk, eggs, slippers, candles, as well as soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43 year-old lady, and she is blessed with five children. She joined Hand Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

She practices maize and bean farming. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, which will help in improving her productivity. She says that this will help support her family’s basic needs, such as food and clothing.

She is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nirina Lalaina Arivola

texts.fr:
Nirina est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de sécurité. Ils ont trois filles. Elles sont âgées de 19 ans, 10 ans et 8 ans, et scolarisées dans une école catholique. 
Nirina est vendeuse de volaille. Elle a exercé cette activité depuis 1995. Elle a hérité cette activité de ses parents. A de cause son mari qui est infidèle et ne donne qu’une partie de son salaire à sa famille, elle doit travailler dur pour subvenir à toutes les charges familiales et l'éducation de ses enfants. 
Heureusement, qu'elle est propriétaire de son domicile et ne paie pas de loyer. Mais elle a quand même pour objectif d’acquérir un terrain afin d’y construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nirina is a courageous and hard-working woman, who is 37 years old. She is married to a security agent. She has three daughters, aged 8, 10, and 19 years old. They attend a catholic school.

Nirina works selling poultry. She has been doing this from 1995, when she inherited the business from her parents.

Because her husband is unfaithful and only gives some of his salary to his family, Nirina must work to support all the family's needs and her children's education.

Luckily, she owns her home and does not pay rent. But she still has the goal of buying some land to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry: ducks, geese, roosters, and chickens.

loans.name: Rochel

texts.fr:
Rochel est un père de famille consciencieux et responsable de 34 ans. Il est marié et a deux enfants de 8 et 1 ans. L'ainé seulement va à l'école actuellement et dans une école primaire privée.
Il est fabricant de tapis et il les tisse à partir des bouts de tissus qu'il achète en kilo. Il en est à son 2eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Avant, il tenait un stand de "kafe sy mofo". Le couple travail ensemble dans la fabrication de tapis. 
Il est propriétaire de son domicile et a pour objectif de développer son activité et aussi de construire une maison dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Rochel is an attentive and responsible father of a family, who is 34 years old. He is married and has two children, who are one and eight years old. Only the eldest is going to school, in a private school.

Rochel makes rugs, and he weaves them from scraps of fabric that he buys by the kilogram. He is on his second loan with CEFOR.

Before, he ran a "kafe sy mofo" stand.

He and his wife work together to make rugs.

Rochel owns his own home, and his goal is to develop his business and build another house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric scraps to weave rugs.

loans.name: Layka

texts.en:
Layka is a 61-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and working brother. She is the main income source for the family and she states that she works resolutely to provide her family with the bare minimum needs of life.

For the past two years, Layka has worked from her home, cutting bread and preparing homemade foods. Now, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a bread-cutting machine and purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments, etc. in order to increase her sales and her revenue. In the future, she plans to apply for additional Kiva loans to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a bread-cutting machine and purchase more food provisions.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a 54-year-old widowed mother of four, who has been working for fifteen years in selling fruits and vegetables to raise and educate her children, hoping that she can manage to be a successful hardworking father and the caring mother at the same time.

She is a Palestinian refugee, who is working hard to improve her beloved family's living, who were born and living in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Palestinian's social and financial living isn't encouraging in Lebanon, they can barely get the necessary standards of living. She is their main supporter and hopes that they can make all their dreams come true.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her son's travelling expenses, seeking a better living. She knows that being apart from him will hurt her a lot, but knowing that he is a successful means a lot to her.

loans.use: to pay for her son's travelling abroad expenses, seeking a better living

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 44-year-old divorced woman and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Ten years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh," or preserved foods, to cover her needs and expenses. She is well-known in her region for her broad experience in this domain. She learned to prepare "Mouneh" from her mother.

Today, Dalia is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy herbs, blossoms, and sage leaves, in addition to jars to conserve her production. Dalia hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy herbs, blossoms, and sage leaves, as well as jars for the preserved foods she makes.

loans.name: Terrous Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single woman in her early 30's with one school-aged child. She has run a poultry business for ten years and works from 5.30 am to 10 pm daily. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rosemary's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to purchase additional chicks. She has managed to successfully repay the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees for her child, repay the loan and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy chicks, medicine, and chicken feed. She dreams of expanding her business.

Rosemary will share this loan with her loan 3-member group TERROUS who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, medicine, and feed.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 30-year-old man who supports his 8-member family. He has been a carpenter for 8 years and earns 7000 KES per month.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase carpentry materials for his clients.

He will use the anticipated profit to re-invest in the business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to take subsequent loans and stabilize his business and family.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 27 years old and supports eight people in his family. He has a stall where he sells secondhand and ready-made clothes, a business he has been doing for the last eight years. He gets a monthly income of KES 35,000.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase more clothes.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 39 years old, married to Emily, and blessed with three children between the ages of 2 and 10 years old. He has been in the retail business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 22,000.

This being his third loan with VisionFund Kenya, Noah intends to purchase additional household goods for his retail shop. He plans to save, repay his loan, and buy food with his expanded business profits. His future dream is to open up a supermarket in Kapsabet town.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Mildred. She operates her own sari-sari store (a Filipino-coined term for a small variety store) for a living. The store is occupying a small space of their humble house in Cavite. Operating for many years now, she has managed to keep the business running and growing.

Mildred has been faithful in her responsibilities and once again she is knocking on the hearts of the ever supportive lenders. By borrowing capital, she believes this could resolve her inadequacies in business. She hopes to improve her variety store by adding more grocery items. She would also use her loan to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney and buy new tires whenever replacements are needed. She is applying for a loan amount of Php 30,000 and praying that her request will be granted. She promised to use the amount for the said purpose and pay it back to the best of her ability.

She wants to increase her sales and improve their service in the next few years. She is a faithful member of Center for Community Transformation. Microentrepreneurs, like Agnes, are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 members. They meet on weekly basis to share the goodness of God in their lives and their experiences on the very unique work of transformation that CCT offers.

loans.use: to pay for new grocery items and her jeepney's new tires.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Emilia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Emilia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. Emilia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 55 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Catalina has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Veronica dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
This nice lady is 36 years old and her name is Anzhela. She lives with her beloved husband and two school-aged sons in Ijevan city of Tavush region. She has a degree in education and worked at the school as a teacher for six years. Now she works at the food market as an accountant since she completed training courses in accounting. Anzhela’s husband is also employed and he is a dentist. Together this couple does everything possible to provide good living conditions for their sons.

Now Anzhela has some health problems and is in great need of financial support. The medical examinations and course of treatment that she must undergo are very expensive, and her family’s budget is far from being able to cover this kind of expenses.

Anzhela asks for this loan of 1.450.000 Armenian drams in order to pay for medical examinations and a course of treatment at the hospital.

loans.use: to pay for medical examinations and a course of treatment at the hospital.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en:
Sevada is thankful for his first Kiva deal that greatly developed his auto repairing business and farming as well. He lives in the frontier village Khashtarak of Tavush region. He still manages his business and with the help of farming he tries to cover his big family’s a lot needs. Sevada works in his own garage and he does car seat and body upholstery, car body noise insulation and also repairs plastic details of cars.

 His farming is also of great support for him since he breeds swine, chickens and grows potatoes, maize, onions, string beans, apples and peppers both selling it and also using for his family. Sevada lives with his wife, three children and his mother. Sevada’s wife unfortunately has some health problems and this time partnership with Kiva lenders has more urgent and serious meaning for him and his family. Sevada asks for this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as he must pay for his wife’s treatment course at the hospital which the doctor directed as very urgent and important.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s treatment course at the hospital which the doctor directed as very urgent and important

loans.name: Chanuka Women Group

texts.en:
Jane (shown raising her hand in the photo) is a member of Chanuka Women Group .She is married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa in 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She owns a grocery shop and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock and buy a freezer to preserve her stock. She says that this will help her get more profits and support her family’s basic needs such as education and food.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to add more stock and buy a freezer.

loans.name: Zuleyma Beatriz

texts.es:
Zuleyma es dueña de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y ente otros, inicio su negocio hace dos años con el apoyo de una amiga y su suegra, pues así probaría si tenía oportunidad de generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares, hasta la fecha ha sabido administrarla y no ha tenido dificultades para atender a sus clientes. Zuleyma actualmente vive en casa familiar junto a su suegra, cuñadas y un hijo de cuatro años, su esposo se fue a residir a otro lugar por motivos de trabajo pero más sin embargo le ayuda económicamente para los gastos de su hijo.
Considera que para la temporada de fin de año no tiene un inventario con el que pueda suplir las demandas de sus clientes, por lo que está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar galletas,  huevos, jugos, gaseosas, agua, especias, etc., así podrá vender más y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es ir mejorando la tienda hasta lograr tener un minisúper y así mejorar su situación financiera.
texts.en:
Zuleyma owns a convenience store. She started her business two years ago with the support of a friend and her mother-in-law to try to generate additional income to contribute to her household expenses. Up until now, she has managed her business well and has not had any difficulties to serve her customers. Zuleyma currently lives with her mother-in-law, sisters-in-law and her 4-year-old son. Her husband moved somewhere else for work, but helps Zuleyma with their son's expenses.

She does not have a large enough inventory to satisfy her customers' demand for the holiday season, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy crackers, eggs, juice, soft drinks, water, spices, etc. in order to be able to sell more and provide a better service to her customers.

Her dream is to improve her store until it becomes a small supermarket, which would improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy crackers, eggs, juice, soft drinks, water, spices, etc. in order to be able to sell more and provide a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y tiene un hijo.

Oscar, se dedica a los trabajos en construcciones, ya tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y fue gracias a un tío que aprendió a trabajar de esta manera, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol; cuando cortan la cosecha siempre le ayuda su esposa y también sus hermanos.

Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera lechera, porque no tiene vacas y quiere iniciar el negocio de productos lácteos para mejorar sus ingresos.

Oscar, sueña con tener 5 vacas lecheras que le generen buenos ingresos económicos y además desea mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar, 35, left school after the fifth grade.  His wife works at home and cares for their son.  Oscar says that an uncle helped him get started in construction, work that he's been doing for 10 years now.  He also has a small farm where he grows maize and beans.  His wife and brothers help him to harvest his crops.  

Oscar is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a milk cow.  He has no cattle now but wants to start a dairy business to improve his income.  For the future, he hopes to buy more cows and improve his house.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr:
Irène est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 33 ans. Elle est une mère divorcée. Elle a deux enfants âgés de 18 ans et de 8 ans et ils sont tous les deux scolarisés. Elle élève seule ses enfants, le père ne verse aucune pension. Irène et ses enfants vivent dans la maison de ses parents. Cela a entrainé chez elle, l’idée de devenir indépendante et de pouvoir construire une maison pour ses enfants.
Irène est vendeuse de chaussures à l'occasion et est à son 4eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle a choisi de rester dans cette activité car elle s’est aperçue que c’était plus bénéfique. Avant d’entrer dans ce domaine, elle s’était lancée dans la vente de beignet de soja. 
Le prêt servira à acheter des chaussures à l'occasion pour hommes et enfants.
texts.en:
Irène is a courageous and hard-working woman who is 33 years old. She is a divorced mother with two children, who are 8 and 18 years old. Both children are in school. She raises her children alone, the father does not provide any financial support.

Irène and her children live in her parents' home. The idea of becoming independent and being able to build a house for her children led to her moving home.

Irène sells used shoes, and she is on her fourth loan with CEFOR. She has chosen to stay in this business, because she finds it profitable.

Before this work, she had started a business selling soy donuts.

This loan will serve to buy used shoes for men and children.

loans.use: to buy used shoes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 31-year-old woman blessed with 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Easter Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

She grows potatoes, maize, and has a dairy farm. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds that will enable her get high yields. This will increase her income and enable her to pay her children's education fees.

Nancy is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca y departamento  de Cusco.
La socia Jacinta tiene 68 años de edad y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota,la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando parta de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, arroz, azúcar entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA," which is located in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Jacinta is 68 years old and a widow, and alternates her daily activities, working in her grocery store business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payments. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who hopes that through her business she will make more income so she can continue to support her family. She sells basic goods including rice, sugar, milk and other products, and she hopes to keep working.

Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy sweets, rice, sugar, and other products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete the payments.

loans.use: to buy sweets, rice, and sugar, among other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old, married to Simion and blessed with three children aged between 17 and eight years old. She has been in the clothing business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 13,000.

As this is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, she intends to buy more clothes and shoes for resale in town. She anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

She hopes to expand her shop and open other outlets in town.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and widowed. She is blessed with three children between 24 and 12 years old. She has sold clothes, vegetables and bananas as businesses for the last 19 years and earns a monthly income of KES.20,250.

This being her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, she intends to buy fertilizers, seeds and clothes for resale in the village. She anticipates saving, paying the loan and buying food for her family from the expanded business profits. She dreams of settling down happily after her younger son’s education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 26-year-old supporting eight people in her family. She has a beauty salon and also sells clothes--a business she has been doing for the last three years--and she earns a monthly income of KES 35,000.

Rebecca has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase additional bales of clothes, as well as hair products. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bales of clothes, as well as hair products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old and supports eight people in his family.

He has a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last eight years, and gets a monthly income of KES 35,000.

He has applied for his sixth VisionFund Kenya loan, which he will use to purchase additional retail goods for resale.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail goods for resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Helen industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and a meat stand business. Helen dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and widowed, with one child who is in school.

Rosalie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins has operated a retail shop for10 years. He was inspired by his brothers to start this business and wishes to open up different outlets in his area. He is faced with customers who default on payments and fluctuating prices; he is learning how to deal with this challenge.

He would like to buy farm land. Collins will use the loan to buy sugar, soap, detergent, and other items.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, soap, detergent, and other items.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela, de 57 años de edad, nunca estudio, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tuvo cuatro hijos pero todos tienen sus propios hogares y en su casa solo vive una nieta. 

Rafaela, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde y también hace ventas de tamales, panes con pollo y comida típica, ella realiza estas ventas desde hace siete años e inicio este negocio debido a la necesitad que enfrentaba.

Rafaela, necesita el préstamo para comprar 150 pollos, dos quintales de concentrado y para comprar vitaminas y todos los medicamentos que necesitan.

Rafaela, sueña con seguir trabajando con su granja, para tener una mejor calidad de vida y que su nieta siga estudiando y obtenga un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Rafela, age 57, never went to school. She and her partner are farmers. They had four children, but all have their own homes now, and just one granddaughter lives with Rafael and her partner now.

Rafaela has a farm where she fattens chickens. She also sells tamales, chicken sandwiches, and other typical food. She's been making these sales for seven years, and she started the business out of necessity.

Rafaela needs this loan to buy 150 chickens, two hundredweight of concentrated feed, and all the necessary vitamins and medicines the chickens will need.

Rafaela's goals are to continue working her farm, to have a better quality of life, and to see her granddaughter stay in school and earn a university degree.

loans.use: buy 150 chickens, concentrated feed, and all needed vitamins and medication.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00, to improve her kiosk business. She is married, her husband is very supportive of her business. She decided to take a loan fromTuba Rai Metin to buy  cooking oil, candies, sardines, sauces, coffee, milk, aqua, detergent, biscuits, soft drinks and other items.  She started her business  a few years ago. She hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, candies, sardines, sauces, coffee, milk, aqua, detergent, biscuits, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Youth Tahidi Wanawake Women Group

texts.en:
Julia (shown raising her hand in the photo) is a member of Youth Tahidi Wanawake Women Group. She is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development, savings, and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

She operates a grocery and grows maize and beans. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, and household items. She says this will increase her level of income and help her to continue supporting her family’s basic needs with better food, clothing, and an improved living standard.

She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Jose Sigfredo

texts.es:
José, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, estudio hasta octavo grado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, junto con su pareja tiene dos hijos, pero solo uno estudia. 

José, ha sido agricultor durante toda su vida, pues ese fue el oficio que su padre le enseño; pero quiere iniciar con la ganadería, para elaborar productos lácteos. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para poder cuidarla y darle el pasto que sale de la cosecha de maíz y así poder beneficiarse de los productos derivados de la leche. 

El sueño de el es mejorar económicamente poder mejorar su vivienda y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 27, lives with his family. He attended school through the eight grade. His partner runs the household. Together, they have two children, but only one is in school.

José has been a farmer his entire life; it's what he learned from his father. But he'd like to start raising cows so that he can make dairy products.

José needs a loan so that he can buy and care for a cow. He will feed it the roughage that comes from the corn harvest, and thus be able to take advantage of all the products he can make from the milk.

His dream is to advance economically so that he can improve his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Na Tau 24 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun, 30, is Thai ethnic woman who is married and has three children, two girls at the age of 6 and 14, a boy at the age of 12. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a small remote village where people mainly rely on agricultural production for a living.

Like other villagers, Mrs. Lun works very hard at farming and animal husbandry with several activities such as growing rice, raising buffaloes, pigs, chickens, ducks and fish, while her husband works as a truck driver to provide for the family. Mrs. Lun has always wanted to increase production to improve income and support her family better.

This is the third time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets. She hopes that with her good experience in breeding and with the technical support of the Program's staff, her investment will go well and help her reap good profit. Mrs. Lun dreams of a more sufficient life for her family and a brighter future for her children.

In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi de 40 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien en busca de poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 13, 16, 18 y 20 años de edad por quienes se esfuerza día con día. Deysi en busca de aumentar sus ingresos económicos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, labiales, etc. para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi is 40 years old, and is a hardworking and responsible woman who, as a way to support her family, makes a living selling beauty products by catalog. She lives with her partner and children who are 13, 16, 18 and 20 years old, for whom she strives to provide for day after day.

Deysi is looking to increase her income so is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of creams, lotions, deodorants, makeup, lipstick, etc. to increase her business sales thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of creams, lotions, deodorants, makeup, lipstick, etc. to increase her business sales.

loans.name: Las Palmeras De Amaybamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS PALMERAS DE AMAYBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia Inés tiene 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer luchadora  que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar, leche y gaseosas.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Las Palmeras de Amaybamba," a band located in the Huayopata district in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

The member, Ynes, is 54 years old, married, and she has six children. She alternates her daily activities, working at a grocery store. She's a fighting woman who hopes to earn enough income through her business to support her family. She sells various types of products, like rice, sugar, oil, and many other things that her customers demand. She wants to continue to work so that she can support her family.

The member is requesting this loan so that she can buy ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

The member is grateful for the loan and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, milk, and soft drinks

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 60-year-old man who sells groceries in Busia, Kenya. He has 5 children.

He has had a grocery stall for 18 years and makes a monthly income of 24,000 KES.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase assorted vegetables and fruit to sell during the approaching festive season.

He will use the anticipated profit to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old and married with two children.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell.

Nelly has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Nelly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married with children. He has been operating a bar business for three years now. He started with a motorcycle transport business where he managed to get capital for the bar that he is currently running.

He has the responsibility of taking care of his children, as their only breadwinner. He is doing well, but laments the challenge of competition that affects his returns at the end of it all.

He has a vision of engaging in commercial farming though he does not have enough land to start the project. Samuel is therefore requesting for a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy land for farming.

loans.name: Ermendina

texts.en:
Ermendina is a 25-year-old woman who started a business a few years ago with her own capital. She sells goats and her husband is a farmer who is supportive of her business.

She requests a loan of $ 700.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goats. She wants to increase her income and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Wenny

texts.en:
Wenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall for her fish vending business. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns additional income from a general store.

Wenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of sving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr:
Marie Louise est une mère de famille très simple, travailleuse, et courageuse de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et le couple exerce ensemble les activités sources de revenu familial. Le couple a 6 enfants dont sont 4 scolarisés.
Marie Louise a comme principale activité l’élevage de vaches laitières, l’activité secondaire  étant la vente de pistaches. Elle a 9 années d’expérience dans l’élevage laitier, les clients sont sûrs. C’est une activité familiale. Elle dispose actuellement de 3 têtes de vaches. La vente des pistaches se développe ainsi petit à petit. 
L’objectif  est la finalisation de la construction de sa maison et l'amélioration  des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Marie Louise is a very simple hard-working, courageous 47-year-old mother. She is married and the couple share all the family's income-generating activities. The couple has six children of whom four attend school.

Marie Louise's main activity is raising dairy cows, the secondary activity being the sale of pistachios. She has nine years of experience in dairy farming, and her customers are dependable. It is a family business. She currently has three cows, and pistachio sales are slowly increasing.

The aim is to finalize the construction of her house and to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: contribute 240,000 ar towards buying a cow and use 60,000 ar to buy pistachios

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 23-year-old, Lebanese, married woman of two school-aged children.

Her husband represents the main income provider in his family; he has worked as a soldier in the Lebanese army for many years. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why currently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's registrations fees for school, with the aim to ensure them a good education.

loans.use: to pay her children's registration fees.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Yomentoni Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA YOMETONI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rupertina  continúa con su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia espera poder agrandar su negocio para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia cría a sus animalitos para de esta forma poder venderlos a sus clientes, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y para compra de víveres para su hogar.
Los  socios en general  se sienten agradecidos por el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Nueva Esperanza Yometoni," which is located in the Echarate district in the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

This member, Rupertina, continues in her business of raising young animals. She's a responsible woman, and she's grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it on time. She hopes to be able to expand her business and thus support her family. The member raises small animals and then sells them to her customers, which is how she is able to get her family ahead.

The member is requesting this loan so that she can buy animals as well as supplies for her home.

In general, the members are all grateful for the loan and they are committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: buy animals and supplies for her home

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy the new phones and money credits needed in her money remittance business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again in the amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will be added to her capital and will be used to supply more money credits. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Florencia wants expand her business so that she will be able to help support her family's everyday needs. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more money credits for her money remittance business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
38-year-old Shaista belongs to a middle-class family. She started her school in 2009 as a good cause for the children of underprivileged families. The school is providing education to 155 students, more than half of whom (64%) are female.

Shiasta related that private schools, charging high fees, are able to deliver better education compared with schools of the same scale as hers. Increasing school fees is not an option, as that will simply exclude many deserving children from gaining access to education.

While planning to renovate her school and get it painted, she has requested a loan worth PKR 100,000. This will improve the appearance of the school, which currently needs repair and maintenance.

loans.use: to renovate her school and get it painted.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra hortalizas y tienen 1 hijo de tres años de edad.

Anita, se dedica a la confeccionar y diseño de ropa y a través de este trabajo genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia; pero también se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa.

Anita, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar una máquina de coser eléctrica, para poder  trazar una costura de más alta calidad y durabilidad y entregar las prendas de vestirá más rápido y poder tener clientes más satisfechos.

Anita, sueña con colocar un bazar de ropa con los diseños elaborados por ella misma y además desea poder ayudar a su hijo para que estudie una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Anita, 25, left school after the ninth grade.  She is married now and has a 3-year old son.  Her husband, a farmer, grows garden crops.  

Anita has a business making and designing clothes.  Her income from the business helps to cover the family's expenses. 

Anita is applying for a loan that she will use to buy an electric sewing machine, one that will allow her to make better-quality and more durable clothing.  The new machine will also allow her to work faster and deliver orders for clothing quicker, an advantage sure to make her customers happy.

Anita would like to open a clothing store in the future, selling clothing that she herself designs.  She also hopes to send her son to college one day.

loans.use: to buy a specialist sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar, aged 42, is a responsible mother of three children living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a scrap shop; he deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling them to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have an amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Samar requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. Samar gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc., for her husband's scrap shop.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is 28 years old and single.  She opened a school that she hopes will grow each and every day until one day it becomes the top school in her area. 

Her school is only school her in community.  She faces untrained teachers, and the school facilities do not meet the needs of her 143 students. 

To buy more furniture for her students and construct better rooms to suit the capacity, she has borrowed PKR 60,000. 

The number of school students is constantly increasing, and Ruqia is helping her teachers improve their technical skills so they can provide a high-quality education to the children. She has long-term planning for her community children's future.

loans.use: To buy more furniture for her students and construct better rooms to suit the capacity

loans.name: Ramia

texts.en:
Ramia is a 34-year-old married Lebanese woman and mother of two children who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life. He owns a fruits and vegetables shop.

Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting a loan today from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan would surely help her to register him for the new school year, which makes her very optimistic.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This is Mohammad’s second loan cycle. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome.  He was able to expand his poultry yard, 

Today, Mohammad has applied for this loan to repair his house because it was damaged in the last war in Gaza. He planning to build a ceiling and walls as start.  Then he would like to install pipelines, and to buy more building materials for renovating his home.

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to normal life again with his family.

loans.use: to build ceiling and walls for his war-damaged home, and then pipelines and more building materials.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 29-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife and her husband is responsible to satisfy the family needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle. Today, in order to pay her children’s school fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the school fees and ensure appropriate education for them.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
SAID who is in his early 60's is single with two schooling children.  He has been running a grocery store for five years now. He works from 08 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be SAID's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy the best selling drinks in the grocery store and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the drinks stock and to start selling spirits and wine to meet his customer's demand.  He dreams of expanding his business to a Pub.

Said will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the drinks stock and to start selling spirits and wine  to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Isai

texts.es:
Isai con 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Querocotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 06 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en labores de mantenimiento y aumento de áreas de fincas de café. De esta manera obtendrá una mejor calidad en su cultivo.

Isai es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Isai is 24 years old. He is in a common-law relationship, and lives in a rustic house with his partner and son in the Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department of Peru. He has very good personal as well as and work references from the people in the area. The people of this town are engaged mainly in farming, trade, and ranching.

He is engaged in farming, specifically coffee cultivation, and he has over six years of experience in the trade. He is requesting this loan to invest in maintenance, and to expand his coffee plantation areas. In this way, he will obtain a better quality crop.

Isai is a re-instated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance, and to expand his coffee plantation areas.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis Gustavo con 26 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de lima,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 08 años, sus cultivos se encuentran en un muy buen estado. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de productos de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol,etc, los cuáles son para consumo. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su finca de lima,en gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de lima.De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Luis Gustavo es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luis Gustavo, age 26, lives with his civil partner and their son in the district of San Felipe, located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca department in Peru. He has excellent references, both personal and professional, from the other residents in the area. The people in this area are generally farmers, ranchers, and business owners.

He is in the business of agriculture, specifically in raising limes. He has eight years of experience in this field and his crops are in very good shape. Additionally, he raises daily staples like yucca and beans, which are for his own consumption.
