This loan will be used to invest in his lime farm, paying for expenses of fertilizer and maintenance. This way, he'll manage to have an acceptable tool for improving his quality of life.

Luis Gustavo is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: invest in his lime farm, paying for fertilizer and maintenance

loans.name: Libradilla

texts.en:
Libradilla is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Libradilla is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Libradilla has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Libradilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona operates a retail shop, selling foodstuffs and beers as well. She is strategically located and doing very well in her business, given that she is easily accessed. 

She desires to have a bigger shop in future. We are approaching the Christmas season, Fiona has realized more needs for her shop but lacks enough capital to do the shopping. 

She is requesting a loan to buy flour and other bakery products to sell and be able to make profits, since she is assured of a readily available market.

loans.use: To buy flour and other bakery products to sell.

loans.name: Aliphonse

texts.en:
Aliphonse is a grown-up, married man with four children who are still attending school in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main and only source of income, where he mainly grows and sells coffee. He has been farming for more than eight years, loves being active at work and works for 10 hours each of the seven days worked per week.

With this, he has been able to improve on his standards of living, pay school fees for his children and look after his dependents. A good father he is, his vision is to educate his children up to degree level as a minimum qualification and also expand his farm business.

Inadequate capital limits him from fulfilling his plans.

Aliphonse is seeking financial support in the form of a loan to buy manure, coffee seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, coffee seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en: Medius has operated a retail shop for eight years now. She has a lot of experience in this kind of business. She also does agriculture for food security and selling. She has dreams of growing bananas and coffee on a large scale in order to get bigger harvests. She is faced with a problem of pests and diseases which affects her yields in the long run. Medius is requesting a loan facility to buy pesticides and pay for labor for those working on her farm.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay for labor for those working on her farm.

loans.name: Fushai Group

texts.en:
Nightfall is the time for cross border bus drivers to test their buses in preparation for their long journeys to South Africa, Tanzania, Mozambique, Botswana, Zambia and even further afield. Tarmary will be among the passengers who are keen and thoroughly prepared for their long journey to Zambia. She ensures that her passport is on her before she leaves her house. Tarmary also ensures that she prepares adequate home cooked meals so that she can eat along the way since she is not a fan of fast foods which are usually the main menu along the roads.

Tarmary is married and has 4 children who all go to school. She is a 41 year old business-woman and resides in Warren Park in Harare, Zimbabwe.

Tarmary replenishes her products from Zambia and prefers Zambia because the products there are high quality and are cheaper. Tarmary is in the clothing and footwear business and she mainly restocks shoes for both genders and for different occasions. She buys clothing like golf t-shirts, normal t-shirts and men’s jeans. She operates a flea market right outside her place of residence, her place is now affectionately known as ‘the neighborhood boutique’.

Tarmary is currently on her second loan cycle with Thrive. During her first cycle she successfully applied for a loan of 400USD. She performed exceptionally well on the last loan. This can be evidenced by the numbers of orders that she currently has and also the fact that she is now restocking in bulk. She is gradually creating customer loyalty and she indicated that she intends to increase her stock levels to ensure customers flock to her.

Currently Tarmary require a loan of $650, with this loan she plans to travel as far as Tanzania in order to restock with very cheap clothes of better quality. This would give her higher profit margins when she resells in Zimbabwe. She is also planning to restock a variety of clothing and shoes so as to meet the various needs of her clients both young and old. She is eyeing the festive season that is fast approaching as sales will be high during such times.

loans.use: to travel as far as Tanzania to restock with very cheap clothes of better quality, giving her higher profit margins when she resells in Zimbabwe.

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 52 años de edad, orgullosa campesina, mujer verraca, arriera que dio a luz a 8 hijos,  todos ellos los crio y levanto en su finca donde genera recursos gracias a unos cultivos de café y su responsabilidad no termina ya que 4 de esos hijos son menores de edad, una adolescente y los otros tres a con familia.
Ella quiere seguir realizando su profesión la cual está inculcando a sus hijos, su propósito es mantenerlos y tener siempre en la mesa un alimento para disfrutar.
La señora María se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los siguientes insumos:
•	Abonos
•	Riegos
•	Machete
•	Asador para café 
•	Vasijas 
•	costales
texts.en: María is 52 years old. She is a hard working, proud and gutsy farmer who has given birth to 8 children.She has brought all of them up on her farm where she has an income from growing coffee.Her responsibilities are not over yet; four of her children are still youngsters, one a teenage girl, and the other three live at home. María wants to continue with her business which provides for her children. Her goal is to take care of them and always have food on the table for them to eat. María is asking for a loan to buy the following supplies:  fertilizer, irrigation equipment, a machete, a coffee roaster, bowls and sacks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation equipment, a machete, coffee roaster, pots and sacks.

loans.name: Muthunthini Stars Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Benedetta,  a member of Muthunthini  Stars Group. She is forty two years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development training.
She is involved in farming of both vegetables and maize.  She is borrowing a loan from kiva to buy certified seeds for her farm. This will increase her production hence more income. She says that this income will help her provide better food and clothing for her family.
She is very  grateful to kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and increase production hence more income to provide better food and clothing for her family

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: A $800.00 is offered to Teresa to improve her business. Teresa lives in Atsabe. And most of her daily income is from kiosk, so she still happy to do her business. She just selling in her house, because she live near many people. She started her business a few year ago, with her own working capital of $ 400.00 . She was bring this money to going to add with her principal amount to buy more items like candies, cooking oils, sardines, detergents, noodles, biscuits, aqua, rice and other things to sell, according to people like, because it has become her activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will to has a management for her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, cooking oils, sardines, detergents, noodles, biscuits, aqua, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 55-year-old Lebanese woman.  She lives with her husband and five children. 

Nawal is trying her best to be as helpful as she can. She started her own job at an earlier age. She opened a room in her house to give private education since 1995. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop for her business. In the future, she plans to open an educational center in order to attract more students.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for her business.

loans.name: Elisa Jamileth

texts.es: Elisa de 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 16, 15 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que en busca de sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, este negocio lo maneja desde hace varios años y gracias a ello ahora cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes que la prefieren. Elisa en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, cremas, maquillaje, desodorantes, etc. para aumentar las ganancias de su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Elisa is 33 years old, and lives at the side of her life companion and her children, ages 16, 15, and 8.  She is a very hard worker, and she is looking to get her children ahead.  She is engaged in selling beauty products by catalog, and has managed this business for several years.  Thanks to this business, she now has a fairly large number of customers that prefer doing business with her.  Elisa is looking to improve her quality of life through the loan she is requesting from Fusai.  She will invest in lotions, creams, make-up, deodorants, and other items to increase the profits of her business and, in this way, be able to provide her family with a better way of life.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, creams, make-up, deodorants, and other items to increase the profits of her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna lives a simple life with her family in Baybay, Leyte. She is 45 years old and a mother of six children; one adult and five dependents. Her husband went to other country to earn more while Myrna does tailoring business. She has been doing this for twenty five years to earn a living and to supports her husband in providing their children’s need. Myrna’s main goal in life is to improve their livelihood to have enough money for their children. She wants them to finish their studies. That is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the money to buy cloth.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Diana Grabiela

texts.es:
Diana Gabriela con 44 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica al comercio de artículos para el hogar,artículos de bazar y ropa. Además percibe pensión por sus hijos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la confección de adornos en Tecnoport para cumpleaños y otros eventos.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y perfumes para su negocio. De esta manera tendrá una mayor venta y atención a sus clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.

Diana Gabriela con experiencia crediticia con Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Diana Gabriela, age 44, is a single mother who lives in her own home along with her children. The family lives in the district of Zaña, part of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru. She has very good references, both personal and professional, from the other residents of the area. The people in this area are mostly farmers, ranchers, or business owners.

She is in the business of selling household items, assorted sundries, and clothing. In addition, she receives child support. She also makes decorative items from Tecnoport, a Styrofoam-like material, for birthdays and other events.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing and perfume for her business. That ways, she will have better sales and service to her customers, earning more income and improving her quality of life and that of her family.

Diana Gabriela has good credit history with Edpyme Alternativa, with timely payments.

loans.use: buy clothing and perfume for her business

loans.name: Lilanie

texts.en:
Lilanie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Lilanie has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Lilanie has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He owns a drug shop and also is a government salary earner, which adds more income for him and his family. He started his business on a small scale and was inspired by his fellow health workers. He is charged with the duty of looking after his small family by meeting all their basic needs.

Richard is faced with a challenge of low working capital that hinders expansion of his business as his main vision and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Richard has asked for another loan to help him buy human drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.use: to buy human drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.name: Deysi Aydee

texts.es:
Daysi considera que los créditos le están siendo de mucha utilidad para mantener la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado, en la actualidad tiene más clientes satisfechos, su negocio ha crecido y su familia tiene muy buena salud.
Por el buen servicio que recibe, se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito en Padecomsm,  lo invertirá en aguacates, naranjas, papas, elote, repollos, cebollas, manzanas, etc., para que sus clientes puedan adquirir productos frescos y a bajo precio, espera seguir trabajando sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Daysi finds that the loans have been very useful in maintaining her business selling fruits and vegetables in the market. She currently has more satisfied customers, her business has grown, and her family is in very good health.

Because of the good service she received, she decided to request a new loan from Padecomsm, which she will invest in avocados, oranges, potatoes, corn, cabbage, apples, and more so that her customers can buy fresh produce at a low price. She expects to continue working without difficulties.

loans.use: buy fresh produce for her customers, including avocados, oranges, potatoes, corn, cabbage, and apples.

loans.name: Noms Group

texts.en:
Death is a tragic experience but no one can deny the fact that it is real and it is inevitable. After being married twice and losing both her husbands through death, Nancy knew she had to be strong since she was left with two children, one from each marriage. 

Nancy had lost hope in life, and at some point, she thought she could not move on, as she had no means to get money for the upkeep of her family. She also had to take care of her ill mother (who later passed on) and had help her brother acquire a good education by paying for his school fees. 

She was smart enough to realise that the only way to make it was for her to venture into entrepreneurship. Since she had a passport, she started by restocking groceries from South Africa that she would resell in her local neighborhood in Mbare. 

She also worked in South Africa for two years, but because of xenophobic attacks, she realised home is always best, so she came back to stay with her family. At the age of 45, she is now a full-time cross border trader who supplies groceries to shops in Harare. She has 15 years of experience in this line of business. 

Nancy formed a group called Noms with her friends, who are all in various businesses. These women encourage each other to work, make savings and  promote each other’s businesses. Thrive has played a major role in giving them training to have a strong group and to be financially literate. 

Nancy is looking for a loan amounting $300. She plans to stock more groceries every week from South Africa. As a group, they want $1,500 to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to stock more groceries every week from South Africa for resale from her stall.

loans.name: Shumba Group

texts.en:
Fatigue is one word which does not exist in Yeukai’s vocabulary. Yeukai is a 48-year-old, widowed woman with two children who are in school.

She is a tailor and a cross-border trader. She specializes in sewing sheets, bed covers, and sofa covers. Usually she travels to Mozambique twice every month to sell her stuff.

Every month she spends 10 to 12 days on her sewing machine putting these items together, six days traveling to and from Mozambique, and about 10 days, she spends walking up and down the streets of Quelimane in a bid to sell her products and collect cash from her debtors in Mozambique.

She sometimes gets help from her daughter, who is studying at a local university, during her holidays. She has been managing to send her children to school without anyone assisting her and has not used the excuse of being a widow to get help from anyone.

Her main challenge has been liquidity because of late repayments from her debtors. This renders her unable to secure more material to make more products for sale. She then realized she needs a capital injection to raise her working capital so that she does not run out of stock anymore. She has approached Thrive Microfinance with four other women as the Shumba (Shona for "lion") Group, requesting a combined loan of $1,850 to help unchain themselves from the yoke of poverty.

With her portion of the loan, Yeukai will buy fabric and other sewing material so that she makes her trips to Mozambique more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing material so that she can make sheets, bed covers, and sofa covers.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, one of them is still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family. He has worked in the construction field for many years and, as for her, she is housewife.

Currently, Sawsan is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay education fees for school. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for him. This makes her very happy and thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay education fees for school.

loans.name: Benjamin Jr.

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 40-year-old man who lives in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. He is married and has four children who are 12, 9, 5 and 3 years old. He raised his family through driving a tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow). A tricycle is a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines, and Benjamin has been doing this for two years.

In addition to this, he and his wife also run a sari-sari (variety) store. Benjamin works hard to provide for the needs of his family. Thus, he is asking for a loan for tricycle maintenance such as overhauling and buying motor chains. In addition to this, he will also buy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, snack foods, toiletries and spices. Benjamin’s goal in life is to improve his livelihood to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance such as overhauling and buying motor chains and to buy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, snack foods, toiletries and spices.

loans.name: Jesus Reyes

texts.es:
Jesús Reyes con 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa de sus padres de material rústico, en el distrito de Querocotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en labores de mantenimiento y aumento de áreas de fincas de café.

Jesús Reyes es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jesús Reyes is 24 years old and single. He lives in his parents' house, which is made of rustic materials and is located in the Querocotillo district, which is in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region of Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from the people who live in the area. The inhabitants of this place mostly make their living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically by harvesting coffee. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He is requesting the loan to invest in maintenance work and to expand the area of the coffee farm.

Jesús Reyes is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has handled a loan, which he paid off in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance work and to expand the area of the coffee farm.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 40 years old, married and has five children. Four children are currently in school.

Bernadita has been in the agricultural business for four years now, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Bernadita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years, and earns additional income from a general store.

Brigida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Joan

texts.en:
Ma. Joan is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Joan has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Joan requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Joan has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ma. Joan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shira

texts.en:
Shira received cosmetics training and certification. For several years she worked in ‎salons, gaining experience and skills. After realizing she would need to become ‎independent if she wanted to earn a decent living, Shira took business training courses ‎at the Israeli Small Business Association working with Ethiopian Israeli entrepreneurs. ‎

Shira opened her small cosmetics salon this past summer. After researching several ‎areas, studying the foot traffic and existing competition, Shira opened her small salon in ‎a strong location and has already begun reaching new clients.‎

She needed this loan to make small renovations (including paint, a manicure station, and a ‎sign) and to pay for flyers and supplies.‎

Shira is working to make to strengthen her business. She chose to open small and wants ‎to grow and expand her business in the future, and bring in staff who can offer a variety ‎of cosmetic treatments.‎

loans.use: to make small renovations to her cosmetics salon (including paint, a manicure station, and a sign) and to pay for flyers and ‎supplies.‎

loans.name: Heriberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Heriberto, vive con su grupo familiar integrado por su compañera de vida y dos hijos con edades de 4 años y 2 meses de nacido, su negocio consiste en administrar una peluquería, oficio que aprendió siendo empleado, desde hace un año se propuso establecer su propio negocio, objetivo que logro cumplir, y es así como hoy cuenta con un negocio propio para subsistir junto a su familia.
Debido a las próximas fechas de fiestas patronales y de fin de año ha decidido trabajar con créditos, podrá comprara tijeras, navajas, máquinas cara cortar cabello, talcos, etc., al mayoreo para surtir su inventario a un bajo costo, espera mantenerse trabajando y obtener mayores ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son abrir otros puntos de atención a nivel departamental y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Heriberto lives with his family, comprised of his partner and their two children, aged four years and two months old. His business is running a barbershop, work which he learned as an employee. A year ago, he decided to establish his own business, which he managed to do, and today he is able to rely on his own business to sustain himself and his family.

Due to the upcoming saint's day holidays and the end of the year, he has decided to work on credit. He will be able to buy scissors, razors, machines for cutting hair, various powders, and more, all at wholesale, which will enable him to supply his business at a low price. He hopes to continue working and to earn more money.

His goal is to open other storefronts in the region and provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: buy scissors, razors, machines for cutting hair, talc, and more at wholesale so that he can supply his business at low cost.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 25 years old and a mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Humaira has to buy materials such as a hand-embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. She has become an expert in the embroidery business.

Currently her husband handles her transactions with her customer's, but she has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market. That way she can earn a better profit for her family. So, Humaira requested a loan so she will be able to buy more raw materials from the market.

Humaira is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Erlinda Rodi

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 19 años de edad, está estudiando noveno grado a distancia, debido a que tiene que cuidar y trabajar para mantener a sus hijos, porque es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus hijos y sus hermanos.

Erlinda, trabaja elaborando tortillas en la ciudad, decidió dedicarse a este negocio para poder mantener y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos; su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y mientras ella trabaja su madre le cuida los niños y tiene que viajar a pie durante 20 minutos desde su casa para estar 10 minutos antes de iniciar su jornada de trabajo.

Erlinda, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas y para comprar maíz.

Erlinda, sueña con poder terminar sus estudios de bachiller y encontrar un empleo formal para terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 19 years old, is studying 9th grade from a distance, since she has to work and take care of her children. She is a single mother and lives in the house of her parents, together with her children and her siblings.

Erlinda makes tortillas in the city for work. She decided to work on this business to be able to maintain her children and meet their basic needs. Her hours of work is from 6am to 2pm. Her mother looks after the kids while she works. She has to walk 20 minutes from her house to be 10 minutes early for her day's journey for work.

Erlinda needs the loan to buy a griddle for making tortillas and to buy maize. She dreams of finishing her high school studies and find a formal job, so she can finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for making tortillas and to buy maize

loans.name: Na Tau 25 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ui is a 27-year-old Thai lady who has been married and become the mother of two girls aged one and nine. She lives with her husband and her two daughters in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small remote village. Her family has encountered plenty of difficulties because of poverty, but she has still tried hard to send her first-born daughter to school fully with the hope of a brighter future for her through good education.

To provide for the family, Mrs. Ui and her husband work very hard at agricultural production with several activities such as growing rice and breeding pigs, chicken, ducks and fish. However, they lack capital for increasing production. As a result, Mrs. Ui has decided to request a loan at the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets and food for the pigs. She hopes that her investment will go well and bring good income to her family, especially when she knows that Anh Chi Em also provides good agricultural training and counseling along with the loan. Mrs. Ui dreams that her family will escape from poverty and that her children will be successful in their careers and in life. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de trois femmes a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008. Il rassemble des femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations de voisinage. Madame Sokhna est la responsable elle est mariée âgée de 32 ans  et mère d'un garçon de quatre ans.
Elle est debout à gauche de la photo la main levée. Sokhna s'active dans le commerce par la vente de tissus divers et habits prêt à porter.
Son nouveau crédit de 500 000 francs lui permettra de se payer une balle de tissus wax et des habits prêt à porter qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa petite famille et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The group, founded on December 1, 2008, is made up of three women from the same neighborhood who share warm neighborly bonds. Mrs. Sokhna, the group's leader, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of a four-year-old boy. 

Standing on the left side of the photo with her arm raised, Sokhna runs a business selling assorted fabrics and ready-to-wear clothing. 

A loan of 500,000 XOF (West African CFA francs) will allow her to purchase waxprint fabrics and ready made clothing, which she will resell at retail price in her neighborhood. She has lots of experience in the retail trade. Her earnings will help her to provide food for her small family and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Perlitas Group

texts.es:
Yaquelin es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 10, 16 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
Ella es decidida, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ que es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, hasta donde llegaron los damnificados de la riada del Piraí del año 1983, Los habitantes de la populosa zona son mayormente migrantes de otras ciudades y del campo.
Yaquelin es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico mediano (la primera de la izquierda, viste camiseta azul), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en reuniones familiares y habla es pañol por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de medicina natural, confección de cortinas, panadería, venta de refrescos y taller de muelles para auto. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior femenina, como; camisetas, shorts, bodysuit, ropa interior térmica, bustier, camisola, brasier, liguero y otros, “Muchas veces descuidamos la ropa interior porque pensamos que nadie nos va a ver, eso es un error porque debemos estar bellas para nosotras mismas…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la mercadería que vende es variada. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientela continua, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir el negocio. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, ella desea comprar ropa interior femenina. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yaquelin solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior femenina para consolidar su negocio en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Yaquelin age 41, lives with her partner. They have four children, ages 9, 10, 16, and 19 years old. She is in the business of selling undergarments.

She is resolute, constant, and very hard-working. She runs her business in the 'Plan 3000' neighborhood, one of the most populous in the city; it's where the survivors of the Piraí flood in 1983 came. The people in this crowded area are largely migrants from other cities and from the country.

Yaquelin has brown skin, short stature, and medium build - in the picture, she's the first on the left, wearing a blue shirt. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish with people generally and while running her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a rented room made of bricks, and have water, electricity, and waste water services.

The drive to get ahead led her to form a bank for the undertaking. The members run a variety of businesses, including selling clothes, selling food, selling natural medicines, making curtains, baking bread, selling soft drinks, and running a automotive shocks shop.

Her business is selling ladies' undergarments, including tshirts, shorts, body suits, thermal underwear, corsets, camisoles, bras, garter belts, and more. "A lot of times, we don't think about our underwear because we think that nobody is going to see us. But that's a mistake because we should be beautiful for ourselves," she commented.

Her business is successful because the merchandise she sells is varied. One advantage of her business is that she can rely on steady customers; one disadvantage is that she lacks capital to supply her business. Her goal is strengthen her business; she wants to buy women's undergarments to do that. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years that she's been running this business.

It's for all these reasons that Yaquelin is requesting this loan, which she will use to buy women's underwear and supply her business for the end-of-year parties.

loans.use: buy women's undergarments to strengthen her business for New Year's parties

loans.name: Hanin

texts.en:
Hanin is a 27-year-old Lebanese single woman. In 2010, Hanin started her own business, by opening a small room in her house for vending women's clothes. With her special selling methods and by giving a high quality of products, she is well-known in her region with special talents in her domain.

Today, Hanin is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise with new and special collections. This will meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. She is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new and special collections.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 20-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has worked as a private teacher since 2014. She arranged a room in her house where she receives her students. She chose this profession because she feels that she is helping students to get the needed education.

Today, Hanan is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy the required materials and supplies for her instruction project. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students.

loans.use: to buy the required materials and supplies for her instruction project.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 55-year-old married woman living with her husband and is mother of four children. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and requests.

She has opened a room in her house to prepare homemade foods since 2010 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions in order to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

In the future, she plans to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 58 years old and married with ten children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

Esmeralda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mina's Group

texts.en:
Mina is 40 years old; she lives with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Mina's husband has been selling fruits for many years; he sells seasonal & fresh fruits in his hometown. He uses a four-wheeled manual cart for selling. As a hawker, he can easily reach customers. People like to buy fruit at their doors instead of going to the market. Due to his fruit’s freshness, Mina's husband has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for his fruit has increased and by noon he has no more stock.

Mina feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. Mina is taking a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy fruit in greater quantities and equilibrium to scale to weight.

Mina wants to save the excess profit so that she can utilize these saving for future sudden needs and for her children's education. Mina thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of seasonal & fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food, school fees and clothes.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of untimely payments of debts.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Zaruro Group

texts.en:
Life is not fair, and one person who encountered an experience that made her believe this saying is Patricia. After her husband passed on, she thought she thought her world was over, until her younger sister passed on a week later. These losses left her with four dependants since they had two children and her sister had two of her own.

She grieved wondering how she was going to be able to take care of these four children on her own. Luckily she had an old knitting machine which she had kept for years. She had last knitted a jersey as a present for her husband’s birthday and used to knit as a pastime. She then dusted the old machine and sat before it with determination as this was going to be her source of income.

Patricia now makes 3 - 4 jerseys a day and she supplies these jerseys to schools in the rural areas of Madziva and Bindura. She also sells to villagers in these rural areas, typically in exchange for peanut butter and maize, as they do not usually have cash. When she returns to Harare, she then sells the peanut butter and maize to her neighbours. For the past two years, she has managed to send all four children to school.

Patricia and three other women have approached Thrive Microfinance as a group called Zaruro and are requesting a combined loan of $1,100. Patricia wants to buy wool in bulk so that she can be able to fully supply the jersey orders from the schools as she usually fails to do this due to inadequate resources.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk so that she can be able to fully supply the jersey orders from schools.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “EL ESFUERZO ES GRANDE” está conformada por 08 socias entusiastas. Este es el caso de MARIA de 33 años de edad, soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Maria es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de especerías y condimentos como ají molido pimienta comino y muchas variedades más. El deseo de Maria es poder tener su casa propia. Solicito el crédito para la compra de ají panca ajos pimienta y comino. El grupo “el esfuerzo es grande” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Maria se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la cuarta del lado izquierdo viste chompa color azul.
texts.en:
The community collective "El Esfuerzo Es Grande" is comprised of eight enthusiastic members, including Maria. Maria is 33 years old, single, and has two dependent children. She is a hard-working mother who with a great deal of struggle and determination is able to get her family ahead.

She is in the business of selling spices and condiments, including hot chili powder and many other things. Maria's goal is to have her own house.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy panca peppers (red and smoky peppers, typical in the area), garlic pepper, and cumin.

The group "El Esfuerzo is Grande" is grateful to Kiva for the support provided. Maria is standing in the back of the room on the left, wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: buy assorted spices, including chili powder, garlic, and cumin

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of three children who are still attending school. She started her business in 2010 by opening a small room in her home for vending Tupperware, using her special selling skills and providing high quality products. She also visits her clients based on their needs. She is well-known in her region for the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality. 

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. She is very proud that she was able to develop her business and hopes to open a shop very soon.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old, married to Safania, and blessed with two children of 5 and 2 years respectively.

She has a retail shop that she has operated for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,000.

This being her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more stock such as sugar, bar soaps, cooking oil, salt, matchboxes, and loaves of bread.

She anticipates helping her husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

She hopes to expand her business to become a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, bar soaps, cooking oil, salt, matchboxes, and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 25 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Myra has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business. Myra has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Myra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 83 years old and married with three children.

Alejandra is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alejandra has been farming vegetables for 10 years, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

Alejandra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming vegetables for 8 years and also earns income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 42-year-old, single mother of one child, living in Hoima, Uganda.

Her main business is a stationery shop, although she also has produce and mobile money businesses. She started her business to look after her child and pay for her school fees, like any loving mother would do. Her biggest challenge is the unpredictable weather changes. Her business is seasonal. She makes big sales when schools have just started.

Jane intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her child for this third and promotion term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Javier Geovani

texts.es:
Javier, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, junto a ella tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad.

Javier, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo y hortalizas desde que era un niño, su padre fue quien le enseño todo acerca de cómo cultivar, pero aparte de eso tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos y le apoyado su esposa e hijos en el mantenimientos de la porqueriza y en la alimentación de los cerdos y su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 5:00 a.m. y culmina por la tarde a las 6:00 p.m. 

Javier, necesita el préstamo para ampliar la granja de cerdos y para comprar pulimento y concentrado para engordarlos.

Javier, sueña con poder comprar un vehículo para trasladar sus cultivos hasta su casa, además desea poder ver a sus hijos graduados de bachillerato y que trabajen en un lugar donde sus esfuerzos sean bien recompensados.
texts.en:
Javier is 40 years old and studied up to Grade 6. He is married, his wife does the housework and together with her he has two children aged 16 and 12 years old.

Javier has worked growing corn, beans, sorghum and vegetables since he was a boy. His father taught him everything about how to grow. And besides this he has 5 years experience raising pigs. His wife and children help him with the upkeep of the pigpens and feeding the pigs. His work day begins at 5 am and he finishes at 6 in the evening.

Javier needs the loan to expand his pig farm and buy rice husks and concentrated feed to fatten them.

Javier dreams of buying a vehicle to transport his crops to his house. He also wants to see his children graduate from Secondary school and work someplace where their effort will be well rewarded.

loans.use: to expand his pig farm and buy rice husks and concentrated feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Vibrant Women Group

texts.en:
In Budiriro, a high density suburb situated in south west Harare, there is a group of women called the Vibrant Women group. The group is comprised of four jovial women who are neighbours. They all run their businesses in the same neighbourhood.

Faustina is 26 years old and married with two children who are both not yet going to school. Her husband is a self-employed motor mechanic who currently helps her in the tuck shop business since it is their main source of income.

Faustina and her colleagues managed to get their first loan from Thrive Microfinance in April 2015. She used the money to stock more groceries in her tuck shop and to buy shoes. The training on financial literacy and group formation have helped them to grow. She says the continuous follow up from Thrive has been helpful to them.

In their second loan, Faustina is planning to stock a variety of groceries and a wider selection of footwear to meet the existing demand from her customers. A loan amounting to $300 would help her to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock a variety of groceries and a wider selection of footwear to meet the existing demand from her customers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio continúa perteneciendo al banco comunal “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”.
Francisco es una persona trabajadora y  continua dedicándose a la agricultura, el cultiva maíz. 
El socio sabe la potencia agrícola que tiene su localidad, por  esta razón su meta es tener una producción agrícola teniendo calidad y cantidad
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes.
Francisco agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en él, y otorgarle el préstamo que le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN” communal bank.

Francisco is a hard-working person who continues to work in agriculture, growing corn.

He knows the agricultural potential of his area and for this reason his goal is to reap an agricultural product of quality and in quantity.

The member is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers.

Francisco is grateful to the Kiva lenders who continue to have confidence in him and grant him the loan which will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 43 years old, married and a good father of four children. Hasan lives with his wife and children in the district of Shahrituz. Hasan has engaged in agriculture for ten years. Thus he provides for his family. 

At the moment, he has no money to buy seeds and fertilizers. For him, timely procurement of these farming inputs is very important, because if he is not able to plant a crop this year, they will be left without food. For this reason, Hasan applied for a loan. Please help him to improve his life. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fe Angelie

texts.en:
Fe Angelie lives a simple life with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a single mother and blessed with a two-year-old, baby girl.

She is engaged in a direct-selling business where she sells beauty products, personal care products, home care products, cosmetics, and apparels. Fe Angelie works alone since she and her partner are separated. Because of this, she needs to work hard.

Thus, Fe Angelie is asking for a loan to buy beauty products, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics, shirts, shoes, sandals, underwear, and other products. 27-year-old Fe Angelie dreams to have a stable business for her family's sustainability.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics, shirts, shoes, sandals, underwear, and other products.

loans.name: Bhakti Karang Group

texts.en:
Yudita, a 28-year-old talented woman (standing on the left side) is the mother of two children, Stela, eight years old and enrolled in elementary school, and Dimas, one year old. With her talent, she runs a weaving business and has been involved in the business for years. She enjoys the days by producing weaving such as sarongs and shawls.

It takes two to three days for a shawl and a week for one sarong as it needs patience and skill for a good result. She usually produces the weaving as requested by the customer. Yudita usually asks the customer for the down payment to buy yarn.

Due to the requests from customers that should be completed, she needs to buy more yarn. Therefore, Yudita and Rosiana joined in the Bhakti Karang Group and requested a loan totaling IDR 4,000,000. Just like Yudita, Rosiana also wants to invest her part for business improvement. They are sure the loan provided by Kiva through TLM will encourage them for a better life.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 25 years old, married to Gerishon, and blessed with two children aged 9 and 4 years old. She has been into a tailoring business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 28,000.

This being her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more clothing materials for resale in the shop.

With the anticipated profits, Everlyne will be able to help her husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

She hopes to buy additional sewing machines, and employ and train more people in her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for resale in the shop.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 55-year-old supporting eight people in his family.

He has a cereals stall, a business he has been doing for the last 22 years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more stock.

He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anecia has five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Anecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, banana, cooking oil, and related goods for her food production business.

Anecia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anecia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, bananas, and cooking oil for her food production business.

loans.name: Noura Group

texts.en:
Fadia is the featured borrower for Noura Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Fadia is a 52-year-old mother of four. She started five years ago, preparing and selling "Mouneh" to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her region. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy eggplant and some other foodstuff to increase her production. Fadia is the first lady on the right in the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Aisha is the second lady on the right, Noura is the second on the left, and Rasha is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy eggplant and some other foodstuff to increase her production

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en: Ricarda is 62 years old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has six adult children. Her husband is a farmer while Ricarda sells “tuba” (a Filipino word for coconut wine). She has been doing this business proficiently for thirty years and earns about PHP 5,440 per month.  Aside from “tuba” wine selling, Ricarda also raises pigs. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and “tungod”(a tannin powder used to add color to the coconut wine). In the future, Ricarda wishes to improve her business because it is their main source of income to sustain each day.

loans.use: to buy "tungog" powder and feed

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Jemimah works very hard to provide for them.

Jemimah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jemimah has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Jemimah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel very quickly repaid his first Kiva loan that helped him to pay for his son’s tuition fee and he already has a new idea and need of financial support. With his family Samvel lives in Sevan city of Gergharkunik region. Samvel worked for many years as an aquatic sports coach, and then he also worked as a physical education teacher at a school.

Now he is a farmer and in his farm he has cows, calves, and a lot of chickens and on his plot of land he cultivates potato and wholesale sells it to re-sellers right from his farm. Samvel also sells his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and egg to his regular customers. Samvel’s wife greatly helps him in their farm works and on this way they earn on their living and also daily have fresh products for their children.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Samvel asks for the purchase of two more calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of two more calves for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with two  children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two  years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Yeyeri

texts.en:
Yeyeri is requesting a loan to purchase general merchandise to sell ahead of the Christmas season, such as sugar, rice, soap, and other items. She is a developing, young woman, married, with one child.

Yeyeri has a retail shop and a motorcycle for transportation purposes. She usually complains of bad roads and debtors which affect her expected profits. She has a vision of trading in wholesale, owning many motorcycles in the future, and having a healthy family.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise to sell, such as sugar, rice, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 27-year-old married woman of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, she started twelve years ago selling cosmetics and perfumes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.As she also works in the cleaning field as a second source of income. 
Today, Fatima is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with more requested cosmetics and perfumes for upcoming Christmas season.
Fatima hopes to open her own cosmetics shop which will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with more requested cosmetics and perfumes for upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia continúa con su negocio de venta ambulante de medias, guantes y calzoncillos. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar mercadería variada para su negocio, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajó con normalidad. Actualmente sus hijos continúan estudiando, la salud de su bebé mejoró y la familia sigue unida, en cuanto a su negocio, este mejoró en la variedad y cantidad de prendas, cuenta con más tallas y modelos diferentes, en cuanto a las ventas estas se volvieron permanentes, los clientes son constantes y su negocio funciona todo el tiempo, “aumenté modelos de ropa y calcetines, combinándolos con colores y materiales de algodón…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque vende prendas de buena calidad apreciada por los clientes. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con nuevos clientes y mejor número de ventas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la reposición de nuevas prendas. Su sueño es tener una tienda en su domicilio, ella desea comprar ropa interior masculina de algodón para estoquear su negocio para las fiestas de fin de año.  Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior masculina de algodón para estoquear su negocio para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Silvia continues her business as a street vendor selling socks, gloves, and underwear. She used the loan that she got to buy merchandise for her business. She paid the bills punctually because she had regular work. Currently, her children continue studying, her baby's health has improved, and her family remains united.

With respect to her business, it has improved in terms of the variety and quantity of garments. She has more sizes and different models. As for sales, they have become consistent. She has continuous customers and her business is always going. "I expanded the models of clothes and socks, combining them with colors and cotton materials..." she comments. Her business is successful because she sells high-quality garments that the customers value. The advantage of her business is that she has new customers and a greater number of sales. The downside is that she doesn't have money to bring in new garments.

Her dream is to have a store in her residence. She wants to buy cotton undergarments for men in order to stock her business for the year-end holidays. This is the second sequence of loans that she has had with the institution in the 3 years that she has been in this line of work. It is for these reasons that Silvia is requesting a loan to buy cotton underwear for men in order to stock her business for the year-end holidays.

loans.use: to buy cotton underwear for men in order to stock her business for the year-end holidays.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 38 years old, and she is supporting five children in her family.

She has a beauty salon, a business she has been doing for the past 16 years.  She gets a monthly income of Kes 25,000.


She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, that she will use to purchase more stocks of salon products and hair processing equipment, such as a blow drier and hairdryer.


She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of salon products and hair processing equipment.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 42-year-old woman, supporting six people in her family.

Jackline sells cereals in her local center, a business she has been doing for the last 25 years and she gets a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more sacks of beans, dried maize, peas, and lentils to sell.

She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of beans, dried maize, peas, and lentils to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace has been a dedicated member of CCT for eleven years now. She availed already several loans and she never failed to pay it on time. Her meat stall, variety store and buy and sell items are helping her provide for their daily needs. She wants to prosper through these businesses and she automatically grabs every opportunity that comes along her way.

This time, she is asking again for your support to be able to raise the necessary amount which she needs to buy more supplies of meat products, additional merchandise and groceries for her store. A PhP 30,000 worth of loan assistance will definitely increase her inventory, which means a bigger return on her investments.

Mary Grace wants to build additional stores within the community. She dreams to be able to buy her own car which they can use for personal and business purposes. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional supplies and meat products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married, with four children, all in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been raising livestock for five years now, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 35 years old and she is a pedagogue with higher education and already with 10 years of work experience in this field. She works at the school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. Anna also gives paid private courses of this subject on this way preparing a group of pupils for their entrance exams. Anna is very good specialist and she uses all her knowledge and pedagogical methods to teach her pupils and helps them to avoid mistakes or corrects all of it in a way that they never repeat it again.

In Sevan city of Gegharkunik region Anna lives with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband is very famous and respected architect in the region. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Anna asks for the purchase of computer, accessories for it and also she must buy a new very important dictionary; these tools are very important both for her self-development works and for her private courses as well.

loans.use: purchase a computer, accessories for it and also she must buy a new very important dictionary for her private courses also.

loans.name: Konta Line Group

texts.en:
This is thirty-five years old Ramatu, who is married with three children. Ramatu belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other and achieve their individual dreams.

Konta Line is the name of Ramatu’s solidarity group. Konta Line Group needs a total loan of 6,250,000 SLL. Ramatu will receive 1, 250,000 SLL which she needs in order to purchase more 10 crates of soft drinks and 100 bundles of pure water for her business. In the group photo, Ramatu is in the middle.

Ramatu established her drinks and pure water business five years ago. She established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Ramatu uses profit from this business to provide the livelihood of her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week, from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Ramatu is a hardworking woman.

In the future, Ramatu plans to support her children in acquiring university-level education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 10 crates of soft drinks and 100 bundles of pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional slippers for her business.

loans.name: Veronica Magdalena

texts.es:
Verónica necesita de un financiamiento para mejorar el inventario de su negocio y así seguir progresando con su familia, comprara madera, barniz, pinzas, cierra, etc., para fabricar los cuadros con fotografías  cubiertas con resina que sus clientes solicitan, tiene la fe que las demandas de su servicio se mantendrán.
Con el préstamo anterior ha tenido mayor diversidad de productos para atender a sus clientes y tener ingresos de subsistencia disponibles, ella ha cambiado de domicilio, hoy en día vive en una zona más céntrica en la ciudad, por lo que se siente optimista en que su negocio crecerá aún más.
texts.en:
Verónica needs a loan to improve the inventory for her business and continue helping her family. She will buy wood, varnish, pliers, a hand saw, etc. to make framed photographs covered in resin that her clients ask for. She has faith that her service will stay in demand.

With the previous loan, she had more product diversity for her clients which gave her more income. She has moved and now lives in a more centralized part of town, so she feels optimistic that her business will grow even more.

loans.use: buy wood, varnish, pliers, a hand saw, etc. to make framed photographs covered in resin that her clients ask for.

loans.name: Talented Group

texts.en:
Who knew that Alice would one day start her own business and start selling building materials; she was just a shopkeeper whose smile and cheerfulness made her liked by everyone. Alice believes that, “If you are not willing to learn, no one can help you. If you are determined to learn, no one can stop you!” Alice learned well and in no time, she believed in herself to be able to start her own business. Although venturing alone has been very difficult, as the days rolled into months, it was a blessing in disguise for Alice who took the chance of time to specialise in what she knew best.

Alice is 27 years old, seated right in the photo, sells building materials in Manyame Park. Her business is extra special because there are very few women in her line of work. This makes her even more motivated to prove that women are as good, or even better. Her business is strategically positioned in a new resettlement area where the majority of the people are building new houses. Alice is a member of Talented group, a combination of very close friends who are driven to succeed. She has two small children, one in primary and another one not yet going to school.

Being that hardworking young mother, she has naturally become the pillar of the group; she is always motivating and supportive to her other members. Alice wants a loan from Thrive to buy door frames, window frames, metal doors and other building materials so that she may sell to her clients. Alice and her group members expressed much appreciation to the best training which they received at Thrive microfinance, they will be very happy to tell others about the good learning they received.

loans.use: to buy door frames, window frames, metal doors and other building materials.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 27 years old and the mother of two children, coming from a minority community. Her husband (in the picture is Sabina with her husband) works in construction, but earns a very low salary, so they supplement his income by working in agriculture, planting wheat and different vegetables to use and sell.

They are very happy that they have the land and the opportunity to earn additional income in this way, to improve life for their family, and be able to provide enough for their needs.

At this time, Sabina is requesting a loan in order to purchase a motor cultivator to work the land and to avoid having to pay others for the work. This will reduce the costs associated with their work and, thereby, further increase their income.

Sabina is very happy for this opportunity and, knowing it's a Kiva loan, she appreciates all of the lenders and promises to pay on-time.

loans.use: to purchase a motor cultivator to work the land and to avoid having to pay others for the work.

loans.name: Al Najah Group

texts.en:
Farja is the featured borrower for Al Najah Group. She joined her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Farja is a 47-year-old widowed Syrian mother of four children. Five years ago, she started raising cattle to cover the needs and expenses of her children as their only breadwinner. She is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

In the photo, Farja is the second lady on the right. With respect to the other group members, Zeeba is the first on the right, Mariam is the second on the left, and Fatima is the first on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Four years ago, and after being through difficult circumstances, she opened in her house a small room for vending make up. She is a skilled worker always pleasing her customers. And now, she states that she requires having more make up tools and equipment which she will acquire by the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. she is eager to receive those funds hoping that it will help her improve her business as well as her way of living.

loans.use: she requires having more make up tools and equipment.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: Shuhrat from the district of Shahrituz, is a hard-working and peace-loving person. He is 36 years old. He is married and has five children. He raises animals for a living, and breeds cattle. Shuhrat has raised livestock since his youth. Also he engages in horticulture. These works are the primary source of income for him and his family. Shuhrat wants to increase the number of his livestock. He has some capital, but it is not enough. He hopes that he will be able to find help, and then he will be able to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is 30 years old, married to James and blessed with two children aged 13 and six years old. She has been in the clothing business for eleven years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more clothing materials for resale in the shop as she anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, married to John, and blessed with three children between the ages of 13 and 2 years old.

She has been in the used clothes business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,000. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she intends to use it to buy used clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business. She dreams of becoming the best enterpreneur in the town.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 54-year-old lady supporting three people in her family.

She has a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last 20 years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy sugar, bar soap, and cooking oils.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bar soap, and cooking oils.

loans.name: Hill Cut Sisters Group

texts.en:
This is Mary, who is 24 years old and married, with one child.  

Mary belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other in achieving their individual dreams.  “Hill Cut Sisters” is the name of Mary’s solidarity group. 

“Hill Cut Sisters” group needs a total loan of SLL 5,000,000.  Mary will receive SLL 1,000,000, which she needs in order to purchase five more cartons of raw fish for her business. (Mary is in the middle of the group photo.).

Mary established her raw fish business 15 years ago to ensure her family enough money for their basic needs.   She uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her child’s education.  

She opens her business from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Saturday every week.  Mary is a hardworking woman.

In the future, Mary plans to support her child to acquire a university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  

She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase five more cartons of raw fish for her business

loans.name: Gee

texts.en:
Gee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gee is 42 years old and her children are all in school.

Gee has a bakery business in the Philippines. Gee requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, butter, and more for her bread production business.

Gee has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gee would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, and butter for her bread production business.

loans.name: Ma. Gigi

texts.en:
Ma. Gigi is 48 years old and married with three children. Ma. Gigi works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gigi runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, noodles, coffee, toothpaste, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Ma. Gigi has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, noodles, coffee, toothpaste, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft-drinks, etc. 

Ma. Gigi would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, noodles, coffee, toothpaste, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert from Sevan city of Gegharkunik region works at the police station and takes care of his large family. He is married and he lives with his wife, two sons, a daughter and his retired mother. Robert is the only bread winner in his family.
