He works a lot and in addition after his work he also does repairing works in his house. Robert mentions that he works slowly but he does all the work accurately and with good quality and he also manages to save money since he hires no constructors for his house repairing. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Robert asks as he has some half-done works in his house and since having little money he is not able to end it; so with this loan he will finally end the repairing of his house.

loans.use: with this loan he will finally end the repairing of his house as he has some half-done works in his house

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is 25 years old and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Satenik is married and she lives with her husband, small son and her father-in-law. Satenik has higher education of economist and now she managed to find a job of her specialty. Satenik’s husband is also employed and he works at the private company. This loan for Satenik and her family is very important one since her husband has some health problems and the financial state of the family does not allow him to get read of that problem. This loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams Satenik asks for the solution of her husband’s health problem particularly he must pass medical exam at the hospital.

loans.use: for the solution of her husband’s health problem particularly he must pass medical exam at the hospital

loans.name: Goal Getters Group

texts.en:
A healthy man is a happy man, after realising that man ought to eat to live she started her fruit stall business, she goes as far as Honde Valley which is about 250+ kilometres away from her place of operation i.e. Mbare in Harare to find the very best quality fruit and veg.
Beauty is a 49-year-old and is a mother of five; she has been in the business of wholesaling fruits for about 5 years now. Her Husband is unemployed and sometimes he assists her in this business. 
After realising that her reliance upon loan sharks was destroying her business since they would collect their instalments daily and all her profits were being drained she thought of coming to Thrive Microfinance. She and her fellow members received financial literacy training that improved their level of business management. Despite being looked down upon in their community, these women formed a group called Goal Getters which reflects their zeal and focus. Together they know they can make it.
They would like a sum of $1300 to reach their goals and Beauty will use her portion of the loan to travel to Honde valley to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can sell back in Harare.

loans.use: to travel to Honde valley to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can sell back in Harare.

loans.name: Lucianah

texts.en:
Lucianah is a single mother, and she has been blessed with four school-going children. She owns a house, but it has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a  farming business, selling at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 32 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 12. In 1998, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan Business and Professional Women, and wants to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Pramila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luis Evaristo

texts.es:
Luis Evaristo con 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de ladrillo de tipo artesanal,pandereta y de techo, el cuál lo transporta en su misma motocargarguera, con una experiencia en el rubro desde casi 01 año. Adicionalmente en sus ratos libres presta servicio de mototaxi. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de más ladrillo para su negocio. de esta manera le facilitará aumentar sus ingresos.

El cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luis Evaristo is 33 years old and lives with his partner. He lives in a family house along with his spouse and his child. They live in the Cayaltí district, which is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from the people who live in the area. The inhabitants of this area mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He makes a living by selling artisanal bricks, both hollow bricks and for roofing. He transports them in his own motorcycle that has an attached trailer. He has almost 1 year of experience in this field. Additionally, in his free time he provides a motorcycle taxi service.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying more bricks for his business. This will help him increase his income. He has credit experience and is a recurring partner of Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to invest in buying more bricks for his business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 50 years old. She is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan Business and Professional Women, and she wants to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peer, who is in his early 50's, is married with four children in school.  He has a shop in a school.  He works from  8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Peter's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his shop's inventory.  He has managed to pay back all his loans successful. 

He is happy with those loans.  He used the profit to pay school fees for his children, to repay loans, pay rent, reinvest in business, and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his school shop's stock for children's requirements.  He dreams of building his own house.

Peter will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his shop's stock for children's requirements.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman, 55 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Amalia has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like eggplants, cabbages, beans, carrots, potatoes, and other spices to sell at her store.

Amalia has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like eggplants, cabbages, beans, carrots, potatoes, and other spices to sell at her store.
